39126966.review:
Nice remake, but with its own drawbacks. I won't discuss the game itself – just read the other reviews which praise story and atmosphere. I agree with them. But for those who have played the original Downfall and wonder wether it's worth to pay 10 Euros for the same game again, I'ld recommand to get it on sale. The developer has put lots of effort into this project, like in a new and a bit more comfortable interface, full voices overs and new arts and animation. But all of these aspects have their downsides as well:
- The interface (which is similar to TCL) is still a bit clumsy: Why can I access via ESC but not resume with the same button? Why is there a quick-save and a quick-load button, but the quick-saves where put to F1–F4 while quick-load starts on F5 (which is quite the opposite to most other games utilizing the F-Buttons for quick-saving)? Why do I have to press ESC multiple times and skip lots of stuff to go to a clumsy "load" menu when I want to continue the game – I'ld loved to see a easy accesseable "Continue" option here. (Additionally, the new interface makes the puzzles a lot easier, even easier than TCL. You can finish this game in less then 5 hours without checking a walkthrough. But not automatically something bad, it's just different.)
- The voice-overs are well done for the most part. But in the intro they suck. And in the end you'll meet a character from TCL, and while I was fine with this character's voice-over in TCL for the most part, it became odd and annoying here. It's like they took the bad voice-over situations from TCL and to create the cameo from it. Which is sad, it's a character I did empathize with in TCL.
- The new art is fine – it's different from the original, but definitely not worse and interesting to compare. But the new animations are plainly awkward. They are more fluent then in the original game and even than TCL. But the people's walking resemble moon-walking Donald Ducks. I got used to it, but it was quite repelling in the beginning.

That said, it's not a bad game at all, and the remake offers some pros for people who know the original game, too: dialogs were changed, parts of the story were changend as well and intertwined with TCL, the narration and some puzzles were changed. So if you're interested in the whole TCL-universe, this game will offer some new insights and new(-ly created) connections.

Fully recommanded for everybody who hasn't played the original game and for die-hard TCL-fans. For everybody else: Wait until it's on sale.

38912255.review:
To nie gra. To dzieło sztuki. 

Długo nie wiedziałam, jak zabrać się za tę recenzję. 
Uwielbiam gry od studia Harvester Games, a "Downfall" to tytuł mi bardzo bliski, szczególnie że porusza bardzo osobiste dla mnie tematy. 
Za każdym razem, gdy wracam do tej historii, czuję się, jakbym przeżywała ją pierwszy raz. To samo napięcie, te same emocje, poruszenie, gęsia skórka. 
Cudownie przedstawiony motyw choroby i upadku człowieka. I choć oprawa graficzna jest szara i przygnębiająca, a ponure pokoje co jakiś czas ozdabia rozchlapana krew, to dzieło Remigiusza Michalskiego potrafi wzruszyć i pokazać, jak silna może być prawdziwa miłość. 
Wszystkim, którzy myślą, że to kolejny zwykły horror z krwawymi scenami - nie, to przede wszystkim opowieść o pogłębiającym się szaleństwie i zatraceniu siebie, ale też silnej relacji międzyludzkiej, poświęceniu i pokonywaniu wszelkich granic, byleby tylko uratować najbliższą osobę. 
A nieszczęście, jakie dotknęło Ivy... dawno nie widziałam tak niesamowitego przedstawienia tego typu chorób. 
Bohaterowie mają coś w sobie. Na tyle, że za pierwszym podejściem poczułam, jakby gra opowiadała momentami moją własną historię. Wrażenie nie znikło, nawet po kilkukrotnym ukończeniu tytułu. Coś takiego zdarzało mi się bardzo rzadko (a grałam w grubo ponad 100 produkcji). 

"Downfall" warto przejść kilka razy, poznać wszystkie zakończenia i różne wersje dialogów, ponieważ to pozwala jeszcze bardziej docenić przedstawioną tam historię. Przy odpowiednio dojrzałym podejściu nawet "złe zakończenie" może przekazać coś wyjątkowego. Dużym plusem jest to, że po poznaniu każdej możliwej ścieżki dialogowej tytuł wciąż działa na wyobraźnię, część wątków zostaje tajemnicą, a wiele faktów musimy połączyć już według własnych poglądów. 

Pojawia się jeszcze pytanie, od czego warto zaczynać: "Downfall" czy "The Cat Lady"? Osobiście polecałabym rozpocząć od tego pierwszego. Brak znajomości drugiego tytułu nie utrudnia wczucia się w fabułę, a nawet pozwala podejść do historii na świeżo, nie sugerując się losami Susan Ashworth. Zagranie w "The Cat Lady" już po poznaniu "Upadku" sprawia, że momentami uśmiechniemy się, wreszcie rozumiejąc pewne smaczki i nawiązania, a gdy przyjdzie czas na wątek Joego Davisa - odczujemy to znaczcie mocniej, wiedząc już, co siedziało w głowie tajemniczego sąsiada Susan.

38687185.review:
Antes de tudo, o fato de não recomendar esse jogo não significa que ele seja ruim, significa apenas que não fez meu gosto. E ainda, eu esperava que a Steam tivesse uma forma de classificação mais aberta ao invés de "Sim ou Não", algo que fosse mais pessoal, o que pra mim se encaixaria perfeitamente nesse modelo de análise.

---

Eu gosto bastante de suspense e terror psicológico. [spoiler]Fazia parte do time que defendia Silent Hill das garras dos fãs de Resident Evil quando existia rivalidade entre as franquias, mesmo sendo jogos bem diferentes (até a Konami destruir SH e acabar com a alegria da galera).[/spoiler] Afinal, quando se trata da mente humana, existe um abismo imenso e escuro de possibilidades, e embora há muito se estude o comportamento das pessoas e muitas nomenclaturas tenham sido criadas, é impossível prever os atos e os pensamentos de alguém. Trabalhamos em diferentes sintonias e recebemos mensagens externas de maneiras diferentes, e esse jogo trata justamente disso.

Não acho justo "não recomendar" esse jogo (e por isso minha reclamação no início) pois percebo que a pessoa que o escreveu soube tratar os assuntos de forma séria. Os elementos usados para representar as angústias dos personagens, ora de forma abstrata, ora bem visceral, são muito bem colocados e raramente parecem "aleatórios". A construção do cenário, a arte e o modo como ela se modifica no decorrer da história é muito bem feito. A visão mostrada carrega muita expressão sobre os temas abordados, algo que parece ser o calcanhar de Aquiles de vários jogos do gênero, que utilizam sangue e violência apenas com o intuito de "chocar" (numa indústria onde boa parte dos jogos são "violentos").

Porém, o jogo peca ao fazer a conexão desses elementos na trama. As ideias são boas, mas o desenvolvimento, para mim, foi bastante simplório. Talvez pelo fato do jogo ser curto, não consegui me conectar com quase nenhum personagem. Seus dramas foram muito bem colocados, mas faltou "liga" pra que a história como um todo funcionasse. São bons pequenos momentos numa narrativa que não me prendeu. Várias situações são clichês de filmes de suspense, e se você já jogou Silent Hill 2, vai notar semelhanças absurdas entre os dois jogos, o que evidencia ainda mais o potencial que a história tinha com as ferramentas possuídas, se apenas tivesse uma melhor fluidez.

Deixei várias coisas vagas de propósito para não comprometer a experiência de quem pretende jogar, pois acredito que muita gente possa gostar, mas, resumidamente, eu esperava mais. E só pra deixar gravado (embora isso não tenha influenciado na análise), o voice-acting desse jogo é terrível, assim como as legendas em PT-BR. Selo Joel Santana de qualidade.

38684856.review:
Engraçado pensar que mesmo amando muito outra pessoa chagando até a viver com ela você não pode entender ela completamente, no final do dia é como se cada um fosse pra uma ilha isolada e solitária, isso é uma das muitas coisas que Downfall me fez pensar.

A [b]história[/b] traz Joe e Ivy Davis, um casal que se "destino" existisse eles teriam sido feitos um para o outro, mas que depois de 10 anos juntos passam por momentos difíceis, então Joe na esperança de concertar as coisas decide levar Ivy a um refúgio amoroso, no caso o hotel Quiet Haven, pouco depois de chegar nele, Ivy tem um ataque de pânico, o que faz um tempo depois eles entrarem numa discussão feia em seu quarto, no outro dia Ivy some, e Joe começa a procura-la em meio ao pesadelo.
Em muitas partes a história é interpretativa, algumas coisas são até obvias, outras você tem que juntar alguns detalhes para no final entender e ainda tem algumas que ficam em aberto, mas que no final continua incrível do mesmo jeito além de ser pesada e obscura quase o tempo inteiro.
 
A linda [b]arte[/b] desse jogo [spoiler] linda mesmo[/spoiler] é um mar de preto, branco, tons de cinza e com algumas cores sendo quase sempre vermelho aparecendo de vez em quando, é na mesma linha de The Cat Lady, mas usando até menos cores, o que dá uma sensação muito boa em ambos os jogos sempre que alguma cor aparece, despertando certa curiosidade. Outra é que as cenas são bem grotescas até mais que em The Cat Lady.

Sobre a [b]trilha sonora[/b] não tem muito o que falar só que ela combina muito, acompanhando sempre o clima do jogo, ficando mais pesada ou as vezes até sumindo dando uma sensação [spoiler]ilusória[/spoiler] de calma.

Uma coisa interessante, é que esse Downfall na Steam é um "remake" da versão original de 2009, e ela está contida nessa versão do game, mas apenas em inglês ;-; 

[b]Algumas coisas negativas:[/b] 
A tradução, o jogo está todo legendado, porem a tradução é meio bugada e tem certos erros, mas não é algo que atrapalhe no final das contas. 
Os puzzles são bem fáceis, o que não significa que são ruins, mas fáceis, ele também é mais curto que The Cat Lady, o jogo tem em torno de 6 ou 7 horas.

Também recomendo que The Cat Lady seja jogado [b]antes[/b], pois ambos os jogos têm partes da história que se ligam, e Downfall dá um spoiler maiorzinho de The Cat Lady.

Enfim é um jogo com uma história surpreendente em vários pontos, entrei nele esperando bastante coisa e ele conseguiu superar as expectativas altas que eu tinha, pessoalmente gostei um pouquinho mais desse do que TCL, vou de encontro com a Ivy em certos aspectos, mas os dois jogos são [b]obras primas[/b].

38477066.review:
(SPOILER FREE c: )
I've been intrigued by the remake since I finished playing The Cat Lady last year. I didn't go into TCL blind, as I watched someone else play it years back. Even though I knew how it was going to play out, I was invested enough to buy it for myself and play it through. Playing it for myself gave the experience a much deeper ambiance and meaning. However, for Downfall, I purposefully went in blind. I didn't even research the original, all I knew was that it showcased the most fascinating and mysterious character from TCL- Joe Davis. So naturally, my expectations were that it would be good, although I didn't expect it to be better than TCL.

And I was wrong. It wasn't good: it was perfect. The introduction alone invokes so much fear, despair and intrigue that it hooked me in instantly. The style is not only an improvement over TCL, but it also gives the audience a way to perceive the world around Joe through his eyes without saying a word. Not only do the visuals do an outstanding job of conjuring a spiral of emotions, but the soundtrack also gives way into the player's psyche. These elements alone are enough to entice the player into playing more, and what awaits them is a masterpiece of interactive contemporary lore. The point and click gameplay combined with the story gives the player a feeling of human limitation in an inhumane world. Choices matter, people are desperate for action, and the only one who can make those difficult decisions is you.

For aspiring story-driven game creators, this serves as an excellent example of how to make the audience invested and determined to see the adventure to completion. I could not reccomend this game enough, nor do it justice, but I did do my best for those who are interested and have yet to experience it for themselves. Playing it gives so much more meaning than watching someone else play it, it's truly worth it. I'm looking forward to future works from Screen 7. :)

38435959.review:
After playing The Cat Lady and finding it to be one of the best narrative driven games I've played in quite a while, it made sense to find more games like it. Looking into Harvester games, I was both disappointed that there was only one other game, but excited at the promise of more of to sink my teeth into. Downfall did not disappoint.

If someone asked me to describe what Downfall is about, I might say that it feels like if the shining was adapted to film by David Lynch instead of Stanley Kubrick. The plot follows Joe Davis, who goes to the 'Quiet Haven Hotel' with his wife, Ivy, to fix his struggling marriage. It doesn't take long before it becomes obvious that something strange is going on and that this will not be a typical holiday for the unlucky couple. I don't want to go any further into the story because it is something that you should really experience yourself. Like The Cat Lady, it goes into mature themes throughout the plot, concerning issues such as mental health. With that being said, while Downfall is similarly dark to The Cat Lady, and neither game is conventionally realistic, Downfall is more consistently surreal. This is not necessarily a good or bad thing, but is rather a notable difference between the two.

The art style is very similar to The Cat Lady (okay, I'll try to stop comparing the two so much) and the puzzles are typical of adventure games. It is challenging enough working out the solutions, but not so hard that it becomes irritating. Even if the answer is too obscure, the solution can usually be found by wandering around and trying to interact every object with every interactable piece of scenery until the situation sorts itself out.

Overall I enjoyed my time with Downfall and highly recommend it to anyone who likes adveture games, particularly ones of a dark nature. Even now I am anticipating the next title from this studio.

Agora abordando cara parêntese



[h1] Trilha Sonora (OST)	[/h1]

Em vários momentos eu vi muito, mas muito! de Silent Hill nelas, ainda mais no piano e percussão.
Mas como eu não dei um 10, não é por causa disso, é apenas por causa das guitarras, que achei ela um tanto... desnecessárias em certas músicas, não estou dizendo que seria melhor sem elas, mas em certas músicas a guitarra ganha um destaque muito maior do que ela proporciona.

Bem, eu, antes de jogar, achava que o jogo teria uma história bem complicada

Porém, continuando a falar sobre a história em si: é necessário que o jogador fique ligado em tudo, já que tem coisas importantes na trama que não é transmitido em dialogo. 
Mas isso é uma coisa universal, atenção perante histórias e enredos nunca é demais! 
Ou seja, em conclusão final...? A história de Downfall é complexa e linear.
um tanto... controverso e contraditório, não? pois é, mas essa é a melhor definição, eu te garanto.

37819686.review:
I haven't played the original, so my experience is solely with this version. I will get a few things out of the way: the voice acting, plot, Cat Lady. 

1. Voice Acting: In the prologue, the voices are awful. In the main plot, the protagonist is almost always awful. There is a big difference in microphone quality between characters, which is sometimes quite distracting. It was so offputting, I almost stopped the game. As the game went on however, I found that I enjoyed everyone else's voice acting, which was a blessing.

2. Plot: I do feel the story borrows maybe a bit too heavily from Silent Hill 2, stepping beyond mere homage. Your protagonist's background feels sort of overdone, given the central narrative, and probably could have been made more subtle or taken out entirely. Sometimes it feels like a cheesey b-movie, other times it takes itself pretty seriously.

3. Cat Lady: I'd argue that you need to play Cat Lady first in order to understand what happens near the end of the game. I had actually played it before, but not recently, and found myself scratching my head at the references. It also doesn't fit in that well to the plot and - again - should probably have been taken out entirely.

YET I RECOMMEND IT. The art quality is a bit dicey, but it works with the atmosphere. Navigation, controls, inventory - I wasn't sure about any of these at first, but it's easy to pick up and I actually think it's a good system for a 2D world like this. The most important thing is that the puzzles were more fun than tedious; they were morbid, creative, helped you get into the game's sense of logic and were even humorous at times. For all its similarities to Silent Hill 2, the story turned out better than I expected and does manage to stand on its own.

TL;DR A bit messy at times, but overall quite entertaining.

37432991.review:
Если ищете развлекательный квест с зубодробительными задачками - это не тот случай. Это вообще даже не совсем игра, а погружение в сознание измученного человека. Как и в The Cat Lady, где главная героиня боролась с депрессией, личными потерями и суицидальными наклонностями, здесь поднимаются очень тяжелые темы: отношения в браке с психически неуравновешенным супругом; неприятие собственного тела; пограничные состояния, когда собственное отчаяние хочется выплеснуть в виде насилия по отношению к окружающим; возможно, множественные личности. Визуальный стиль и музыка Downfall создают атмосферу безумия и страха, при этом история практически не скатывается в пафос, а кое-где даже появляется очень уместный чёрный юмор. Героям сопереживаешь на 100%, а для любого произведения искусства это большое достижение.
Играла в Downfall именно в этой обновлённой версии, которая полностью связана с сюжетом The Cat Lady (насколько я понимаю, была старая версия, которая вышла до The Cat Lady, и там истории героев совпадали не так гладко, как в новой версии, и графика была совсем другая), причём сначала в The Cat Lady, потом в Downfall, и Downfall понравился даже больше. Хотя очередность, насколько я понимаю, не важна, т.к. события происходят параллельно.
Казалось бы, простейшее управление (влево, вправо, использовать), анимация персонажей напоминает бумажных кукол на шарнирах, а фоны по большей части - это изобретательные коллажи из фотографий, текстур и компьютерной графики; далеко не самые сложные квестовые задачки - и при этом игра стала одной из самых любимых. 
Вот что значит СДЕЛАНО С УМОМ И ЛЮБОВЬЮ)) Всем любителям психологических хорроров - однозначно рекомендую, 10/10
P.S. Из похожего могу посоветовать Detention, тоже очень печальный и мрачный сюжет и психоделичная атмосфера.

37298055.review: one of the most uber cool, crazy,psychotic games ive ever played

36905548.review:
[code][h1]Pros[/h1]
- História fantástica. 
- Ambientação muito boa, horror psicológico de qualidade. 
- Graficamente muito bonito, com desenhos muito bem feitos e uma escolha artística muito bem acertada. 
- Trilha Sonora muito boa e muito bem colocada no jogo. 

[h1]Contras[/h1]
- Puzzles muito fáceis. 
- Sem suporte a 16:9.

[h1]Duração: Entre 5 ou 6 horas. [/h1]

[h1]Preço: R$ 25,99
Maior Desconto: R$ 8.83 [/h1] 
[/code]

The Cat Lady foi uma surpresa extremamente agradável para mim, antes de começar a jogar Downfall, eu pesquisei um pouco sobre a desenvolvedora e o seu criador, descobrindo então que Downfall, esse que está na steam, é um Remake do original que foi lançado em 2009 como o primeiro jogo de Rem Michalski. Então me veio uma dúvida, será que era para mim ter jogado Downfall primeiro? Ao terminar Downfall entrei na conclusão que não, jogar The Cat Lady primeiro é muito melhor para a sua experiência. 

Downfall conta a história de Joe Davis, que é casado com Ivy Davis há 10 anos. O relacionamento entre eles está bem conturbado, então Joe tem a ideia de passar um tempo fora em um refúgio romântico com Ivy, no Hotel Quiet Haven, para tentar reconciliar e melhorar o relacionamento. Coisas dão errado e Ivy desaparece, joe então vai a procura de sua amada nesse local bizarro onde revelações serão descobertas. 

A história de Downfall é muito boa como em The Cat Lady, é bizarro e com um horror psicológico muito bem aplicado. Há mensagens bem importantes no enredo , como a anorexia e traumas do passado, como em The Cat Lady foi a depressão e a loucura, que de certa forma também está em Downfall.
Muito do enredo, novamente, como em The Cat Lady, é interpretativo, há respostas plausíveis, só que não são jogados na tua cara, umas talvez sim, a maioria não. Também Há algo sobrenatural em cima de tudo que é plausível (ou não), como em the Cat Lady. Esperamos que respostas sejam dadas no próximo jogo que vai sair no Halloween de 2018. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1184111620

 É muito difícil escolher qual é o melhor, The Cat Lady ou Downfall, confesso que simpatizei muito mais com a Susan e com a simpática Mitzi do The Cat Lady, mas Joe e Ivy também são personagens muito bem construídos e profundos, algo bem difícil de ver sendo aplicado acertadamente nos jogos hoje em dia. 

Um detalhe muito importante, ao abrir o jogo,você escolherá o idioma e então vai haver uma introdução jogável, não pule! Vai ter uns diálogos e depois uma parte jogável com Joe e Ivi criança, é muito importante essa introdução. 

Graficamente Downfall é Muito bonito, até mais do que the Cat Lady, o ênfase  no vermelho e em outras cores por cima do preto e branco ainda estão aqui, e está muito bem aplicado. Uma novidade que foi colocado são algumas partes em 3d, como quando você desce uma escada ou na introdução fazendo uma tour na frente do hotel, são partes específicas em cutscene, mas que ficou bem legal. 

A Trilha Sonora continua muito boa e muito bem colocada, apesar que no conjunto da obra, eu gostei mais da trilha sonora do The Cat Lady. O Destaque para ost [b]Boogeyman[/b] do [b]Black Casino and the Ghost[/b], e como já virou costume, Warmer e Tears of Mars também está no jogo, e outras instrumentais fantásticas.

A dublagem é amadora, você ouve isso nitidamente, mas não dá para falar que é ruim, na verdade dá um certo ar de realismo, isso é engraçado e estranho. Algo que nunca tinha parado para pensar, em Silent Hill 2, os dublados também eram amadores e ficou marcado, foi (é!) fantástico, e quando teve a remasterização e a polêmica da troca de dubladores para a nova versão, ficou estranho e ruim, vai de caso para caso, aqui, em Downfall, a dublagem é muito boa. 

O Gameplay continua sendo a mesma base do the Cat Lady, simples e objetivo,sem complicações, é um Adventure de terror onde se usa as setas do teclado e o enter apenas, com foco totalmente na história. Eu achei os puzzles de Downfall bem mais fáceis e simples do que no The Cat Lady, que teve puzzles muito bem feitos, esse talvez foi minha única decepção com o jogo. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1185495974

Algo bem ruim no jogo é a falta de suporte do 16:9. A resolução usada no jogo é de 800x600, tem como colocar filtros e antialiasing pelo laucher, mas ao fazer isso a tela do jogo encurtava e ficavam bordas pretas, preferi deixar o 800x600 mesmo e sem a bordas pretas, não é algo que deixe o jogo feio, mas é algo que muitas pessoas não vão gostar, no The Cat Lady eu tinha conseguido colocar filtros e deixar sem as bordas, no Downfall não. No próximo jogo esse problema será resolvido, até porque agora será feito com a unity, com suporte a Fullhd e 16:9.

Downfall é mais curto do que the Cat Lady, umas 6 ou 5 horas para zera-lo. O jogo não é difícil, fiquei preso em uma parte apenas, onde a solução não foi demorado para ser encontrado. 

O jogo contém 3 finais diferentes, finais muito bons e com uma surpresa enorme, algo que eu realmente não esperava. Para fazer os finais depende de certos diálogos, teoricamente você tem 27 , vamos dizer “Tendências”, dependendo do diálogo, você perde 1 tendência, o final B você tem que terminar o jogo com as 27 tendências, o final C você não pode ter nenhuma tendência, o final A é o mais tradicional e o que você provavelmente vai fazer na primeira jogatina, se faltar 1 ou mais “tendência”, que não seja todas, vai aparecer esse final. Meio complicado, não é explicado no jogo, ao zerar você verá a quantidade de “Tendências” que você terminou tendo. 

Você percebeu que as comparações com the Cat Lady foi feito várias vezes, que é bem normal, já que é o jogo antecessor da desenvolvedora. Eu recomendo jogar The Cat Lady primeiro, é o mesmo mundo, Joe e Ivi faz uma aparição em The Cat Lady e o desenvolvedor e criador disse que The Cat Lady se passa um pouco antes de Downfall, outro motivo é para você não pegar certos Spoilers do The Cat Lady, e algumas coisas você só vai entender ao joga-lo primeiro, vai ser uma experiência muito melhor para você, ao meu ver. 

Joguei The Cat Lady esperando nada, terminei ele como uma surpresa enorme e despertando minha atenção para essa desenvolvedora e também para jogos de estilo adventures com uma pegada parecida. Downfall saciou-me e melhor, me deixou com mais fome de tudo que esperava dele, agora teorizando na minha cabeça todo o enredo desse mundo criado por Rem. Downfall e The Cat Lady são um dos poucos que consegue colocar o horror psicológico tão bem e combinar com uma trilha sonora ótima, algo que Silent Hill foi um dos pioneiros e mais acertou nesses pontos, e downfall tem muito da obra prima, Silent Hill 2. Apenas jogue e caia de cabeça nesse mundo preto, branco e vermelho da Harvester Games, você não vai ser arrepender.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1178248056

36461339.review:
I absolutely love anything created by Harvester Games. True, it's not your average horror game, but I love a horror series that's based on a solid plot.
You love and sympathize with the characters, really think outside the box, and of course the creepy aethetics and monochromatic colors add to it. Not to mention a killer soundtrack.

[spoiler] This is another thing I love about Harvester is how they handle the concept of mental illness. Too many games out there try to exploit mental illness or "crazies" for a shock factor, and I love love LOVE that Harvester shows that the real horror behind mental illness is the illness itself and the suffering the person goes through it. (Such as Ivy having an eating disorder and showing how horrifying it is living with it on a daily basis.) I also love how they show with Joe's perspective and depending how you play him, how loved ones struggle with it too.) Nothing's scarier than what's already real. [/spoiler]

Overall I highly recommend.

36327112.review:
[quote=author]Bir gün oyun dünyasının Stephen King'i olacağım.[/quote]

Hayır, tabii ki bunlar benim sözlerim değil, bunlar bu oyunu yapan ve aynı zamanda The Cat Lady isimli oyundan tanıdığımız yapımcı Remigiusz Michalski'nin sözleri.. Tabi ben tarzını daha çok David Lynch'e benzetiyorum o ayrı.

Nasıl anlatsam, nereden başlasam bilmiyorum, ama bu oyunun bir köşede duran ve keşfedilmeyi bekleyen bir cevher olduğunu biliyorum. Şahane bir atmosfer, tatmin edici müzikler, sıkmayan, yer yer komik diyaloglar ve evliliğini kurtarmaya çalışan bir adam. Joe Davis. Bu hikaye The Cat Lady'den tanıdığımız Susan Ashworth'un komşusunun hikayesini ele alıyor. 

Oyunda benim için en önemli şey hikayenin gidişatıyla alakalı olan 'merak unsuru'ydu. Bu oyun insanın merak unsurunu tetikliyor, hem hikayeyi öğrenmek istiyorsun, hem de oyunun ilerleyişinde karşına ne çıkacağını bilmek istiyorsun. Bu da benim için koca bir artı puan demek. İkinci bir güzel özellik ise oyun karanlık bir atmosferde geçmesine rağmen son ana kadar umutsuzluğa kapılmıyoruz. (Oyunun 3 farklı sonu var)

Oynanış The Cat Lady kadar uzun değil, bulmacaları da zor değil. 4-5 saat içinde bitiyor lakin tatmin edicilik yönünden The Cat Lady'den eksiği yok, ikisini de oynamış ve beğenmiş biri olarak gönül rahatlığıyla tavsiye ederim. Bu arada aynı yapımcının 3. oyunu 'Lorelai' nin de önümüzdeki sene çıkması planlanıyor, o da bu 2 oyunla bağlantılı, heyecanla bekliyoruz.

10/8

36214287.review:
Story genre: Mystery, Horror
Game genre: Side scrolling, adventure game, story rich, puzzles, keyboard controlled.
Similar games: The Cat Lady, Detention.

I enjoyed Downfall way more than anticipated. In fact, I completed it in a single sitting, and had a lot of fun playing it "local co-op" with a friend. It's now in my top 2 games from 2016. Like The Cat Lady, it contains fresh and interesting narrative, twists, a focused pace with good sense of progress, endearing characters, solid puzzle design, atmospheric soundtrack (tons of music as well as ambiance), just enough dark humor, and ridiculous amounts of gore.

Also like The Cat Lady, mental illness features prominently. This time it's body dysmorphia and eating disorders, and although this can be depressing along the way, that's not necessarily where it ends up. In other words, it's mature, you've been warned, and it's worth seeing through to the end.

Another thing worth mentioning (and I feel bad for name-dropping in every single paragraph), is this remake contains far more than passing references to The Cat Lady, and although it's not critical, I think it would make more sense if you'd played The Cat Lady first. Did I mention The Cat Lady is one of my favorite games ever? [spoiler]THE CAT LADY!!![/spoiler]

I guess I'm supposed to give critique to pretend like I'm a balanced journalist or something, and not just some guy on his couch. The truth is I just really liked Downfall all the way through. If I could change one thing, it would be for it to use a more modern game engine because this one inherently means relatively low resolution art and technical issues for a greater than average portion of players. This has been addressed for Lorelai (the final game in the trilogy).

De los creadores de The Cat Lady, tenemos aquí otra aventura que transcurre en el mismo tiempo que los acontecimientos del anterior mencionado. Incluso con apariciones de algunos de los personajes de éste. 

Aventura gráfica en 2D, en tercera persona, al igual que The Cat Lady. Los gráficos del juego, de nuevo, son una mezcla de fotografías, animaciones y renderizado, la única diferencia que personalmente he notado es que está mejor cuidado y tiene cierta mayor calidad.

Se me ha hecho algo más complicado y enrevesado de completar. Tiene tres finales diferentes si no me equivoco, al igual que The Cat Lady, aunque debes tener cuidado con tu forma de jugar si quieres tener uno u otro, ya que cada final que obtengas depende de un montón de conversaciones. Hay guías que ayudan y te muestran las opciones que tienes que escoger. Como iba diciendo, los 'puzles' por decirlo de alguna manera, se me han hecho un poco más complicados y de comerme un poco la cabeza, lo cual me ha encantado, en este sentido The Cat Lady era más fácil, en mi opinión.

En este juego podemos elegir entre ser buena gente, o ser un psicópata desagradable, es una de las cosas que molan, porque en el anterior título sólo podíamos ser unos 'justicieros' y exterminar a los parásitos. El protagonista es muy carismático, aunque debo decir que Susan le da mil vueltas. Te hace también meterte mucho en la historia, es lo bonito que tienen tanto éste juego como The Cat Lady, son Indies hechos con mucho cariño y empeño, controles muy sencillos y en este caso, gore, MUCHO gore.

Lo recomiendo totalmente, si te ha gustado The Cat Lady ni te lo pienses, eso sí, es un poco más corto y se nota, aunque se compensa porque necesitas pasar el juego un par de veces si quieres todos los logros.

34922152.review:
After having enjoyed The Cat Lady, which is another dark, twisted game from the same developer, I got curious to try this one and was not disappointed at all. Downfall takes place in the same universe as The Cat Lady, with some common characters and happening almost in parallel to the events of The Cat Lady. Here the story revolves around Joe and Ivy Davis, a couple who have decided to take a weekend getaway in a nice hotel to rekindle their romance and fix their marriage. Except things quickly start going south and the place appears to be full of creepy and disturbing occurrences. When Ivy goes missing, Joe decides to do whatever it takes to find and save her.

The game is full of disturbing scenes and dark themes, a lot of the time making us ponder about the morality of what we're doing and whether what we're seeing is real or just a twisted figment of the character's imagination. The atmosphere is absolutely superb and immersive, often successfully creating tension and horror, and all this without using jump scares. The visual style is really great for a game like this, where even by the mere look, something can appear to give a chill down your spine. This is of course accompanied by a great soundtrack as well and some pretty good voice acting.

Most of the gameplay consists of solving simple environmental puzzles, exploration, and making choices, particularly during dialogue scenes. So it's very story-driven and casual as far as gameplay goes and should satisfy anyone who likes interactive stories. Most puzzles are pretty logical and straight-forward (though I did have to refer to a walkthrough at one point).

Your decisions have an effect on the ending you get, and there appear to be 3 endings in total, though the very good and the very bad endings are pretty hard to achieve and might need a walkthrough at hand or consecutive playthroughs.

Definitely recommended for anyone who likes darker stories that explore serious themes. If you liked The Cat Lady, you should enjoy Downfall too, and likewise if you enjoyed this, check out The Cat Lady too. As far as I've heard, there's another game in this universe currently in the works, so I'm very much looking forward to trying that out.

34222189.review:
I absolutely adored The Cat Lady for its atmosphere, art style, game mechanics, characters, and thematic elements, and it's become one of those games that resides in my heart as a personal favorite as a result. The Cat Lady, for all its flaws, really hit me with its ability to tackle a heavy subject and twist it with dark magical realism, horror, and metaphor within a skeleton of the frightening and drudging world of mental illness. As such, I jumped on the chance to play Downfall as soon as I learned that it was from the same group.

Downfall puts you in the middle of the story as Joe, a man who's dragged his wife to some hotel in the middle of nowhere in the hopes of fixing his marriage from falling apart. Much like The Cat Lady, you are not granted the knowledge of what the characters' backstories are immediately, and it is only through your way of progressing through the game and through your dialogue choices that you both learn and craft what their pasts really are. It's not like Telltale where it claims that your choice of dialogue matters a lot, but like in the Cat Lady, it makes you forget whether you're playing the game as yourself with the main character as an avatar (and thus crafting the character's responses and thoughts as you would for yourself) or if you're playing the game as the character and trying to get them to the end of the story relatively intact. I personally find myself combining both tactics in order to play these sorts of games, and they've worked well for me so far.

There are several endings that can be acquired, quite a few secret achievements, and a story that slowly begins to take shape just as everything else becomes fuzzier and fuzzier in regards to what is reality and what is hallucination. This is a game where your choices do matter in the long run, and I played my first time with that in mind and got a bittersweet ending as a result. 

In regards to the story as a whole, it's very intriguing, dark, and chock full of those elements that made Silent Hill so good. I would not call this game a rip-off, just like I wouldn't a show like CSI a rip-off of Law and Order: The two operate on similar grounds and approach things in a similar way, but they are their own shows. The same goes for Silent Hill and The Cat Lady/Downfall: Both series make the player take the role of a character who, depending on their subsequent actions in the game, help you personally color what kind of person they are in reaction to, and in spite of, the mistakes they made that led them to experiencing the events in said game. Psychological horror, body horror, metaphors for what lurks in the minds of those haunted by themselves, a story in the past that unfolds as it does in the present, and the confrontation of real-life nightmares are what can be found in The Cat Lady/Downfall as much as Silent Hill. 

The animation is much more fluid than The Cat Lady. While in The Cat Lady the characters moved a bit like paper cutouts (which is a nice stylistic choice, I thought), in Downfall it's Flash (I believe) and the movements are fully animated. They are shaded as three-dimensional, their chests visibly rise when they breathe in their idle state, and the head bobbing that came with the dialogue of some characters in The Cat Lady is gone. Glaringly, though, dialogue still does not quite match up with the lip movements, and this is even harder to ignore because Downfall has more scenes where there are closeups of peoples' faces when speaking, whereas in Cat Lady you stood a good 15 feet away at almost all times. 

The design and art is a mixture of depressing, macabre photo realism, surreal imagery, and detailed animation. The game tries to use as limited and muted palette as possible - pretty much everything is a dour gray, black, and white except for the blood and some other accents. Agnes looks gorgeous and walks gorgeously in her wedding dress; the dilapidated areas of the hotel are well designed and reminiscent of Silent Hill 2 if they had been rendered in this art style and made by this company. The thick lines, detail, and subject matter reminds me of a combination of Archer, Adult Swim, and film noir. 

As for voice acting... I feel like it was much stronger in The Cat Lady. Voices are monotonous in Downfall, almost painfully so, except for the Queen of Maggots and Agnes. I just can't ignore the lack of *oomph* in the voices when the subtitles clearly show that emphasis is supposed to be given to certain words a la ALL CAPS. Characters maintain an even, conversational tone (perhaps slightly inflected with a tiny bit of emotion) when the choice you made, subtitles, and situation obviously calls for the volume of one's voice to be kicked up a few notches. Honestly, it's like watching someone play Guitar Hero and miss half the notes on Normal mode - Dude, just stick to easy mode if you suck that much. For all of the missed cues to get emotional, the voices for Joe and Ava are decent enough: Joe (if you play him right) seems just as depressed as his surroundings but has a very soothing, if droopy hound dog kind of voice. Agnes has enough range of emotions to her voice that it almost makes up for the fact that everyone else seems to be stuck in 1st gear when it comes to emoting. Come on guys, you're not on camera so you have to put your feelings INTO your voice, like Agnes is! 

If you loved the Cat Lady, consider this a phenomenal spiritual successor that must be played.

警告：本作极度不适合患有抑郁症等类似心理与精神疾病的玩家游玩。
pros:
    +阴郁奇诡的美术风格
    +冲击视觉的血腥场面
    +深刻的人物塑造
    +惊悚的配乐和超赞的歌曲
    +适中的谜题
    +极具吸引力的黑暗剧情
cons:
     -不可跳过的剧情对话

     对于喜爱《The Cat Lady》的玩家来说，本作不可错过。毕竟“恶魔过境”系列一脉相传。本作也绝不会让喜欢恐怖游戏的玩家失望。
     在3D恐怖游戏大行其道，以“逃亡”来制造紧张与恐惧感的今天，本作可谓是回归恐怖游戏的本真，针对心理与视觉营造出了恐怖的氛围。其实，这个系列的两部作品都算不上“恐怖”，但其独特的美术风格和阴暗的剧情会让玩家在游玩的时候感受到压抑。游戏所创造出的诡异世界让玩家感受到身临其境，而与《The Cat Lady》完全不同的绝望结局则更加深了玩家的无助 。
     在本作中，作者更为集中和隐晦地讨论了两性关系、心理疾病与精神世界。作者非常形象地表现出了患有这种心理疾病和精神疾病的切身感受。尤其是Ivy,作为一个厌食症患者，催吐、自我评价低、极度缺乏安全感，都是非常准确的表现。作者要么有类似经历，要么做了详细的调查。
     值得一提的是，本作有Susan的出场，但人设基本已经ooc。在我看来猫夫人并不喜欢杀戮，她只是希望不被伤害。
     死蛆女皇仍然是我认为两作中最富有魅力与可能性的角色。希望以Loralai为主角的下一作能够尽快到来。
     希望理清故事线的玩家可以自行百度，一个帖子非常详细地分析了全剧情。
     不可错过。9/10.

33463950.review:
I need to open the review with a disclaimer: i've never played the original Downfall, so i can't make a comparison between that and the remake. I'll just make a few points against it and The Cat Lady. 

First off, i sort of enjoyed playing the game, although i often felt like there were quite a few areas where it could have been polished or just done differently. 

The plot is a quite compelling story that's a mix between reality and hallucinations ( i would say?), it basically depicts the events before The Cat Lady, and pretty merges with it at the end. 

Visually, i haven't really liked some of the style which isnt also very consistent between different areas of the game, some scenarios involve basic 3D modeled backgrounds, while others offer much more detailed and coloured handmade artworks. The animations also kind of sucks, it's neither smooth or well done, and considering that Joe and Agnes move in the same way for like, 95% of the time, creating a couple of decent animations would have been a good idea...

Anyway, for the most part, the concept behind the scenarios and the overall game works pretty good. It lacks quite a bit of colour, especially in comparison to The Cat Lady, but it somehow still works.

Voice acting: aside of the overall incosistencies on the audio volume between different characters (some are too loud, some can barely be heard), i don't like Joe Davis's voice a lot, but considering that he's the same guy from The Cat Lady i guess that must be the way it has to be done...i actually liked more some of the minor char' voices, like the dead ones, or some female char ones. Even Agnes's voice isn't bad. Ivy's voice is a tad too muffled maybe. 

Soundtrack wise, you do get to listen to some melodies, almost none of the pieces from the soundtrack is sung, and especially there is no recognizable voice over all of the tracks (which is sort of what worked quite well in The Cat Lady). Definately a bit of a shame, even if the soundtrack isn't really bad on its own anyway. It just doesn't make a lot to underline some particular events or some actions you happen to execute (aside of the killing).

About the interface...nothing has changed since The Cat Lady, apparently. 

I would score this game at about 7.5 - i recommend it, although not to everyone as i would with The Cat Lady.

Главный герой Джо Дэвис вместе со своей женой Айви страдающей психическими нарушениями, в  частности анорексией, приезжают в гостиницу «Тихая Гавань». С самого начала все идет не по плану. Айви психует и ложится спать. На утро Айви исчезает, а гостиница превращается в настоящий ад. Сумасшедший доктор пытающийся воскресить труп молодой девушки, маньяк с топором не раз сможет пощеголять вам нервы, управляющая, которая что-то от вас скрывает и т.п. Все сделано в черно-белых тонах и есть пару цветных локаций. Есть юмор, даже немного черный. Мясо, кровь и психологическое давление имеется. Очень красивая музыка играет на фоне. Спасибо большое Ben And Alfie, Micamic, Iamqqqqqqq и Myuu за прекрасную музыку. Также есть отсылка к The Cat Lady во время игры на пианино (кому интересно могу кинуть ноты) и не только. [spoiler]Также мы сможем также поиграть за Агнес, девушку, которую воскресит доктор, и за саму Сьюзан Эшворт.[/spoiler] [spoiler]Мне только непонятно почему Сьюзан резко похудела и помолодела, а Митзи наоборот выглядит старше и толще. [/spoiler]Еще есть отсылка на следующую игру Рема Михальски Lorelai.
[b] Плюсы:[/b] сюжет, музыка, интересные персонажи, черный юмор.
[b] Минусы:[/b] [spoiler]изменение Сьюзан и Митзи[/spoiler], короткая, отличается от оригинального Downfall.
Игру прошла пять раз подряд. Получила массу удовольствия.

33248160.review:
[h1] Harvester Games da nueva vida a su ópera prima. Una aventura point and click que cautivará a los jugadores ávidos de gore duro. Si te gustó The Cat Lady, Downfall está hecho para ti  [/h1]

La mayoría de nosotros conocemos Downfall gracias a The Cat Lady. Allá en 2009 el juego original era un proyecto desconocido, y sus creadores tuvieron que esperar a 2016 para aupar este "remake" en Steam Greenlight. Este antecedente es importante, porque Downfall es un juego [b] hecho a medida [/b] del éxito de The Cat Lady. 

Con esta premisa, ¿qué puede ofrecerte Downfall? ¿Supera a The Cat Lady?
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=964188026
La historia es sin duda el punto fuerte del juego. Ésta conecta con un matrimonio que atraviesa su momento más difícil: Ivy y Joe Davis están a punto de romper su relación sentimental a causa de una enfermedad mental de proporciones [b]monstruosas[/b]. Pero ninguno va a tirar la toalla todavía; están decididos a enfrentar sus demonios. Que triunfen o no queda en tus manos, gracias a un sistema de decisiones que encaminará tus actos hacia una u otra dirección. 

[table]
    [tr]
        [th][b]Pros[/b][/th]
        [th][b]Contras[/b][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td] La atmósfera melancólica y gore está bien conseguida  [/td]
        [td] La calidad del doblaje es muy irregular [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td] Regala momentos realmente escalofriantes [/td]
        [td] En ciertas ocasiones la trama se vuelve demasiado pretenciosa, incluso banal [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td] Fanservice de The Cat Lady por un tubo [/td]
        [td] El guión del juego original ha sido profundamente alterado para adaptarlo a TCL. Pierde fescura [/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1] Conclusión: [/h1]

El juego en general tiene un aprobado y es satisfactorio, aunque Downfall no es para todos los públicos: la temática es dura, y el desarrollo se acerca más a una experiencia narrativa que a una aventura gráfica. Aunque el verdadero problema de Downfall es haber sido remolcado por el éxito de su antecesor. [b]Quiere parecerse demasiado a The Cat Lady[/b], pero no llega a emocionarnos con momentos inolvidables ni llega a tener personalidad propia. En cualquier caso, si te gustó TCL -al que recomiendo jugar primero-, es muy probable que perdones sus defectos y lo disfrutes encantado. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1118298976
[h1]Nota final: 7/10[/h1]

32838495.review:
Por mais que o homem tente compreender todas as faculdades mentais, seremos sempre prisioneiros de nosso pensamento. Somos consequências de nossas decisões. Existe um universo de dimensões incomensuráveis em cada um, e ainda assim, nós, humanos e mortais, julgamos uns aos outros com certezas incertas e argumentos pouco elaborados. No mais profundo do ser, sentimos o peso da verdade que muitos negam, mas que todos sabem, nem nós mesmos nos conhecemos. Você pode ter seus sonhos e seus objetivos, seja ele o carro do ano, a família perfeita ou a profissão dos sonhos, mas nunca saberá se esses sonhos são verdadeiramente seus, ou se simplesmente alguém plantou na sua cabeça. Amigos, por favor, perdoem essas divagações e conjecturas sem sentido, para falar de Downfall eu precisava falar sobre a mente. Na verdade, eu queria falar de outras coisas mais profundas e obscuras, mas aí eu estragaria toda a narrativa impressionante que se segue a partir do inicio do jogo.

De cara você perceberá que este jogo é bem simplista. Se desenrola através da perspectiva 2D, montado, aparentemente, por uma mistura de imagens reais (cenários) e desenhos (personagens), e é através dessa combinação de recortes geniais que o jogo é apresentado ao jogador. É muito provável que você ache Downfall ridículo a principio, pois a introdução do jogo, ou prólogo, é na verdade algo que o jogador não esperava por ver. Siga meu conselho, tenha paciência e se deixe levar por este incrível conto de horror.

O ponto mais forte deste jogo está na incrível narrativa. É na verdade um dos melhores contos de horror que tive o prazer de vivenciar (jogar). A história se desenrola de forma bastante linear e tem a capacidade soberana de prender a atenção do jogador do inicio ao fim. Eu, por exemplo, só consegui parar de jogar depois que terminei. A trama, adulta e bastante polêmica é abordada de forma genial (sério, é muito genial). Todos os personagens que aparecem durante a narrativa possuem um grau de significância extremamente importante para a compreensão da história e de detalhes ocultos por trás da história. Existe todo um simbolismo entranhado nos detalhes, personagens e escolhas. Sério, se você tem um conhecimento mínimo sobre psicologia e sobre distúrbios mentais, você simplesmente vai achar Downfall incrível (ele é incrível, não tem pra onde correr).

Depressão; Bulimia; Anorexia; E muitas outras alterações mentais nem sempre são levadas a sério por pessoas do meio. E este jogo trabalhou tudo isso de uma forma detalhadíssima, mostrando todas as dificuldades e complicações pelas quais as pessoas que sofrem essas alterações costumam passar. É claro que não podemos generalizar, pois como falei antes, cada humano é um universo inteiramente diferente, assim como os meios.

O jogo em si também apresenta outros pontos fortes, como, por exemplo, a capacidade de escolhas durante diálogos que podem influenciar diretamente o seu destino e o destino de outros personagens. Também há uma grande quantidade de puzzles. Nada muito complexo, porém, TODOS significativos para a narrativa e para a crítica direta já comentada. 

Particularmente adorei Downfall. Do inicio ao fim, superou minhas expectativas em tudo. E espero muitíssimo que vocês gostem. É literalmente uma viagem por dentro de uma mente perturbada que procura desesperadamente por uma saída.

Downfall - 10/10

I played Downfall very, very long ago, so I'm pre-destined to be a fan of it.  This game is incredibly dark, however.  If you have a sensitivity to gore, avoid this at all costs.

That being said, the game is also unforgiving.  One small slip-up.  One wrong turned corner.  Doing a puzzle a little too slowly will end up getting the character killed.  The upgrade in graphics and music is outstanding, as well as the voice acting.  I loved the style of The Cat Lady, and so it was easy to see this game going the same way.

Play it if you're a fan of old-school difficulty point and click adventure games, stay if you are a fan of the macabre.

31266573.review:
I can't tell too much about the story here without spoiling a lot, so I'll just give you the premise: you play Joe Davis, who is on a short trip with his wife Ivy in a lonely countryside hotel called Quiet Haven in order to get your marriage back on track which was on a rough road for a while. But then, really unsettling things start to happen.....
Michalski did it again - following the grim and bloody, deeply disturbing horror masterpiece that was The Cat Lady, he made another game dealing with the abyss of human emotions and then some - really twisted, sick and disturbing stuff. I sometimes wonder whether R.Michalski is just a genius storyteller when it comes to horror or just a really fucked up dude who should seek out medical assistance - I hope that the first is the case ;) Anyhow, if you like horror, if you like gore, if you like sick, twisted, fucked-up stories and journeys into the deepest darkness that lurks in a human soul, Downfall is exactly for you. Just one more hint: you definitely should play The Cat Lady before you play Downfall, because it makes the mindfuck that is the ending SO MUCH MORE INTENSE. 
Oh, did I mention that, except for Joe, all the voice acting in this game is really absolutely fantastic? That the soundtrack is great? That the grim, almost avantgardistic artstyle just heightens the tension that the player feels even more? No? 
Well, buy the game, also buy The Cat Lady, play The Cat Lady first and see for yourselves. 
This is a true masterpiece, like The Cat Lady was before - but it definitely should only be played by people who are in a healthy state of mind and are over 18 ;)

30507043.review:
L'ayant fini d'une traite hier j'en profite pour laisser mon évaluation, le jeu n'est pas très long, comptez environ 5 heures pour le finir la première fois et il se peut que vous souhaiteriez ou non le refaire (ce qui n'est pas mon cas) pour avoir les fins alternatives, si comme moi vous avez eu une fin mi-figue mi-raisin et non la golden ending ou la worst ending.

Le jeu est bon. 
Personnellement, j'exécre les jeux à fins multiples surtout quand les critères pour les avoirs sont pas toujours justifiables ce qui je trouve est le cas dans ce titre mais pour le coup c'est acceptable; car pour les avoirs... Vu la durée du jeu c'est pas une grosse prise de tête.

Downfall. 
On y apprend l'histoire de Joe Davis et de sa femme Ivy, voisins de Susan Ashworth issue du jeu The Cat Lady(TCL), ces derniers partent en week-end; initiative de Joe qui a pour but de sauver son couple et se retrouver avec sa femme, ces derniers prênnent refuge dans un hotel le temps d'une nuit... La suite vous la connaitrez en jouant.
 -je pense qui si vous voulez faire Downfall ou si vous l'avez fait, vous avez sûrement joué à The Cat Lady qui est aussi un bon jeu, si c'est pas le cas j'vous conseil de passer par ce dernier même si c'est pas obligatoire-.

Il s'agit ici d'un remake du jeu de 2009, auquel je n'ai pas joué. Le moteur du jeu est assez dissident lors de la configuration. J'ai trouvé que la configuration vidéo était un peu gênante, j'vais pas raconter ma vie mais on va dire que j'ai pas réussi à trouver mon setup (fullscreen 1080p ou fenêtré scallable) bref, à part ça il tourne niquel, aucun problème graphique/audio de mon côté.

Nous avons la même formule que dans TCL, jeu d'aventure graphique en noir et blanc avec prédominance de rouge sur certains tableaux, lesdits tableaux aux aspects souvent gore/psychologique/horrifique et dérangeant, avec un jeu d'acteur convaincant lors des doublages et une BO adaptée font de Downfall un bon titre à part entière.

D'un point de vu scénario, je trouve qu'il y a de bonnes idées et de bonnes mises en pratique. 

Prenons par exemple le prologue, où on se retrouve dans un monde coloré avec le protagoniste jeune puis un jour son monde tourne au noir&blanc. 
Il y a beaucoup de symboliques dans ce jeu, comme quand certains passages qui viennent des souvenirs de Joe -ou certains de ses rêves- passent en couleurs, toujours peu prononcées mais présentent.
J'ai trouvé ça bien amené et pas trop évident.

Certains "plot twist" sont assez limite, de mon point de vu, mais en lançant le jeu on accepte quelque part de mettre sa logique dans une boîte et on part du postulat qu'on va se faire touiller le cerveau.

Au niveau des dialogues, l'humour noir est assez prononcé et appréciable... On peut bel et bien jouer le rôle du c**nard de base; avec des clins d'œil sympa, à certains légendes urbaines, memes, etc. 

En conclusion :
Downfall, la chute, le déluge... est un bon titre, auquel je ne regrette pas d'avoir joué. 
Jeu qui a ses qualités et ses petits défauts. Si vous comptiez y jouer, je vous le conseil vivement. 
Just. Do. It.

30420065.review:
如果说猫夫人我给10/10，Downfall 09我给8/10，Downfall 16我只想给7/10，还有三分是情怀。简单来说这次重制诚意十足，但用力过猛。如果你喜欢gore和暗黑解密且还没有玩过系列里的任何一作，推荐。如果你是猫夫人与09 Downfall粉，不推荐。
虽然非常失望，但还是先扬后抑。相比09，16版本的画面提升简直一绝，光影效果十分出彩；配音和音乐都很用心；人物塑造上也终于使主角之一Ivy不再像背景板；解密删除了许多无用和重复行走的部分，那块让人困惑的三明治不见了（希望喂给了死人们的蛆虫）
16相比09添加了很多情节，比如最一开始Young Joe和Young Ivy在咖啡店前的相遇又一起目睹Robbie的死亡；比如Agnes在迷宫到处寻找门把手顺便遇见了Ivy；比如（让我尖叫出声的）Susan和Mitzi的出现。
然而这些情节没有解释那些让人困惑的隐喻，反而使得原本紧凑的剧情支离破碎；对话的选项让我直咬牙，连贯性也让人怀疑。20年后再次相遇的Joe和Ivy从未提过被炸死的弟弟；在迷宫里追寻Agnes的斧头男只恍过一瞬并非步步紧逼（我还以为我会再死几次）；Susan的出现使现实与虚拟相融，然而我们亲爱亲爱的猫夫人不由分说就砍死了Joe，看着恢复心跳的Ivy活活烧死，还指责Mitzi为什么来晚了。
我不知道这是谁，反正不是我知道的猫夫人。
至于不由分说被砍倒的Joe，他在不情愿之下帮小女孩注射还看着她头颅爆炸，他在未知之下帮医生拿了人脑还好心帮僵尸先生安回，他因为斧头男炼狱也去了还为了回来准备听死人们的怂恿给自己一枪，他为了杀死四个回忆让Ivy回来人脂也烤了人头也搅了什么fuck up烂事都做了。他世界的全部就只有Ivy，他一心一意只想让Ivy回来，他所求全部不过是在一个和Ivy独处的下午，谈论他们要养的猫的名字的那一瞬宁静爱意。
管这样的Joe叫第六个Parasite，Queen of Maggots，你一点也不酷了。
玩过猫夫人后再看16的A结局只觉得时间线混乱且画蛇添足，而我已没有心力去收集三封信攒齐27点打出完美结局。
不过话说回来，在最一开始Young Sophie就坦言“This is Madness”，在疯狂面前，何须再多言？我还是去再玩一次09 Downfall和猫夫人吧。

Downfall 2016 это редкий пример отличного ремейка.
Вселенная стала атмосфернее, квесты несколько изменены, персонажи стали живее и при том много нового контента и отсылок к оригинальным загадкам, диалогам, а так же другим играм.
Яро рекомендую сначала пройти оригинал 2009 года, чтобы были понятны изменения и отсылки.

Ну а про игру:
- Это квест с упрошённым управлением. Сначала может показаться, что это плохо, но потом понимаешь, что из-за простенького управления квесты хуже не становятся.
- Сюжет психоделический, это однозначно +, но к сожалению он пышит сумасшествием с самого начала. Если в оригинале ещё можно было предполагать, что всё происходит в нормальной реальности, то тут сразу ясно, что у ГГ что то не так с головой.
- Очень кинематографичная подача. Приятно смотреть, несмотря на тонны диалогов.
- Отличные персонажи, я просто влюблён в Агнес!

К сожалению русская локализация имеет кучу огрех, несколько диалогов малость попорчены, и некоторые сюжетные вещи можно было не переделывать, а так же жаль, что из сюжета вырезан Гитлер. Но это мелочи.

13 Софи из 10!

30087655.review:
Some background on this game first. Downfall was Harvester Games' first game, released in 2009. They then released The Cat Lady in 2012, and finally, remade Downfall, and released THAT in 2016. This is the 2016 version of Downfall - with me so far?

I haven't played the original version of Downfall - apparently it's roughly the same, story wise, but with no voice acting, different controls, and the remake has added a lot of content. Because of this, it's recommended that you play The Cat Lady before this. I'd recommend doing so - The Cat Lady is one of the finest point 'n' clicks ever made (provided you can stomach the horror aspect of it).

Similar to The Cat Lady, Downfall is a 2D adventure game with strong horror elements. VERY strong, in places - it's got some of the most graphic imagery I've ever seen in a game. It's all presented in a very unique style that ranges from beautiful, to janky as hell. Some of the character animations in particular are... interesting. The animations often seem to have too few frames to sit well with the handdrawn art style. Still, the overall effect - mostly monochrome with the occasional splash of colour - works well. And, as previously mentioned, some of the imagery is... well, it's bloody disturbing. As somebody that's played a lot of horror games, and seen a lot of horror movies, my jaw dropped several times at some of the stuff onscreen. It's not for the faint of heart.

Sound design is similar, in that it's occasionally janky, but mostly, very effective. The voice acting is hit and miss, and made worse by the obvious lack of mixing - you can have two characters standing next to each other having a conversation, and it sounds like one is right next to the mic, and the other is shouting from a clifftop half a mile away. Music is generally excellent - mostly warped, asynchronous, nails-on-a-chalkboard stuff, with the occasional bit of rock/metal.

Gameplay mostly consists of traditional point 'n' clicking - pick up a strange assortment of items and use them in the right places to trigger the next bit of story. The puzzles require a bit of thought, but are never frustrating - I only had to resort to a walkthrough once, and I'm terrible at these sorts of games. There's quite a bit of backtracking, and no run button (that I was aware of anyway), which did occasionally get annoying, but it did help make the environments feel more like real places, rather than just levels to move through.

It took me just under five hours to finish the game, and that was with taking my time, exploring everywhere, and not skipping any cutscenes. Honestly, for these sorts of games, that length is pretty much perfect. Much longer, and I tend to lose interest - when a game is trying to tell a concise, self-contained story, padding it out with unnecessary filler can often dampen the overall product. There are multiple endings, and some story-affecting choices, but not really anything compelling enough to replay it.

Story and dialogue is where Downfall shines, however. It's hard to explain any of the story without spoiling it a bit, but it effectively deals with quite serious real world issues such as depression and marital problems, while successfully weaving these themes into a more traditional horror narrative. In terms of theme and atmosphere, the closest game I can think of (aside from The Cat Lady) is Silent Hill 2 - the undisputed king of all horror games. The dialogue is generally well written, with just enough humour and dryness in the lines and delivery to make the characters believable (sound mixing issues aside).

While the individual part of Downfall are sometimes subpar and often janky, the game as a whole is, like The Cat Lady, a masterpiece, and one of the most interesting and unique horror/adventure games you're ever likely to play. You won't forget this one in a hurry.

29710585.review:
Go play The Cat Lady first, and then decide if you want to play this. Both have a similar gritty style, great soundtracks, and shocking themes. But you can tell that TCL came second with much more sophisticated story and dialog compared to Downfall. Downfall aims for something a little darker, but the ameteur nature makes it feel like a more childish take on marriage, depression, insanity, etc.

If you liked TCL, I think this is worth playing. It's a little bit of a letdown by comparison, but since there are so few adventure games like this it's a really nice companion to TCL.

Beyond any comparisons to TCL, the puzzles are well designed, not too easy and yet I don't remember ever getting stuck. The art is a mix of excellent and poor, but it's so unusual that it draws me in. The voice acting is generally pretty bad (with exceptions like Ivy's very haunting performance) and some accents border on comical. Some hallways with 90 degree turns are really confusing to navigate.

I hope this doesn't sound too harsh. I like the game, but you have to look past the rough edges. Again, I'm looking forward to what the creators make next.

This game makes a lot more sense if you play The Cat Lady first; make sure you do that.

Just like The Cat Lady, this game is quite graphic, and tackles difficult situations and issues. It will definitely give you the feels. The art style is wonderful, and the mechanics are simple. There are several different endings to achieve, but in case you were wondering, none of them are especially positive.

It is relatively short compared to The Cat Lady, but it really does help explain the story of Joe and Ivy if you've completed that first game and are craving more, like I was.

Controls only require one hand to play, so I'll play this while using the other hand to hold food, and tbh that's a huge bonus for me.

I would recommend this game to anybody looking for a solid story based horror game.

29653794.review:
Game Review: ★★★★ (4/5 Stars)
First off: For all of you Cat Lady lovers - if you are looking for a game that matches your favorite game, you might be disappointed. Downfall is, in comparison to its Cat Lady relative, rather short. What you'll find is a very interesting, extremely abstract game starring Joe Davis - a resident of beloved Cat Lady's home house. 

The story follows Joe Davis and his wife as they attempt to mend a broken marriage with a weekend in a hotel, where we soon find out things aren't quite normal. There really isn't too much more I can say about the story without spoiling it for anyone, so I'll leave it at that. 
On occasion the game can be rather disturbing, which in my honest opinion is part of what makes it a great game, however I kind of missed the clear message at the end of the game which I was hoping for and which was present in The Cat Lady. While the game obviously targets mental disorders, in particular I felt a relation to Bulimia, the clear final act that puts things into perspective was somewhat missing. In addition with its extremely abstract story and design, it was quite unclear to me what exactly the message was.

This is still an extremely good story based game with its disturbing moments, its gore and its elaborate story, but it can unfortunately not match my personal favorite: The Cat Lady.

If you're interested, here's a link to my playthrough of it (Link to playlist): https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYzlb9Rw0iBTtwuktYRjm872XvBpzJqSh

29387334.review:
Nach The Cat Lady habe ich mir Downfall angeschaut und muss zugeben, dass ich erneut zutiefst beeindruckt bin, was Harvester Games hier für ein malerisches, storytechnisches Meisterwerk kreiert hat. Ich habe Downfall leider erst viel später kennengelernt, nachdem ich The Cat Lady durchgespielt habe, doch ich spiele Downfall nicht mal eine Stunde und schon ist mir klar, dass Downfall mit The Cat Lady stark zu vergleichen ist. Es gibt einige Parallelen und sogar Bekannte Gesichter, wie die Katze Teacup.

Die Story ist sehr düster, schaurig und unheimlich gestaltet, jedoch gleichzeitig auch spannend und wundervoll. Die malerische Optik ist wie bei The Cat Lady ebenfalls düster gestaltet. Es gibt auch hier kaum Farbe, was dem Spiel nochmal eine ordentliche Tracht Atmosphäre einbringt, da die malerische, farblose Optik hervorragend zur Geschichte passt. Das Spiel ähnelt eher einem Horrorfilm, als einem Spiel, da hier die Geschichte viel eher im Vordergrund steht, als das eigentliche Gameplay, was aber nicht zwangshaft schlecht sein muss.

Da das Spiel eine recht düstere Geschichte und auch eine unheimliche Optik besitzt, ist dieses Spiel wirklich ausschließlich für Spieler ab 18, da wie auch bei The Cat Lady nicht mit Gewalt, Blut und nackter Haut gescheut wird.

Fazit: Nach The Cat Lady mal wieder ein hervorragendes Adventure aus dem Hause Harvester Games. Die Atmosphäre ist wunderschön, die Geschichte wirklich spannend und die Rätsel schön knackig. Das Spiel bietet mehrere Enden und außerdem die Möglichkeit, Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten zu sammeln. Im großen und ganzen ist Downfall genau wie The Cat Lady ein hervorragendes, gut insziniertes und enorm gefülltes 2D-Horror-Adventure, für wenig Geld. Wer hier also keinen Spaß findet, der sammelt besser Bierdeckel oder Briefmarken. Man sollte Downfall nicht als Spiel ansehen, sondern als spielbares Kunstwerk für wenig Geld, was einiges richtig macht.

+Pro:
+Spannende Story
+Interessante Charaktere
+Guter Soundtrack
+Stimmungsvolle Optik
+Wiederspielwert

-Kontra:
-Wie auch bei The Cat Lady gibt es keine 1920x1080 Unterstützung
-Einige Übersetzungsfehler, wie bei The Cat Lady
-Spiel teilweise recht kurz

29219353.review:
Джо и Айви знают друг друга с самого детства. Они вместе пережили не самый лучший момент в жизни, через десятилетие пронесли свое чувство, обвенчались и были счастливы. Но всякому счастью приходит конец, тем более в игре окрашенной в черно-белые тона. Пара несвоевременно сказанных слов в адрес друг друга, и вот брак уже трещит по швам. Но может быть еще не поздно все вернуть? 

Поскольку рассуждать о переплетениях сюжета, раскрывая тут и там спойлеры, перед читателями — дело неблагородное, то я упущу этот пункт. Скажу лишь, что всю игру Джо проведет в загородном отеле «Тихий уголок» в попытках спасти свою жену, похищенную ужасным монстром, живущим по ту сторону разбитых зеркал. Для этого Джо придется совершать совершенно негуманные поступки и чем дальше — тем хуже.

Из-за своего игрового процесса игра вышла очень простой и проще ее может быть только продукция «Telltale Games». Хоть в жанрах и заявлено, что это Adventure (то бишь квест) и заниматься нам тут придется типичными для квеста вещами (исследовать отель, находить предметы, своевременно применять их, а порой даже комбинировать и решать загадки) — процесс был упрощен до невозможности. В отличии от оригинала (стандартный poin'n click квест) здесь Джо перемещается и контактирует с окружающим миром лишь по изометрии. То есть вы уже поняли, что взаимодействовать можно будет лишь в избранными разработчиками предметами окружающего мира, кои будут выделяться стрелочками с надписями и кликать по всему подряд просто не придется. Список действий, кой можно провернуть с тем или иным предметом, практически всегда строго ограничен «Осмотром» и «Действием» и, будьте уверены, что в 85% случаев, когда в списке действий появляется какое-нибудь новое — именно его и нужно применить для дальнейшего прохождения. Вопроса с тем куда идти и что делать почти никогда не возникает (лично я серьезно сглупил лишь один раз), так как решение одной игровой ситуации практически сразу даст вам ключ для решения другой (возможно вам еще не знакомой, но что очень скоро появится).

По традиции в игре несколько концовок, а точнее всего три. Какую вы получите будет зависеть, в первую очередь, от того каким Джо вы будете отыгрывать игру: любящим мужем или бессердечным козлом. В самом начале игры вам, не говоря об этом, дается 27 черепов. И за каждое нехорошее слово или дурной поступок, с вас будут снимать по одному из черепов. Сохранив все 27 черепов, вы получите лучшую концовку. Уничтожив все черепа – худшую. Ну а оказавшись где-то между – нейтральную. Получить другие две концовки – это не такая уж простая задача, знаете ли, ведь в игре всегда может возникнуть неоднозначный момент, когда ты не поймешь – этот поступок снимет череп или сохранит его? А сохранность или напротив отсутствие одного черепка для получения концовки – это, ой как важно.

Также стало заметно, что к работе над этой игрой Рем Михальски подходил с более легкой рукой, нежели к работе над оригиналом, который был буквально весь пропитан болью. Диалоги персонажей зачастую наполнены юмором (пошлым, черным, порой даже тонким), а в игре нет-нет да встретится пара шуточных отсылок, как на тот же самый Steam, так и на модный нынче жанр «Interactive Movies» с их вечным «Герой запомнит это».

Подход к созданию игры вышел весьма спорным поскольку, с одной стороны, он позволяет не особо отвлекаться от созерцания сюжетной линии на известные своими «особенностями» условия прохождения квестовых игр. С другой стороны фанатам жанра тут просто нечего ловить (в отличие от того же оригинала), что опять возвращает нас к вопросу: «Мы кино смотрим или в игру играем?». Лично мне подход не показался плохим — лично я очень рад, что Рем Михальски и его команда нашли свой собственный, не похожий на другие игры, стиль.

Итог

Игра, выполненная в лучших традициях полюбившимся игрокам The Cat Lady. Старая сказка, да на новый лад, так сказать. Рекомендовать эту игру каждому я, разумеется, не стану, но если вы все же и

29171644.review:
Downfall ist ein grandioses Meisterwerk über die menschlichen Abgründe. Realität und Einbildung liegen hier so dicht bei einander, dass man immer wieder mit offenem Mund da sitzt.

Story:
Joe fährt mit seiner Frau Ivy übers Wochenende weg. Ivy war in den letzten Jahren immer wieder psychisch krank und nun scheint die Ehe der beiden vor dem Aus zu stehen. Bei einem Wochenendtrip in ein Romantikhotel unternimmt Joe den letzten Versuch die Ehe zu retten. Dieses Hotel hat nichts, aber auch rein gar nichts mit einem Romantikhotel gemein. "Es ist der Ort, der verrückt ist." Ivy verschwindet plötzlich und es zieht ein Sturm herauf...

Spiel:
Downfall ist ein Meisterwerk des Psycho-Horrors. Es stellt den Spieler immer wieder vor harte, unmoralische und zum Teil bestialische Entscheidungen. Es ist nichts für schwache Nerven und das obwohl es "nur" ein Sidescrolling-Horror-Game ist. Die Geschichte ist sehr dicht und undurchsichtig und bleibt bis zum Ende spannend und überraschend. 

Mechanik:
Schwächen gibt es in meinen Augen praktisch keine. Manch einer mag monieren, dass das Spiel im 5:4-Format angezeigt wird. Aber das war für mich kein Problem. Das einzige, was ein wenig unglücklich gelöst ist, ist das erreichen des letzten Spielstandes nach einem Neustart des Spiels. 

Fazit: 
Downfall hat mich nachhaltig beschäftigt. Selten habe ich so bei einem Horrorspiel gelitten, wie hier. Ein Spiel, das definitiv hängen bleibt. Eine absolute persönliche Empfehlung.

Wer einen Eindruck von diesem Spiel haben möchte kann gerne mein Let's Play zu Downfall sehen. Achtung: Die erste Folge besteht zu 90% aus dem Prolog. Obwohl sich dieser sehr lohnt, kann man ihn auch überspringen und direkt in den Horror hinein tauchen.

https://youtu.be/bDgjRZ9IN30

29095248.review:
С Downfall я познакомилась в 2009 году. Это был довольно оригинальный по атмосфере и исполнению point-n-click инди-квест, отличающийся и идеей, и стилем, и некоторой нелинейностью. Запоминать разработчика игры даже не стала - мало ли на свете контор, выпускавших инди и впоследствии канувших в бездну. Каково же было мое удивление, когда я наткнулась на The Cat Lady и переиздание Downfall.

Быстрый обзор минусов в сравнении с оригинальной версией. Если не играли в нее, не читайте это.

1. Меньшее количество локаций. Хотя в оригинальной версии все фоны были явно нарисованы на коленке (запустите игру 2009 года или погуглите скриншоты), а здесь все очень качественно и профессионально, пусть даже в меньшем разнообразии.

2. Отсутствие возможности погибнуть. В оригинале было несколько моментов, когда игроку приходилось действовать быстро. Хоть это и лишняя нервотрепка.

3. Выбор яда не имеет значения. Черт возьми, серьезно??? Я никогда в жизни не забуду последствия выбора в игре 2009 года. Просто запустите и посмотрите, как это там реализовано. Зато стало все понятно с газовым вентилем (в каком положении подача газа выключена, а в каком включена). Спасибо!

4. Слишком быстро врубаешься в суть происходящего. В оригинале сидишь до самого конца в непонятках.

5. Бесцветность. Добро пожаловать в Sin City, дамы и господа. Издержки стилистики (и не только).

6. Сцена, перенесенная в пролог, слишком укорочена, да и головоломки из нее все повыпилили.

Стоит ли играть в оригинал? Можно, но не обязательно. Просто для сравнения.

Теперь попробую забыть о том, что это ремейк, собрать взорванный мозг воедино после переосмысления финала - а это очень сложно - и высказать пару более-менее адекватных мыслей по поводу всего.

Рем Михальски - гениальный человек, да еще и с обалденным музыкальным вкусом. Все, что он делает, великолепно. Народ, да это, без шуток, лучшая игра 2016 года. Вот только играть, не пройдя The Cat Lady, бессмысленно. Даже не пытайтесь. Не поймете половину.

Заключительный абзац о концовках. [spoiler]Их три, все очень разные и вызывают совершенно разные эмоции, но только одна из них true. И она разбила мне сердце.[/spoiler]

PS: тот, кто делал русскую локализацию, зачем-то прибавил ко всем номерам этажей единицу. То есть первый этаж в русском переводе оказывается вторым, а четвертый - пятым. Спасибо, добрый человек.

28974603.review:
Хочу начать с того, что "Downfall" рекомендую проходить ДО "The Cat Lady", несмотря на то, что первый тесно связан с "Кошатницей" и содержит массу отсылок. Почему это необходимо?
Сюжет игры захватывающий, но местами предсказуемый; персонажи колоритные, но не вызывающие бурной привязанности и сильного переживания за их судьбы; концовки интересны, но не поразительны до ужаса. Собственно, и ужаса в "Downfall" мало: хоррор-сцены и графика гипнотизируют, максимум заставляют поморщиться, но уникального психологического давления за этим не следует. 
Это описание вышло таким бедным и не возводящим игру до 10/10 потому, что перед "Downfall" была именно что пройдена "Кошатница", которая 10/10 как раз заслуживает. Именно на ее фоне "Downfall" выглядит  среднячком, где все вроде бы неплохо и привлекательно, но в то же время поверхностно. Поэтому  знакомство с данной серией советую начать с него: местные хоррор-элементы еще не примелькаются вместе с сюжетными перипетиями. 
Кроме того, неиллюзорная перекличка с богоподобным "Silent Hill 2" и радует, и огорчает одновременно. Потому что после второго SH к трагическим брачным историям начинаешь относиться ох как предвзято. 
Как итог: игра хороша, определенно заслуживает внимания, фанатам и любителям подобного обязательна к прохождению, но есть существенные "но", из-за которых восприятие "Downfall" может исказиться. В сравнениях эта игра проигрывает, но вне сравнений она - качественная, отличная вещь.

P.S. Очень порадовало то, что через персонажа освещается актуальная проблема анорексии/булимии. Серьезную болезненную тему раскрыли на редкость грамотно и интересно.

28941563.review:
I am not a fan of remakes. I am in general convinced that a bad game should be allowed to rest in peace, since it's impossible to fix the most glaring flaws of a game. 

Downfall changed my mind on this.

The original version had an unoriginal story, very annoying puzzles and shoddy ending. It had promise, but the promise was unfulfilled. Because of that I did not plan to buy the remake, but high praise from my friends made me reconsider. 

Remastered Downfall has the same plot and roughly the same characters, but the changes are nevertheless stunning. I enjoyed the graphics in Cat Lady (another game of this developer), but Downfall got an upgrade both in visuals and animations. Don't be deceived by the screens: the game is very visually rich and the developer does not shy away from experimenting with backgrounds and setting a whole new standard for adventure games. 

Overly convoluted puzzles had been simplified and are now wonderfully coherent. You no longer need to carry around ten items to solve a problem and the interface had been cleaned up. Some sections will require some thought, but in the end everyone should be able to guess what needs to be done next.

The story depicts a mentally ill wife with depression and anorexia. While in the original mental illness was used mostly for shock value, the remastered version offers a far more compassionate and nuanced take on this character. The husband, protagonist of the game can be either the person who leads her on the path to self-destruction or gives her the support she needs. 

This does not mean that you will see heavy-handed mental illness talk, but instead you get a variety of dialogue choices and visit fascinating nightmare locations mirroring your wife's problems. Beware: if you dislike gore and horror, this game is not for you. If you enjoy a little bit campiness in your horror, you will love it.
