28703686.review:
Downfall is a game similar to The Cat Lady with gore, symbolism and the the supernatural.

However while The Cat Lady was about finding light in the dark, Downfall is about going deeper and deeper  in the darkness to find what you lost. When Joe Davis loses his wife, not even reality will separate them. The game comes with two versions  the original(2009) and the remake(2016) and while they basically tell the same story they both do it in their own unique way.

The original (about 4h)
-Joe is going through a downward spiral to madness.
-At the end he has to decide how it ends (1 of 3 ways).
-It is presented in the old point-and-click style, with rather difficult puzzles.
-It has a more complete story, as it presents a lot more about the characters.

The Remake (about 3h)
-Joe is  going through some soul searching (morality choices).
-At the end you are given a ending (good, bad or “you did not try hard enough”).
-The same side scrolling point-and-click style as The Cat Lady. With very easy puzzles.
-It has a more compact story and is better  presented.
-The final section is re-written for the fans of The Cat Lady.

28507050.review: I played both Cat Lady and Downfall. This one seems a bit shorter than TCL , but it's still enjoyable. I found the voice acting a bit more amateur as well, but I love the story, such a good remake, revamp from the original Downfall.

28436309.review: It's a good game, but I liked The Cat Lady a lot more. The characters in The Cat Lady are more interesting and likeable. Furthermore the story is better and more touching in my opinion.

28324450.review: Я являюсь большим фанатом игр студии Harverster Games. И Downfall не является исключением из правила. Играл и в оригинал и с огромным удовольствием прошел переиздание. Оно вышло на славу: графика улучшена (даже в сравнении с The Cat Lady - все стало более плавным, красивым), прежний стиль сохранен, как и игровой процесс. Последний полностью идентичен The Cat Lady - мы ходим, ищем предметы, пытаемся их применить. Впрочем, в саязи с особеннсотями сюжета, Downfall более камерный, ведь почти вся игра происходит в прежелах отеля, но более свободный - мы постоянно бродим по строению, решаем задачки, разговариваем с героями. Сюжет сохранен со времен оригинального Downfall, но несколько изменились роли ряда героев и пара сюжетных поворотов. В сухом остатке, я рекомендую пройти (вернее, прожить) эту игру всем и каждому, оно точно того стоит!

28280708.review: Another masterpiece, just like The Cat Lady. Great sounds, music, writing and atmosphere.

28275115.review:
Je ne pouvais pas ne pas jouer à ce jeu après ma découverte de The Cat Lady qui m'a complètement embarquée. Et je n'ai vraiment pas été déçue de connaitre l'histoire de son voisin ! 28027532.review:
[i] "S`up, Joe. Missed me?" [/i] (с)
 [b] Агнес [/b]
Примечание перед обзором: некоторые аспекты я буду сравнивать с The Cat Lady, так как обзор рассчитан на игроков уже знакомых с нею, но без спойлеров в отношении Downfall. Вы можете пролистать обзор вниз к +/- и вердикту.

Семейная чета Джо и Айви Дэвисов прибывает на уикенд в небольшой отель Quite Heaven, чтобы поправить пошатнувшиеся отношения. В холле отеля супруги ссорятся, и Джо поднимается в номер один. Наутро он обнаруживает, что Айви пропала, а в самом отеле происходит что-то странное. Поиском Айви нам и предстоит заниматься на протяжении всей игры.

[h1] Графика [/h1]
Разрешение в игре 800x600, т.ч. будьте готовы к черным полоскам по бокам широкоформатного экрана. Стилистика черно-белая, с акцентным красным цветом. Рисовка стала  плавнее и приятнее глазу, но фирменный стиль The Cat Lady узнается сразу. 
[h1] Геймплей [/h1]
Хоть в тегах и стоит "Point&Click"-управление в игре стрелками, т.е.-никакой мышки [strike] и пиксельхантинга [/strike]. Нам предстоит решать вполне логичные задачи, так что бродить часами в поисках ответа/следующего действия нет необходимости. В игру добавили функции автоматического и быстрого сохранения. Большую часть времени играть будем за Джо, часть за Агнес-загадочную девушку из отеля (нет, это не спойлер!), [spoiler] за Айви всего в одной локации [/spoiler].
[h1] Сюжет [/h1]
Завязку я упомянул в начале, а об остальной части написать, не наспойлерив, невозможно. Он интересен и удерживает внимание до конца истории. Скажу лишь, что в игре, в зависимости от действий, есть ТРИ концовки. И самое интересное то, что КАЖДАЯ трактует историю по-разному.
Атмосфера в игре тоже на высшем уровне, но она не похожа на депрессивную атмосферу The Cat Lady, но это даже в плюс. К примеру: в напряжении ждешь чего-то серьезного от следующей сцены, а тут бац!-совершенно абсурдная ситуация или забавный диалог между Джо и Агнес. К счастью, таких сцен немного и они служат контрастом общему повествованию.
Персонажи в игре очень яркие и запоминающиеся, а голоса актеров озвучки подобраны идеально.
[h1] Саундтрек [/h1]
Он бесподобен! Продолжая традицию The Cat Lady, он как нельзя лучше позволяет прочувствовать происходящее на экране монитора. И он из тех редких OST, которые хочется слушать и вне игры.
[i] К слову, в продающимся в Steam "Downfall-Original Soundtrack" представлены только инструментальные композиции (о чем есть предупреждение в обсуждениях игры), но не песни. В нем нет песен Warmer, Siah и Black Casino and the Ghost (последняя-песня из трейлера игры). [/i] 
[h1] Разное [/h1]
В комплекте с игрой идет Downfall 2009 (оригинальная игра, только на английском, классический "Point&Click"). Так вот, на Windows 7x64 есть небольшая проблема: в самой игре не работает курсор, т.е. играть попросту невозможно. Однако, игра спокойно работает на Windows XP и 8.1 (проверял работоспособность на обеих ОС).
[h1] [b]Плюсы и минусы Downfall [/b] [/h1]
[h1] + [/h1]
-Сюжет и различные интерпретации истории тремя концовками
-Неповторимая атмосфера и стилистика
-Отличный саундтрек
-Наличие русского языка (только текст, озвучка английская)
-Есть демо (только на английском)
-Помолодевшая Сьюзен Эшворт! (субъективный плюс)
[h1] +/- [/h1]
-Тесная связь/отсылки к The Cat Lady. Поясню: связанность с TCL это хорошо и мне она греет душу в Downfall, но игрокам, не игравшим в TCL, будут непонятны некоторые отсылки и прямые заимствования (да даже появление самой Сьюзен!), что негативно сказывается на понимании сюжета и интерпретации концовок
[h1] - [/h1]
-Продолжительность игры (хотя, это субъективный и единственный минус). На первое неспешное прохождение (осмотр предметов, бэктрекинг по локациям) у меня ушло чуть менее 5,5 часов. Следующие 3 (в попытке получить другую концовку самостоятельно упустил ма-а-ленькую деталь и зафейлил прохождение; учтите мой опыт и после первого прохождения посматривайте в гайд, благо он есть в руководствах) прохождения были еще быстрее.
[h1] [b]Вердикт [/b] [/h1]
Рекомендую к покупке, но не всем игрокам. Игра, в первую очередь, рассчитана на поклонников The Cat Lady. Более полное понимание сюжета требует знакомства с TCL. Некоторых может оттолкнуть стилистика, графика, механика игры (управление только с клавиатуры), поэтому настоятельно рекомендую загрузить и поиграть в демо, благо оно есть. Так вы хотя бы поймете, зацепила ли вас игра или же нет. Игра must have фанатам The Cat Lady.

[i] Если вы решились на покупку, то мой вам совет: во время игры будет момент с выбором "за кого играть дальше?". Переборите себя и выберите "продолжить за Джо"-не пожалеете!;)[/i]
Спасибо за чтение!

27914421.review:
Downfall (the 2016 version) was a solid follow up to "The Cat Lady." I was completely into the storyline, and it definitely had me saying "Woah" and "What the fuck" several times. I love the way Harvester Games tackles games about mental illnesses, and I hope they continue to do games like this. They're dark and twisted, grimey and gory, but they have a strong message about depression and self image. I love it. I will be replaying them for all the achievements.

I have yet to play the original 2009 version, but between 2016 Downfall and The Cat Lady, the latter was the stronger of the two games. Downfall's storyline got slightly foggy at times and the art style, while similar to and newer than Cat Lady, was less charming and artistic than The Cat Lady's (personal preference). The voice acting, however, pales in comparison to Cat Lady. Adult Joe was mostly good, Susan Ashworth was lovely, I loved the cameos of the YouTubers (especially Cryaotic), but everyone else was either poorly done or poorly recorded, or felt like they were phoning it in emotion wise.

Other than that, I love the game, I love The Cat Lady and look forward to more games with AMAZING soundtracks from them.

 "Devil came through here" series by Harvester Games reveal people's nature, their hidden intentions. Unwillingly, you live each character's life what is the [strike] best[/strike] worst part of these stories: you get easily affected.

This is not a game. This is a guide to human mind. Uncouth, ugly, rotting yet blooming - just like our life is.

26889468.review:
Mein Review für Downfall kann ich fast eins zu eins übernehmen von The Cat Lady: 

Was soll ich bloß zu diesem Spiel sagen? Außer das es mein absoluter Favorit ist gegenüber anderen Spielen, der Sound passt sich dem jeweiligen Set an. Es sind bei jedem Durchspielen immer wieder andere Dinge zu beobachten. Insgesamt gibt es 7 verschiedene Enden, daher hoher Wiederspielwert. Grafikstil ist ungewöhnlich aber passt absolut. Die Stimmung im gesamten Spiel passt einfach wunderbar zusammen. Eine emotionale Reise in dunkle Gefilde der Psyche.

Und das trifft auch hier wieder zu schon der Einstieg ist der absolute Hammer und den vollen Kaufpreis wert, daher unterstützt die Entwickler und spielt das Spiel. Absolute Kaufempfehlung für Leute die auf "erwachsene Themen" stehen.

26726679.review:
The Cat Lady gehört für mich mit zum Besten, was es an erwachsenen Adventures gibt. 
Downfall erschien eigentlich vorher, jedoch ist es vielleicht besser, wenn man the cat lady zuerst spielt, da das Ende( zumindest in diesem Remake) so viel verständlicher ist und somit noch interessanter ist.

Spielerisch ist das Remake Cat Lady sehr ähnlich. Downfall ist jedoch simpler in den Rätseln, sodass jeder ohne Lösung durchkommen müsste. Es gibt mehrere Enden, verschiedene Wege Dialoge zu führen und einige Geheimnisse, die man entdecken muss um alle Achievements freizuspielen. In ca 4-5 Stunden hat man wohl seinen ersten Durchgang beendet. 

Ich bin auf jeden Fall auf den dritten sehr gespannt. Ich hoffe, dass das Universum weiter ausgebaut wird. Es hat Potential für noch einige Teile mehr. The Cat Lady ist nochmal ne Steigerung in allen Bereichen gewesen, aber Downfall hat eine sehr gute Grundlage gelegt, die sich zu spielen lohnt.

26045931.review:
Симулятор общения с девушками.
Если вы хиккан, целыми днями сидите дома и у вас нет девушки, а так хочется общения с противоположным полом,то эта игра для вас.
Здесь вы можете не только мило побеседовать и признаться в любви,а так же если вы лютый ТННщик,то для вас есть варианты общения "на уровне".
Игра в жанре квест,головоломка с выбором вариантов диалога,которые в дальнейшем могут повлиять на концовку.
Из явных плюсов можно отметить:
+ Очень атмосферная. Игра прямо таки даёт погрузиться в себя:в её хоть и не столь многочисленнные, но интересные декорации,в её музыку на заднем фоне, временами величественную,а порой пробирающую до мурашек.
+ Диалоги. Очень интересная система диалогов, вроде бы и ничего особенного, но ответы получаемые в результате того или иного выбора даже казалось бы в такой фантастической игре вполне адекватные,где-то с иронией,а где-то даже с философским подтекстом. И не зря я вначале написал, что это симулятор общения с девушками, т.к действительно диалоги с возлюбленной вполне себе даже из разряда быта,и чтобы в лишний раз не попасться на уловку жены(девушки) главного героя ему приходится придумывать ответы с наименьшим летальным исходом для него.Так что если у вас есть или будет женщина, то вот вам пособие по общению с ней и заранее готовые ответы на ту или иную реплику.
+ Нелинейность. Как уже упоминал-игра интересна вариативностью концовок. Вы можете быть как хорошим семьянином, так и ходящим "налево" муженьком.
+ Сюжет. Сам по себе сюжет это в завязке типичный хоррор, но вот что будет в конце,то это лютый трэш. После прохождение игры вы будете минут 20 пытаться осознать, что же на самом деле произошло. Кому-то будет не по душе, но лично мне сюжет более чем полностью понравился.
Из минусов могу отметить только 1:
- Локализация. Игру я приобретал давно,ещё до того, как появилась русская локализация. И откровенно говоря- через 15 минут прохождения игры я её закрыл, потому как истинный патриот я не знаю язык буржуев,а если транслитить каждый диалог, то пропадает вся атмосферность игры. И вот недавно я зашёл и увидел русскую локализацию и понял, что пора игру пройти. Переведена игра только субтитрах,но и этого хватает, чтобы погрузиться в игру. Для меня даже лучше, что озвучка оригинальная. Но не обошлось и без косяков,таких как АШИБАК в тексте. Ну это пустяки, мы же НИ НА ЭКЗАМИНЕ,ЧТОБЫ ПРАВИЛЬНА ПИСАТЬ,ГЛАВНОЕ ТЫ МИНЯ ПАНИМАЕШЬ.

Подводя итог хочу сказать, что игра для любителей квестов-головоломок несомненно заслуживает внимания.
Общая оценка игре 10 руководительниц отеля из 10.

26005045.review:
Großartig!

Ich war Anfangs wirklich skeptisch, ob ein Remake wirklich gut werden würde, aber das wurde es. 

Ich mochte die Grafiken, die Musik und auch die Dialoge, auch wenn die Tonaufnahmen teilweise an Qualität zu wünschen übrig ließen (bspw. übersteuerung an machen Stellen). Dies hat aber dem Spielspaß keinen Abbruch getan. Auch die Musik-Auswahl war wirder toll und ich habe wieder einige Ohrwürmer zurückbehalten. 

Besonders gefiel mir, dass die Parallelen zu The Cat Lady deutlich wurden und das Ende meiner Meinung nach verbessert wurde, im Gegensatz zum Original.

Erwähnenswert ist auch, dass es verschiedenen Endings gibt und es vom Schwierigkeitsgrad als casual einzuordnen ist. Es gab keine Stelle, an der ich lange fest hing oder in einen Walktrough schauen musste, weswegen ich es in einem Rutsch durchspielen konnte. Vorrausgesetzt, man ist geduldig und verbeißt sich nicht in etwas. Alles ergibt sich im Laufe das Spiels von selbst.

Die Warnung vor Spielstart sollte ernst genommen werden, da Downfall nichts für schwache Mägen ist.

25828064.review:
My overall recommendation is a definite "yes" for horror fans, as it is a solid game, and is superior to most horror games released in the past few years.  It has a compelling story, comparatively strong character development, and an overall well-crafted (for an Indie game) presentation with some gruesome and effective moments.  Its greatest crime is being released after The Cat Lady, which is one of my favorite horror-adventure games of all time, and as such feels like a step backward.

The story, compelling as it may be, definitely comes across as a predecessor to The Cat Lady - which makes sense, since the original version was the first game released by the developer.  It lacks the subtlety and quiet character-building moments, and the themes are not nearly as deep or well-explored.  It does have an emotional impact, but because the supernatural/psychological horror elements are so relentless, the humanity of the characters and their interactions is diminished and therefore is less affecting than it could have been.  Of course, this is all relative to The Cat Lady; it is still an order of magnitude above the vast majority of Indie horror games.

The primary flaw, however, is the voice acting.  It ranges from decent to horrendous.  Ivy's VA was the only one that seemed like she consistently knew what she was doing; most other characters seemed like they were reading the script for the first time.  And the person who played Joe in the prologue was just godawful.  Also, things get a little silly toward the end, which undermines the otherwise deeply emotional climax.

I mainly focus on the cons because I loved The Cat Lady so much, but as I said, this is still a good horror game.  I do not know if it is possible to mute the voices, but if it is, I would recommend doing so.  The music is too good to completely turn off the sound, but the voice acting can be cringey at times.

25536717.review:
[h1] Review zu Downfall [/h1]

Downfall ist angesiedelt im Point & Click Genre und Teil der "Devil Came Through Here" Trilogie, wobei der letzte Teil aktuell noch in Produktion ist. Ein Release Datum für den 3. und letzten Teil Lorelai steht noch nicht fest. Es wird bei den Spielen selbst auch nicht wirklich ersichtlich, dass diese eben zusammen gehören, informiert man sich aber etwas genauer, bekommt man da den entscheidenden Tipp. Um gerade das Ende oder eines der Enden (ich kenne nur 1) besser zu verstehen, empfiehlt es sich, The Cat Lady zu spielen bevor man an Downfall heran geht.

In Downfall geht es um das Ehepaar Ivy und Joe Davis, dass seine Beziehung mit einem Romantischen Wochenende retten möchte. Wegen eines schlechten Unwetters, beschließen die beiden, die Nacht in einem Hotel am Land zu verbringen. Kaum angekommen, verhält sich Ivy äußerst komisch, sodass Joe nur noch schnell ins Zimmer möchte. Statt eines romantischen Abends eskaliert es zwischen den 2 Eheleuten, was in einem großen Streit endet. Am nächsten Morgen ist Ivy dann verschwunden. Und hier beginnt die große Suche für Joe.
Er trifft im Verlauf der Story auf viele schräge Figuren und wie auch schon bei "The Cat Lady" lässt das Spiel kaum eine Abartigkeit aus. 

Die Story selbst ist wieder einmal super, spannend, eklig und vor allem spiegelt sie in manchen Punkten unsere Gesellschaft wieder. R.Michalski spricht auch in diesem Meisterwerk wieder Themen an, die kein anderes Computerspiel so sehr behandelt. Vor allem mit den Themen Depression bzw. allgemein Psychische Störungen und Verbrechen aller Art wird man hier konfrontiert. Das kleine Entwicklerteam von Harvester Games lässt uns hier in die tiefsten Abgründe der Menschlichen Seele blicken.

Der Grafikstil ist wie schon bei The Cat Lady ganz was eigenes. Ja das Spiel ist sogar absolut hässlich. Aber darum geht es hier nicht. Und genau das macht das Spiel sogar ein bisschen aus. Diese "miserable" Zeichenkunst untermalt mit der sehr stimmigen Soundkulisse die gesamte Story und unterstreicht diese wiederum auf eine positive Weise. Ich weiß nicht, ob das Spiel noch genau so eine Wirkung hätte, würde man da mit Cinematics und Grafikstilen wie in AAA Titeln auffahren. Ich denke, da würde viel vom Charme verloren gehen.

[b]PRO [/b]
[list]
    [*]Super Story mit mehreren Enden, hat also Wiederspielwert
    [*]der Regulärpreis von 13,99 ist völlig in Ordnung - Spiel ist auch öfter mal im Sale, wer trotzdem etwas sparen möchte kann da Bedenkenlos zuschlagen
    [*]Ein Spieldurchlauf beträgt ca. 5 Std., allerdings gibt es mehrere Enden und da empfiehlt es sich, es öfter zu spielen
    [*]Viele Steam Erfolge
[/list]

[b]CONTRA [/b]
[list]
    [*]Leider nur eine Fixeinstellung bei der Auflösung, man kann zwar im Vollbild spielen, hat jedoch je nach Bildschirmgröße einen kleineren oder größeren Rand.
    [*]In den Sequenzen wo man Agnes steuert und mit etwas interagiert "freezt" das Bild. Es hängt sich nichts auf, aber optisch tut es etwas weh....
[/list]

[b]FAZIT [/b]
Mir persönlich hat es viel Spaß gemacht, ich hab es gleich in einem durch gespielt und ich bin schon gespannt auf die anderen Enden. Wenn ich euch mit meiner Review jetzt neugierig gemacht haben sollte, guckt euch trotzdem noch mal kurz einen Trailer oder ein Gameplay Video an, nur um zu sehen, ob ihr mit diesem "Stil" auch leben könnt. Die Grafik in diesem Spiel ist nicht jedermanns Sache! Mir gefällt es wie es ist, allerdings habe ich schon bei anderen gelesen, dass sie nach 10 Minuten aufhören mussten, weil sie das nicht ertragen konnten ;)
Für diejenigen denen das Optische nicht so wichtig ist wie die Story: Kauft es euch!

25416942.review:
Психоделическая история в лучших традициях книг Стивена Кинга, рассказывающая о любви обычной пары у которой отношения пошли под откос. Чтобы спасти их они решают провести отпуск вдвоем в загородном отеле "Тихая Гавань". Гнетущая атмосфера и сюжетные твисты не дадут заскучать всем ценителям хорошо написанных триллеров. Эту игру можно сравнивать с серией "Silent Hill", можно найти в ней что то от рассказа "1408", но это не делает эту игру менее самобытной, а скорее добавляет ей особого шарма. 

Игра стоит потраченных денег и ценителям хорошего сюжета точно придется по вкусу. К тому же купив обновленную версию этой игры, вы также получите оригинал 2009 года который по моему личному мнению во многих аспектах лучше обновленной версии, хоть и уступает ей в графическом плане. И по сути это две совершенно разные игры имеющие одну и ту же основу. 

Несмотря на то что игра имеет несколько концовок, финал никого не оставит равнодушным и ощущения будут как от просмотра отличного фильма который однажды точно захочется пересмотреть вновь. 

[h1]Итог:[/h1] 8 кошачьих черепов из 10 ремейку 2016 года и 10 из 10 версии 2009 года (на волне ностальгии). 

P.S. Хотелось бы посоветовать начинать именно с версии 2009 года, а после пройти версию 2016 года для получения максимального удовольствия от повествования, но всё же решать вам.

25380113.review:
Downfall:
~~~~~~~~ 
   
Joe and Ivy Davis have been married for several years but their marriage has not been smooth sailing for a while. Ivy has not been herself lately as bad memories from the past keep haunting her. Joe organized a small vacation at the “Quiet Haven Hotel” in an attempt to work out their marriage. As they arrive at the “Quiet Haven Hotel”, they are welcomed by an incredible storm and heavy rain. Could this be an omen for what is to come? 
 
Downfall is a point and click/rich story/adventure game where you play the character of Joe Davis. 
First you will play a prologue (tutorial) where you will learn how to interact with other characters and as well as how use items from your inventory. In the prologue, you will be told how Joe and Ivy met for the first time when they were but spring chickens. It will also outlay Ivy’s prime concern at this particular time of her life, and what happened to Robbie, Joe’s little brother.

Then you will get a short, effective intro which will give you the feel of how the atmosphere will be portrayed in the game. As you enter the lobby of the hotel, Ivy will act in very strange ways, speaking in an incoherent manner and then back to normal several times. After speaking with manager, Joe will move up to their room and head off to bed. After a while dreaming, he wakes up in the room alone. From here, Joe will need to find out where his troubled wife is. 

Throughout this dark adventure, Joe will meet interesting characters to talk to in hope of saving Ivy. There is Doctor Z, who conducts brain transplants; Agnes, who does not know Joe but will party with him; as well as other intriguing personalities.  Most of the story will be in the hotel, but Joe will also visit places on the outside, keeping you alert and entertained. 

Downfall look goods graphically with its peculiar atmosphere. All the mechanisms are easy to control with your keyboard. The highest resolution you can play this game is 800X600. The voiceover could have been better. 

Positives:
~~~~~~~~~~

-	Good & Interesting Story
-	Easy interface to use
-	Good graphics and atmosphere
-	Achievements & trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~~~
 
-	Puzzles could have been harder
-	Highest resolution is 800X600
-	Voiceover could have better

If you enjoy a rich story with a freaky atmosphere and strange characters, then downfall should be in your game library.

7/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

25114828.review:
Downfall est clairement un jeu d'une rare qualité. Encore plus dans le milieu du jeu dit "d'horreur". Si Vous n'avez rien contre quelques frissons mais que les screameurs à répétition et que le gore aguicheur vous procure l'ennuis, alors nous avons ça en commun. Downfall est très loin de tout cela. Downfall construit une histoire riche qui amène une ambiance sombre et malsaine sans jamais tombé dans la facilité du screameur. Les personnages sont intéressants, même lorsqu'ils apparaissent peu de temps à l'écran.
Autre point intéressant, le propos de l'histoire. En fait j'ai été très impressionné qu'une histoire aussi riche puisse être construite sur ce propos (que je ne révelerai pas pour éviter le spoil) pas que le propos soit dérengeant ou insignifiant. C'est juste que c'est un propos qui n'est que peu traité dans n'importe quel média et en général il est même très mal traité, ce qui n'est clairement pas le cas de Downfall ou le propos est porté par l'histoire et les personnages.
Quant à l'hestétique, pas grand chose à redire. Le noir est blanc est parfait pour ce type de jeu, les graphismes sont beaucoup moins austères que pour the cat lady (ce qui n'était déjà pas un problème en soit mais qui pouvait rebuter certains joueurs) et le coté "collage" rend très bien.
Le gameplay est à mi-chemin entre le jeu d'aventure et le point and click car est géré uniquement avec le clavier. Les contrôles peuvent étonner mais ils sont au final très bien pensés pour ce type de jeu.

Le seul point négatif que j'ai noté se tourne du coté de certains choix. En fait surtout un choix, celui d'avoir mis des sortes de clips musicaux sur certains passages. (attention je risque de dévoiler quelques éléments mineurs du jeux) au final seuls les "clips" sur la scène de la quatrième Sophie et du générique de fin sont appropriés. Mais celui du mixeur, par exemple, fait franchement tâche il faut dire.

25011922.review:
Cavalcando il successo di The Cat Lady che li ha consacrati nel panorama videoludico, il team di Harvester Games ha deciso di riprendere in mano la sua prima creatura, [b]Downfall[/b], risalente al 2009, al fine di renderla quanto più fedele possibile allo stile opulento e lugubre alla base del modus operandi del team polacco.
Il risultato finale non vela in alcun modo il suo marcato collegamento con The Cat Lady, intuibile non solo dal restyling adoperato a livello di rappresentazione estetica, atmosfera e meccaniche di gioco, ma anche dalla presenza di alcuni personaggi noti e di tematiche appartenenti al lato oscuro e opprimente della vita. 

Nei panni del marito di una coppia sull’orlo dello sfascio, ci ritroveremo a muovere i nostri passi all’interno di un mondo distopico incarnato in un hotel, avviluppato in un contesto malsano e innaturale e da uno stile sempre più cruento ed esplicito, in cui solo il rosso sangue alternerà le ambientazioni in bianco e nero.
La contrapposizione tra morte e sesso rappresenta solo uno dei temi portanti dell’intera vicenda, elemento atto a veicolare il giocatore all’interno di un amore che trascende la follia e l’ossessione e trasmette lascive e oscure sensazioni di un realtà al contempo surreale, funesta e sinistra, il tutto magistralmente sostenuto da una scenografia e da una colonna sonora sempre coerenti.

Sebbene il fascino atipico e la profondità di The Cat Lady non siano stati scalfiti, Downfall riesce ad imbrigliare l’essenza principale che lo anima, attestandosi come un prodotto al di sopra della media e meritevole d’attenzioni e confermando il talento di Harvester Games nel saper emozionare e coinvolgere il giocatore attraverso il proprio modo di concepire gli horror a sfondo psicologico.

Voto: 8.5

25002363.review: Downfall é um jogo incrível e concerteza um dos meus jogos 2D favoritos, sério o gráfico é super simples mas a arte é bonita da mesma forma, a história é muito boa com um final incrível, ele é muito figurativo abordando temas sérios como anorexia, muito bizarro e concerteza tem uma carga de terror psicológico grande sendo perturbador para alguns, se você tem certa sensibilidade não jogue não vale a pena pois você ficara muito desconfortavél. (se você se sentir confortavél jogando você é doente! procure um psicologo! kkkk zuera)

24822349.review:
Prima di iniziare la recensione un po' di storia
Downfall è nato nel 2009 con una grafica un po' così così, e con un gameplay da punta e clicca.
Il gioco in questione ha fatto un discreto successo, così facendo lo sviluppatore del gioco (Ramigiusz Michalsky) è riuscito a fare un altro gioco, The Cat Lady (che vi consiglio di giocare prima di downfall).
Finito Cat Lady è ritornato a fare una sorta di Remake di Downfall, dove la trama sarà più o meno la medesima ma con molti cambiamenti (anche per la grafica, personaggi, gameplay, e così via).

Essendomi piaciuto veramente tanto The cat lady, ho deciso di acquistare a prezzo intero quest'altro gioco, ho fatto bene? andiamo a scoprirlo

[h1]Pro[/h1]

[b]-La trama del gioco[/b] è molto... bhè confusa.
La trama narra di questa coppia di persone che hanno problemi nel loro rapporto, e per poterli risolvere provano a farsi una vacanza in questo hotel, si noterà da subito che c'è qualcosa di sinistro, qualcosa di paranormale... o saranno solo illusioni?
Mi sono piaciuti tanto gli argomenti che tratterà questo gioco, per quanto possano essere "banali" per alcune persone.

[b]-L'atmosfera del gioco[/b] sarà molto disturbante, angosciante, e riesce a farvi immergere abbastanza nel terrore.
Come al solito consiglio di giocarlo verso sera per avere un "immersione" più profonda.
Non ci saranno jumpscare vari, ma bensì momenti disturbanti da terrorizzarvi.

[b]-I personaggi[/b] in questo gioco li ho trovati molto profondi. Sia il protagonista, sia i personaggi secondari, e sia i "mostri".

[b]Lo stile grafico[/b] rimane sempre in 2D come The Cat lady, con delle animazioni un po' migliorate.
Messo nei Pro più che altro perchè questa grafica riesce ugualmente a dare l'atmosfera horror giusta colorando solo pochissime cose nel gioco.

[b]Infine la soundtrack[/b], nel gioco è azzeccata benissimo, molte sono "disturbanti", altre invece sono messe semplicemente bene nelle scene che vedremo nel gioco (tranne in una che non mi ha convinto tanto).

[b]Chicca per la versione di Steam[/b]: acquistando il gioco avrete nella vostra libreria pure il Downfall del 2009, purtroppo solo in inglese.

[h1]Passiamo ai "contro"[/h1]

Come in The Cat Lady, [b]le opzioni del gioco saranno povere.[/b] La risoluzione presente è di 800x600, e le opzioni si limiteranno solo alla gamma del gioco e alla lingua.

[b]La trama per quanto mi è piaciuta, l'ho trovata fin troppo aperta,[/b] dove puoi ipotizzare veramente tante teorie ma non saprai mai quale può essere la più "giusta".
Non lo considero un contro del gioco, ma un contro più personale visto che avrei preferito una trama un pò più chiusa come in The Cat Lady.

[b]La longevità[/b] si basa sulle 3 ore di gioco.

[b]La difficoltà del gioco è troppo facile,[/b]  non ci saranno rompicapi da far concentrare tanto il cervello. Probabilmente l'hanno messa così facile per i non amanti del genere, riuscendo a far godere il titolo pure alle persone a cui non piace risolvere rompicapi troppo difficili.

[b]Il prologo del gioco[/b] (una scena che inizia prima di andare dal menù) è inutile e non verrà più ripescato nel gioco, potete pure saltarla.

[h1]Conclusione[/h1]
Questa sorta di avventura grafica (facilissima) mi è piaciuta , anche se molto di meno rispetto a the cat lady.
Consiglio di acquistarlo (magari non sopra i 6 euro per la sua longevità) perchè raramente si vedono storie/horror di questo tipo in questa categoria di giochi.

[h1]7.5/10[/h1]

24752549.review:
NO SPOILERS

Note: The resolution is fixed and cannot be changed. They seemed to realize this and put a black border around the rest of the screen and just have the game in the fixed resolution in the center. Which was a good idea. You can play in windowed mode but its still fixed to a certain size and its better to play fullscreen with the black background.
 I enjoyed it much more on my laptop than playing with a monitor and separate keyboard. It was hard to see the details on the monitor since the gamewindow is so small. On laptop its much better though since the screen is smaller....still 1080p native but my laptop screen is smaller and the game is therefore bigger on my screen and easier to see. It really is a treat to look at the game and see all the details, so a screen you can really get close to and see and play on like a laptop is a good idea. plus it plays well with a laptop keyboard. This shouldn't be a deal breaker, as the experience is amazing. Try the demo if you want though to make sure.

Note: very few setup options in general for the game. setup can only be accessed through the steam launcher....if u use shortcuts u will never know there was a setup. You also can't access setup/options unless ur on the mainscreen. And you can't access the mainscreen unless you close and restart the game.

Story felt very very refined and well organized. Would highly recommend it to everyone, even the people who didn't like catlady's story.

Very poetic and artistic game that felt like a movie. And its a really good movie. It is a bit different than the catlady, but honestly its also very much the same....so i wouldn't feel threatened by the reviews saying "i dislike this game but loved the catlady since this game isn't the same". Don't pay them any mind. Honeslty I think its crazy after playing it to not like it and like catlady....i can easily see people saying the opposite, infact im more inclined to think more will like downfall than the catlady since downfall has a male protagonist, which is depressing but its true.

 If enjoyed catlady definitely u have to play this game. Controls are exactly the same as catlady, same gameplay and everything just the story and dynamic sequences/cutaways are maybe a bit more fluid and refined in downfall. The whole downfall experience feels a bit shorter than catlady did but its not a big deal. You feel more grounded in downfall compared to catlady.....its very reminscient of resident evil 1.

Very good experience. We need more games like this one. Very impressive game and standalone experience. Downfall honestly sems to appeal more to male demographic, while catlady appeals more to the female demographic. Hpoefully you don't overlook either game. Ну я вот я все-таки решил написать еще один обзорчик)(зная что никто его наверное не прочитает),ну ладно я отвлекся.

24368224.review:
Downfall (Remake) is one of my favorite games on steam.
Story: Joe and Ivy Davis visit Quiet Haven Hotel to refresh their marriage. After a huge fight Ivy is gone and it’s up to Joe to find her in this nightmare.

Pros:
- great sad story with dark themes
- gloomy atmosphere and fantastic horror
- some nice morbid puzzles which fit perfectly in this disturbing experience
- outstanding soundtrack
- interesting characters
- three endings based on your decisions
- optional help system (though the puzzles are pretty easy)
- including original Downfall (2009) 

Cons:
- some spoken dialogue is either recorded poorly or not well pronounced
- maybe too easy for adventure pros

If you like grotesque horror and games with dark themes such as Silent Hill 2 and The Cat Lady, this one’s definitively for you!


Nominated for the "Whoa, dude!" award

24353516.review: The first negative impressions of this game, and which remained throughout it, were firstly the inelegant interface. It’s a point and click adventure in which you can neither point nor click - no mouse support at all! One can save progress, but never delete, and even saving with the same name just makes multiple saves with that name. The “Prologue” is started every time the game is loaded, as is my native language queried, which hasn’t changed since the last time I played. These may seem minor, but it gives a very cheap feel to the game. The second most pertinent issue is the unnatural animations for characters walking. It really looks very artificial. The “Black and white and red” style has been done too often before for it to be innovative. It is a game not about graphics however, it is about the story, but here it didn’t particularly shine either: it lacked coherence and was ultimately disappointing. Perhaps if I had bought and completed “Cat Lady” it might have been more meaningful but I am far from encouraged to do so. The voice acting has been criticised but I didn’t find any fault with it: not everyone can have a pleasingly euphonic voice and so if anything it is more convincing to have voice actors with less harmonious voices.

24061131.review:
После прохождения The Cat Lady я не задумываясь решила купить эту замечательную игру, которая рассказывает о персонаже, фигурирующем в CL в качестве соседа главной героини.

Игра начинается с того, что нам показывают главного героя -- Джо Д. -- и его жену Айви, с которой у них, мягко говоря, проблемы в отношениях. Проблемы связаны с Айви и ее психическим здоровьем. И вот разработчики, как и в CL, возвращаются к вопросу о психических заболеваниях. На этот раз они рассматривают тему анорексии. 

Мне очень понравилось, как разработчики смогли преподнести эту тему игроку. (дальше возможны спойлеры) Вот есть девушка, хорошенькая девушка, зовут ее Айви, и с виду она совсем уж обычная. Но нет, у Айви проблемы, серьезные проблемы -- она не верит людям, когда они говорят, что она красивая; она не ест целыми днями и считает каждую калорию. А когда Айви смотрится в зеркало, она видит ужасного монстра -- отвратительного, необъятно толстого, того, кем она себя ошибочно считает. И, как и должно быть в нормальных человеческих отношениях, Джо приходит на помощь своей возлюбленной. 

Сюжет очень порадовал, как и в случае с CL. Также очень понравилась обновленная картинка -- персонажи приняли куда более божеский вид(хотя в CL мне больше нравилось, как они выглядят) да и в принципе окружение стало более красивым и приятным глазу. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=716382921

Сохранилась мрачная история, атмосфера и приятная музыка, что не могло не радовать. А еще парочка знакомых персонажей и моментов с явными отсылками к The Cat Lady, что также заставило лишний раз улыбнуться. 

Рекомендую к покупке тем, кому понравилась The Cat Lady -- вы точно не останетесь разочарованными (:

24050561.review:
[h1]Ein Remake der damaligen 2009-Downfall-Auflage vom "The Cat Lady"-Entwickler R. Michalski![/h1] 

Das Spiel, welches den Titel "Downfall" (dt. Untergang, Sturz oder Platzregen) trägt, ist im Jahre 2016 nur für den PC erschienen, und von dem polnischen Studio namens "Harvester Games", unter der Leitung von Rem Michalski, entwickelt worden. 
Es stammt von demselben Macher (R. Michalski), der auch 2012 das Spiel namens "The Cat Lady" entwickelt hatte.
Zu Beginn muss ich sofort erwähnen, dass das Spiel ein REMAKE ist! 
Denn das originale Spiel kam bereits 2009, ebenfalls nur für den PC, heraus.
Vom Genre her ist das Spiel eher ein 2D-Psycho-Horror-, Point & Click-, Adventure-Game.
Der Protagonist des Spiels ist Joe Davis.
Story-Technisch handelt es sich um einen jungen Mann namens "Joe", der ein romantisches, gemeinsames Wochenende mit seiner Ehefrau Ivy, in einem Hotel verbringen möchte.
Mit diesem Wochenend-Ausflug versucht Joe, seine Zuneigung zu Ivy zu beweisen, und möchte die Ehe wieder neu aufblühen lassen.
Doch nichts verläuft, wie geplant. Denn noch in derselben Nacht, streiten die beiden sich, und am nächsten Morgen ist Ivy plötzlich verschwunden.
Seltsame und übernatürliche Vorkommnisse geschehen von nun an im Hotel, und Joe versucht, mit allen Mitteln seine Ivy zu finden.
Im folgenden Verlauf, möchte ich gerne auf meine positive Perzeption näher eingehen.
Zunächst muss ich gestehen, dass ich mit skeptischen Gedanken an das Spiel herangegangen bin, da ich das Original von damals in und auswendig kenne, und der Trailer, für meinen ersten Eindruck, leider viel zu sehr auf "modern" getrimmt war.
Und genau dieses "moderne, für Mainstream-Leute-getrimmte" Gefühl, haben die davorigen Spiele (The Cat Lady von 2012 & Downfall von 2009) mir niemals vermittelt!
Zum Glück wurde ich, während des Spielens, eines besseren belehrt!
Denn um ehrlich zu sein, bin ich, wie immer, von Harvester Games dermaßen begeistert, dass ich seine Spiele, von R. Michalski, abgöttisch liebe!!!
Was ich besonders an seinen Spielen liebe, ist der Art-Style!
Das Spiel ist die meiste Zeit über in Schwarz-Weiß gehalten worden, nur starke Farbpigmente, wie beispielsweise rot, oder besondere schlüssel-Gegenstände/Accesoires/Augen, sind farbig zu sehen.
Diese Darstellung allein, veranlasst schon zu vielen Interpretations-Hypothesen und trägt zur gruseligen Atmosphäre sehr gut bei!
Ein weiterer postiver Aspekt ist die Story!
Da, wo die Mainstream-Hirnlos-Menschen mehr auf HD-Grafik achten, bin ich jemand, der wirklich sehr stark auf die Story achtet!
Es ist wie der Mensch selbst zu vergleichen: 
Die meisten Menschen achten nur auf Äußerlichkeiten, setzen ihren ganzen Fokus auf das äußere Erscheinungsbild, und verpassen dadurch die Charaktereigenschaften, die ein Mensch eigentlich ausmachen.
Die wahre Schönheit liegt im Charakter, in der Persönlichkeit selbst, die man nicht sehen kann, sondern zu spüren bekommt.
So ist es auch mit Downfall. Ich bin mir sicher, dass sehr viele Menschen, Spiele von Harvester Games, kaum Beachtung schenken, da diese ja nicht in 60FPS und 12K Auflösung sind.
Doch die Geschichten, die diese Spiele mitsich tragen, sind die besten, die ich jemals erleben durfte!
Denn die Handlungen in diesen Spielen sind, im positiven Sinne, erinnerungswürdig!
Und ICH selbst, kann mich, in gewisser Weise, mit den Charakteren identifizieren.
R. Michalski zeigt die Psyche eines Menschens, und scheut sich nicht, die bittere, kranke Wahrheit und Grausamkeit der Menschen darzustellen.
Die Hauptthematik in seinen Spielen befassen sich immer mit psychischen Erkrankungen, und dessen Auswirkungen.
Das schätze ich immens an ihm, da die meisten Spiele sich mit solch tiefgreifenden, komplexen Themen nicht befassen.
Besonders beeindruckend empfinde ich die vielen Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten, die auch wirklich zum Spielverlauf beitragen, und nicht nur eine Illusion sind.
Es gibt drei verschiedene Enden zu erreichen.
Wie man welches Ende erreicht, hängt von deinen Dialog-Antworten, und deine Vorgehensweisen, ab.
Kommen wir nun zum Soundtrack.
Leider muss ich auch hierbei wieder schwärmen, da ich die musikalische Untermalung als sehr gelungen empfinde, denn der Soundtrack passt sich der Situation an. 
Wenn ich ehrlich bin, dann hatte ich manchmal sogar das Gefühl, als ob man industriale, gruselige, verstörende Klänge, wie Akira Yamaoka das mit Silent Hill tat, perfekt nachgemacht hat.
Des weiteren bin ich von der Synchronisation überwältigt worden!
Die Stimmen klingen professionell, passen zu den Charakteren, und man hört KEINEN Synchronsprecher doppelt!
Wenn ich so daran denke, dass das originale Downfall KEINE Synchronsprecher hatte, dann merkt man auf jeden Fall einen Fortschritt.
Allgemein habe ich alle Harvester Games-Spiele, in der Reihenfolge, wie sie herausgekommen sind, gespielt.
Somit sah ich sogar bereits schon bei "The Cat Lady" große Fortschritte!
Zum Schluss möchte ich noch auf die schlüssigen Rätsel eingehen.
Die Rätsel sind gut nachvollziehbar und halten somit nicht allzu lange vom Spielfortschritt auf.
Nun möchte ich auf die negativen Eindrücke des Spiels eingehen. 
Doch wenn ich ehrlich bin, habe ich für mich persönlich nur einen negativen Punkt beim Spielen entdeckt.
Und zwar ist es die Programierung bzw. Animation des Laufens. 
Zu Beginn des Spiels ruckelt das Laufen stark, aber umso länger man es spielt, desto mehr verschwindet diese ruckelige Lauf-Animation.

Abschließend ist also zu sagen, dass das Downfall-Remake ein sehr gelungenes Spiel, mit einzigartigem Art-Style, tollen Soundtracks und Synchronsprechern, ein ehrwürdiges Remake von der originalen Version ist!
Mit einer Spielzeit von ungefähr 8 bis 10 Stunden, bietet es eine packende, schaurige, fesselnde und vielschichtige Story, die zur Eigen-Interpretation und zum Nachdenken anregt! 
Ich persönlich, bin von diesem Spiel beeindruckt worden, und sehe keine einzige Minute, die ich diesem Spiel gewidmet habe, als Zeitverschwendung an!
Ganz im Gegenteil! Viel mehr fühlt es sich für mich so an, als ob dieses Spielerlebnis eine Bereicherung für meine Gefühle und Denkensweise ist!
Ich empfehle dieses Spiel also an jedem weiter, der sich gerne mit Psycho-Horror Geschichten gruseln lässt, aber auch gleichzeitig eine sinn-, und anspruchsvolle Story miterleben möchte, die nicht allzu schwierige Rätsel beinhaltet! (o^.^o)

24031753.review:
As a fan of Cat Lady, I had high expectations for this game and they were mostly met.

Pros:
-the cast of characters. Joe has the charisma of a rock, but the supporting cast does a great job of keeping dialogue interesting.
-background music. There are more ambient tracks and song used than in the cat lady, and some additional plot progress actually depends on listening closely.
-over-all visuals. The game is not very colorful, but when it does vary from the grayscale, the effect looks great. I'm a big fan of merging 2D and 3D imagery for the backgrounds too.
-replay value. There are multiple endings, and getting something other than the default one requires a lot of exploration.
-your choices really do matter!
-quick saves and loads. Because of the requirements for multiple endings, these are a lifesaver. You won't ruin your perfect ending by accidentally clicking the wrong choice!
-voice acting acting is mostly very well done but...

Cons:
-the audio quality ranges from good to terrible. Some of the scenes were ruined because a supposedly emotional line had a bathroom-like echo to it.
-3D animation looked out of place to me, especially the bit of walking down stairs to the cellar. I had to backtrack several times because I forgot things, and had to watch it everytime. It just doesn't match the overall style in my opinion.

Nitpicks!
-the prologue/tutorial chapter. The twist at the end felt like nothing because I didn't care for the characters and I felt like the characters didnt like each other.
-some character art/animation felt out of place: your companion sure smiled a lot even while clearly in distress

24001243.review:
A aparência simples de Downfall carrega consigo a verdadeira essência do horror: O terror psicológico, que é cada vez menos utilizado na industria de games e até mesmo de filmes.

O terror que Downfall transmite envolve muito mais seus sentimentos e emoções do que o terror forçado do qual estamos tão acostumados e até mesmo entediados com, o famoso terror com "jumpscares", usados de maneira excessiva, forçada, e um tanto quanto previsíveis na grande maioria das vezes.

Downfall é o complemento perfeito e tão aguardado para a trama de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/vaktmastare/recommended/253110/]The Cat Lady[/url], da qual eu recomendo muito que você jogue antes, pois a trama se tornará ainda mais rica e lógica pra você, muitos dos personagens já foram vistos no jogo antecessor, mas, o mais importante, é que você verá como a cabeça do protagonista de Downfall, Joe Davis, realmente funciona, pois você a verá pela perspectiva de Susan Ashworth, saberá toda a verdade por traz de sua personalidade, e saberá mais sobre sua história com sua esposa, a Ivy.

Falando em Joe, seu objetivo no game vai ser simplesmente passar um tempo com sua esposa num hotel barato e bem estranho, Ivy parece psicologicamente afetada, e cabe a você, ajudá-la ou repudiá-la, lembrando que suas atitudes e ações interferem no final do game.

O começo do jogo pode parecer entediante pra você, mas continue, os diálogos chatinhos fazem parte da construção da trama, e em questão de minutos, sua vida vai virar de cabeça pra baixo, o terror começa. Visualmente brutal, as cenas de morte são chocantes mesmo na simplicidade 2D do game; ambientes sombrios e muitas conversas insensatas, uma trama controversa que vai te comover e te surpreender.

Ainda há também personagens fofos e carismáticos que vão derreter seu coração, há momentos bonitos no game, que tratam-se de um equilíbrio emocional que o jogo gera, e quando você menos esperar, tudo o que você sentia por alguém pode mudar, as aparências enganam, e Downfall vai te enganar o tempo todo, e é disso que o jogo se trata, de te enganar e mostrar os diferentes pontos de vista de uma mesma história, vista cada hora de um personagem diferente, é uma questão de perspectiva, e caberá a você julgar qual ponto de vista é o verdadeiro.

[i][b]Se gostou da análise, siga-me no meu perfil de [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/7752392-The-Caretaker/]Curador![/url]

Aviso:[/b] Essa análise está protegida pela legislação brasileira sobre direito autoral. Proibida a reprodução do conteúdo em qualquer meio de comunicação, eletrônico ou impresso, sem autorização expressa do autor.[/i]

23952443.review:
A heart wrenching dish to be savored. Probably once.

+++PROS+++
R. Michalski serves us again a point and click adventure with sweet bloody themes and photographic visual that propels our characters through emotions to dwell upon. 

Also in keeping with his take on player choices, you will not always know what to do to get the ending you want; the choices matter, and it's not like Mass Effect's GOOD GUY BAD GUY choices. You will sweat to make your choices.

There is a new quick save stat that players can use to make choices easier. In The Cat Lady, you cycled through menus after long dialogue sequences. Here, you press a button whenever you can.

His Tarantino like juxtaposition of upbeat music in insane situations continues. The soundtrack is delicious. At different moments when appropriate, it is sensitive, dark, scary, calming, and otherworldly, and sometimes rockin'.

This game is shorter than The Cat Lady, and much more concise; the story never drags, and the puzzles won't bamboozle you; Cat Lady had a few of those.

It seems as if the game was made with large expectancy of its players being fans of The Cat Lady. As such, fans will enjoy the awesome connections to that game, for epic moments big and small. It seems as if Michalski's preparing to build a universe here. On the other hand, it may bother some players that there was too much fanservice, putting in the much loved Cat Lady.

---CONS---
The endings were a little punishing, with the only likable one being the hard to get Golden Ending. Thankfully, I can choose for myself what I'd like to believe as canon.

The story is a lot weirder and has even more unanswered questions than The Cat Lady.

There are some parts where the dialogue and voice action isn't fully realistic, but that doesn't bother me. The reason it doesn't is because the game is stylized, and the level of realism in voice acting is not inconsistent with the level of realism in everything else. These are characters, interesting characters, not real people, who have their own ways of talking that make them stand out. Joe Davis might just be a really weird guy who speaks in that overly nonchalant way.

The story is a bit predictable, especially with what trailers have shown. Still, it can be interesting to see how it happens, even if you can vaguely guess what will happen.

I found it hard to care about Ivy. Then again, I think this was part of the point, that people around depressed people get hurt too. This game has taught me that unhappy people are unpleasant. I suppose this isn't really a flaw, except that it kinda messes with the motivation.

23878951.review:
[h1]Review written on Monday, Jun 27th, 2016[/h1]

[h1]Review[/h1]

I haven't played the original version released in 2009 yet, so I can't compare it to the Steam one, released in 2016.
But I can tell you that this is a great game.
People tend to compare it to The Cat Lady, not only because they share the same developer, Harverster Games, but also because Downfall is a prequel to The Cat Lady (Joe Davis is Susan Ashworth's next door neighbor).
While The Cat Lady talks about depression, Downfall talks about love, madness and murder.

Downfall is a psychological horror game that tells you the story of Joe Davis and his wife, Ivy.
Their marriage is on a bad situation and Joe tries to save it going on a romantic getaway.
However, when they get to the Quiet Haven Hotel you realize that it's a weird place, not romantic as Joe desired.
Ivy starts to behave strangely and after an argument, she disappears in the hotel.
Now you need to solve a few puzzles to find your wife.

8/10

[*]Great soundtrack
[*]Multiple endings
[*]Achievements

[/olist]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

23671276.review:
Downfall is the prequel to The Cat Lady, expanding on the universe by going into the story of Joe and Ivy Davis, Susan Ashworth's next door neighbors. This is the remade and redone version of the original point and click adventure game, giving it the same format as The Cat Lady's keyboard mechanics. Given The Cat Lady's quiet success, it'd be easy for fans to compare the two to see how it has improved. So has it?

Let's look at the story, first, as most people will tend to compare to The Cat Lady here. Is it as good as the first? Yes. Is it as dreary and drepressing? No, because this falls under a different theme. While TCL was about the challenges of depression and melancholly, this story is more rough, touching on the subjects of anorexia, vice, the burden of the past and psychopathy. This game is much more "in your face" because of this, as evidenced by the last scene of the prologue. That being said, the story is still fantastic to go through and the characters are all well made in my opinion.

Mechanically, the game is a HUGE step up fro TCL. The functions are much more fluid and the graphics are a bit clearer. The game introduces a quicksave and autosave function, which is very helpful in the event that you have to leave. Also, dialouge isn't too long winded as some in TCL, where you may be sitting there for longer than anticipated because of a longer story and forget to save. It is more spread out and easier to take a break from.

As for the visual design, the characters are no longer animated like puppets with moving pieces, instead being done but animated 2D art, which are much more clearer and crisp than in TCL. The color pallete is what you expect from the game as well, but it doesn't veer too much from the black and white as often as TCL. One issue with TCL was some of it's color choices being too sporadic and lacking identity, but I'm actually going to say that Downfall might have taken a bit too much back. Still, the backgrounds look as if they were photographed and edited, which was a must for this game. And, of course, there are some good greusome bits of blood and gore and disturbing stuff.

As for sound, they did a much better job this time around. They used a much wider array of sound effects. As for the voice acting, it is on the whole better, but there are still some actors that either weren't that good or the audio quality was lacking. Still, it is an improvement in general, as some of the voice acting is very good, easily outweighing the bad. The music is very good too.

As for the puzzles, they are well thought out. I didn't find myself too stumped, nor did I find any of them to be ridiculously easy. One of the puzzles that I found engaging was the dialogue throughout the game. What you say and do in the game will affect the game's ending, and some of the choices leading to the Golden Ending are easily missed because you thought you were doing something right. It doesn't change the actually gameplay, per se, but it is a puzzle in itself to achieve an ending that you want/

So, Downfall, is it good? Indeed it is, and it is worth it. It doesn't follow The Cat Lady's theme to the letter, but it makes the choice of using its own theme to decide how it should play, therefore making itself its own game.

23553256.review:
[quote=author]Это безумие, Джо. Давай попробуем насладиться им, пока мы можем[/quote]

Цитата, взятая из [b]Downfall	[/b] чертовски верно описывает всю игру, включая сюжет, стилистику, музыку и саму идею.
Как и оригинальный Downfall, ремейк остался таким же эксцентричным и так же бросает вам вызов своим психологическим сюжетом и психоделической подачей. 
Это романтический хоррор, больная любовь (как к себе, так и к ближнему), называйте как хотите, но он обязательно после прохождения оставит вам много времени для рассуждений. Я и по сей день задумываюсь, можно ли в конечном итоге обвинять главных героев в том, что они совершили, и каковы на это были реальные причины. 
Постепенно находя ответы на сюжетные вопросы (да-да, на самом деле, если вникнуть, то с легкостью весь сюжет для понимания всплывает наружу, то есть необязательно, как кто-то в отзывах написал, играть для этого часов 30, перепроходя все заново), вам станет больно, если проникнетесь духом самой болезни. Наверное, у [b]Harvester Games[/b] лучшая подача психических заболеваний в своих играх, вызванные проблемами, которые могут возникнуть у любого человека (не дай Бог) и в этом и есть весь хоррор игры. 
Ценителям The Cat Lady, которые не знакомы с оригинальным Downfall, я в первую очередь посоветую ремейк. Мало того, что он пропитан атмосферой кошатницы, но и в качестве маленьких бонусов вы сможете увидеть много отсылок к ней, таких как локации, вещи, сюжетные повороты и [spoiler]даже саму нашу любимую Сьюзен![/spoiler]

[i]Плюсы:	[/i]

    [*]Оригинальный сюжет остался неизмененным 
    [*]Две бонусные концовки, которые зависят от вашего характера
    [*]Музыкальное сопровождение как всегда на высшем уровне
    [*]Дополнительный контент в виде различных материалов разработчиков и немного их биографии
    [*]Некоторое переплетения временной линии с  The Cat Lady
    [*]Удобный гемплей, инвентарь больше не будет мешать тому, кому мешал ;)
    [*]Возможность поиграть в оригинальный Downfall!

23530445.review:
Ok, before you, fanboys and vanilla girls, start taping with your fat fingers smth like YOU WRONG GTFO ITS MESTERPIECE, let me explain why my opinion here is in a red box instead of a blue one.

Downfall'09 was a great game. Despite poor visuals and unpolished plot, it was a uniqe experience I've never encountered in videogames before. It was scary, humorous, even enjoyably stupid B-movie style sometimes. Most important - this game knew what it wanted to be and never changed its' tone until the very end. Even now, after seven years, it stands as a perfect "study in scarlet" for Harvester Games.

Unfortunately, Rem doesn't feel the same way. As a matter of fact, he called it "kinda sh1t" in 2015, couple of months before this remake was released.

To begin with, nobody asked for anoher Downfall. And those who did lied to themselves. Because we all waited for another  Cat Lady. Everybody wanted to burst into tears once again and follow tragic characters who overcome not only disgusting villians but their own demons as well. Which brings us to the 1st major problem of the Downfall'16.

This game doesn't know what it wants to be. It manages to catch the spirit of the original, but strikes hard to push it in chains of a different narrative. The result is not only plotholes ( like [spoiler] Why Ivy behave like she never met Robbie? Why they never discussed this tragedy? Why Queen of Maggots asked Agnes to blow off the candle, if the girl wasn't even real? Why this crasy old b1tch imprisoned Ivy in the first place? [/spoiler]). Somehow it also affects visuals. I mean, art style is great for the most part, but it often doesn't work as it supposed to. 

The most obvious example of this is the kitchen. Remember how gory it felt when you first encountered this room in 2009? With all this meat and dirt all around the place? The same kitchen in remake feels like a pale copy - less detailed and monochrome with slightly red. Cooking scene also lost its charm. The most stupid and terrifying sequence of '09 somehow became less entertaining and even boring in '16. 

Black and white imagery, btw, is overused to death here. Original game was more competent about it - there were only few monochrome scenes, and it worked much more effectively. But here almost everything is monochrome, and it kills the mood completely. Main thing about Downfall'09 that I enjoyed a lot was black humour involving cannibalism and murder. And this kind of fun only works in full colour grindhouse-style. But no, only black and white. Mb red sometimes, but not much. We've got some serious story here.

And this brings us to the main problem of this remake. It tries so hard to make deep narrative using methods of "The Cat Lady" that it forgets about characters. During the whole game I didn't give a fuck about Joe Davis, his wife or any other character in this game. Nobody talks like real human. Nobody feels here like real human, except Agnes, [strike]ironicly[/strike]. Achieving all 3 endings, I don't feel like I know these people. Who the fuck is Joe Davis? Where does he work? What's his favourite dish? What he's afraid of the most? Poor voiceacting doesn't help at all. Sorry, Jessie, sorry, Chisaleya - you need a lot of practice.

Of course, you can tell that original Downfall also had poorly written characters. But this game wasn't about characters, you know. It was all about massacre, death, cannibalism, demons and subconsiousness that plays tricks with your mind. And you're just some guy with the gun and chainsaw called Joe Davis, who wants to make these things right. It was brutal, simple and rather satisfying game that didn't need any kind of remake.

Anyway, this game is also here in this bundle. So if you want to experience both of them and compare - spend your money. I do feel disappointed, but I don't feel decieved. Nobody does it to you like Harvester games after all.

23275334.review:
I'm reccomeding this because the original game is bundled with the remake. The remake made no sense and tried to hard to be the original instead of standing on it's own feet. Buy it on sale, not for full price like I did.
I played the original right before the remake and actually prefer everything about the original. The original actually had me gagging at some points and not wanting to continue because I knew what was about to happen. This remake had me wanting to finish so I could get to the cameos at the end and then left me wanting. 
My main issue is the plot. The remake skewed the story so much it didn't even fit in with what we were shown in the Cat Lady. It kept the same events and motivations from the first game but updated them to try to make them fit into the new game and they didn't. Characters were not fleshed out enough for their actions to make sense. Like the fact they kept the axe man from the original but didn't offer an explanation for him and he wasn't used to his full advantage in my opinion. And then he suddenly poofs and isn't seen for the rest of the game. 
Spoilers: In the original game, Sophie is trying to become fat for the man she loves and becomes morbidly obese. In this game, she's trying to become skinny but still has a recipe for a fattening smoothie?? And still ends up obese. Also her final incarnation has become demonic despite the remake never explaining why.  Ivy, in the original, doesn't eat so Joe feeds her to death and is revealed to be large at the end. When we see Joe and Ivy in the Cat Lady, Ivy is seen to be obese. In the remake Ivy is battling anorexia but when we are told about her true form at the end she is skin and bones, that Joe wasn't trying to save her, even though that's the whole point of the game. Also Ivy went from having mental problems in the first game to just being an unlikeable character with an attitude and a negative attitude about everyting. 
The voice acting was not done well. There was not enough energy put into most of the characters. This made listening to them difficult and I wish there was an option to turn them off. I liked the cameos they included and when Agnes was around she was great to listen to. Everything was voiced, they never just had text on screen, which is something that I really appreciated.
In the original game you had to option to use the arrow keys to move or point and click your way around. This game used the same controls from the Cat Lady, arrow keys to do everything. It took a little getting used to but the inventory was easier to use in this style.  
This was a well made game but for me there wasn't enough love put into it as there was in the original and I really wish they had either changed more or kept things more the same. Actions didn't make sense, the voice acting detracted from the experience, and movement was difficult to get used to. If you're looking for a new truly gruesome horror experience, I recommend the original. The remake is a different experience all it's own.

23258005.review:
[b]Harvester Games[/b] явно создают себе имидж в игровой инди индустрии весьма мрачных парней, угорающим по жёсткому смысловому андеграунду. Андеграунду музыкальному и изобразительному. Хоррору и трешу. А так же заимствование сюжетных ходов, взятыми из совсем уж современной литературы. Очень схожий стиль, на мой взгляд, в написании диалогов, как например у Кроненберга, в его дебютной книге "Употреблено". Простота и скорость описания. Эдакое что-то клиповое и броское. Команда Михальски со всеми этими приёмами справляются и грамотно ими пользуются. Что ж, рассказывать о [b]Downfall[/b] и не упоминать [b]The Cat Lady[/b] решительно невозможно! Впрочем как и молчать об этих двух играх, вместе, или по-отдельности.

При всей схожести с [b]The Cat Lady[/b], [b]Downfall[/b] всё таки самостоятельная игра и исповедует немного другую подачу в сюжете и атмосфере. Вернее сказать, это как с любимейшим блюдом; блюдо приготовлено отменно, но в совсем другом ресторане, который как минимум никак не хуже. Если в [b]Кошатнице[/b] мы видим драмы, самоубийства, характеры, то в Downfall всё куда более конкретно, наверное, потому что в главной роли мужчина, а не парочка рефлексирующих дамочек. [b]The Cat Lady[/b] мне показалась игрой замешанной целиком на чувствах, эмоциях и прочих тонких материях, в кругу дьявольского насилия. [b]Downfall[/b] это откровенно говоря - треш. Да-да, именно треш и чернуха, в блестящей романтической упаковочке. [b]Кошатница[/b] это своего рода нуарный декаданс, со слегка "поехавшей" эстетикой. [b]Downfall[/b] это такое быстрое и стремительное плюшевое love story. Признаюсь, в такое love story мне не приходилось играть со времён Silent Hill 2.


Вердикт мой таков; мрачный романтический треш, с фирменной атмосферой от [b]Harvester Games[/b]. Превосходный повод окунуться еще раз в эту очень жирную и кровавую атмосферу для тех, кому не хватило [b]The Cat Lady[/b].

23127663.review:
This experience was horrifying. Of all the gore and overt attempts at disgust that games and movies deal with these days, only few are truly effective. In games you are either stopped entirely and put into a cutscene of some kind or you face these horrors with obliviousness, whereby the characters does not even to what we know he or she must be aware of, and that conventionally horrify you. Downfall has an interesting movement in this regard, it falls somewhere between the loss of control of a cutscene, but within the world of the played character. A loss of control in this sense is what we in real life would call a reflexive reaction. We cringe, brace ourselves, shield our face, eyes, cower back, etc, and the same happens in this game. This is one part of the realism that underlies the entirety of this experience. And it is that same realism that manages to hit so hard, and actually horrify as every absurdly surrealistic scene has roots to the physical world; yet becomes otherworldly in the compound of these worldly parts. 

When I wrote about The Cat Lady, I mistakenly called it fittingly ugly. This was largely due to an inability to thoughtfully articulate what actually went on aesthetically in games of this ilk (only Downfall and The Cat Lady, as far as I know). Ugliness in regards to this game should entirely be replaced with the term unsettling, or uncanny. It is ugly in the sense that dissonance is ugly. It is jarring, but that does not necessarily mean that it is not suitable for the purposes at hand. In horror, the discordant, unsettling and dissonant are vital to engender a creepy atmosphere. 

But Downfall falls far beyond the merely creepy, and actually lands in the sphere of horror, actual horror. And rarely with much pretense or by having disgust be the goal in and of itself, Downfall's disgust, conjured by the various scenes, serve a narrative purpose; they more often than not carry a symbolic value. This is in large due to the psychological aspect. Instead of straight up depression, as in The Cat Lady, Downfall instead deals with eating disorders or general self-hatred, basically dysmorphobia, where one has either a delusional or actual flaw that is exaggerated to the point of pathology. And it is this dysmorphic view that leads Joe Davis down this horrific path in his attempt to save his beloved wife, and the base which gives meaning to what you'd otherwise interpret as meaninglessly disgusting and surreal. Everything hearkens back to mental illness, allusions to schizophrenia and depression are as common as the dysmorphobia, and all add to the theme of the game, which I'd sum up as [i] the fight against the thoughts produced by mental illnesses, viz., our internal pathological struggles.[/i] 

Along those lines the game struts. It flaunts its horror without being hemmed by shame, comfort nor laziness. But what does it have to say about beating these thoughts? Anything beyond the clichés? The dark room of the hateful thoughts about oneself are said to be counteracted by company, by appealing to the other. At the same time, as the other, we are told it is hopeless (depending on your actions in game, really, but this was the case for me). The multiple endings all add to the aforementioned realism, but vary in what they propound about the hopelessness of the ill mind, making the experience fragmented, divergent, depending on who you are and how you approach this topic, or these suffering people. 

The choices of this game are somewhat subtle. And your actions are free in a sense, and it is hard to predict the consequences of these actions without playing the game multiple times. In a way that gives you replay value, but also a limited first-time experience. I prefer a one-time holistic experience. I do not necessarily think more time played means more value. But real choice, in games, are considered to be those that in some way affect the story or change the final outcome, and on that note, the choices in this game are real choices. But for those who do not necessarily want to play a game 4-5 times to exhaust all the options available to them, it becomes a source of frustration. However, I imagine the latter kind of people are a minority.

While there are puzzle elements, they are rarely problematic. It's a matter of simple world association and paying attention to the dialog and at times the dialog options. Explore thoroughly and pay attention and nothing should be too difficult to overcome in this game. This can be construed as both a positive and a negative, there is no challenge, really, but there is also no frustration. The horror gets to play its part without having to be compromised by overly complicated puzzles. And despite there being no real challenge, there is satisfaction in figuring out the solutions of the quandaries of Joe and company. 

It's a concise experience. It is genuine and simple in many ways, but it serves the purpose of making the symbolic relations shine so much brighter. It's clear, most of all. The equivocalness that may arise is not due to any fault in the game's ability to tell a story, but in the story itself and what it tries to portray, which tend towards equivocalness. Attempting to do this is very much admirable. To touch darkness as a sort of exuberant catharsis. To with your full body delve into absolute horror and see your way through it. Mainly because you are an observer, thereby excluded from it, but also by playing a character going through it, sometimes managing, sometimes not. Instead of alluding to psychological pathology as a pretext for silliness or surrealism, it is used with a great understanding of its reality. The imagery is forceful to signify the intensity of the feeling not everyone experiences, but can through this game. This game can intensify our understanding of these mental issues, or at least give us the blueprint of what such a game could look like. Because it can be done more smoothly, I imagine, with greater focus on inner experience in lieu of the focus on a flashy narrative. We can stay in the moment, in the atmosphere of an awful inner life, Silent Hill 2, along with games like Downfall and The Cat Lady, proved that. But what they have yet to figure out is how to truly create a game where everything leads to the same place, like in Spec Ops: The Line, for example. These games on emotional pain have yet to figure out a way to fully encapsulate themselves in their thematics; yet they remain on a very interesting path towards excellent game-creation, that eventually will have the added bonus of being truly emotionally fulfilling, profound and beautiful. 

haha

23113340.review:
Polish developer Remigiusz Michalski in 2009 introduced an interesting adventure Downfall, which was praised for its horror atmosphere with intriguing story. It is now published in its revised version, which every obscure adventure games fan should not miss.

Downfall was inherently point and click adventure, but in a revised version this is more of an interactive story in the style of Telltale Games. The author left the classic point and click interface, completely redesigned graphics and music, let the dub characters (one character is dubbed by a fan of the previous games) and even rewrote the story to partially follow a different game The Cat Lady to please its fans. Remake is thus not only a newly released version of the game.

The first major change and the hallmark of the game is that the environment of the camera is viewed from the side, and the main protagonist is controlled directly via the keyboard. In essence, therefore using only the keyboard. The game does not use the mouse at all, and after a while you will find that playing with just one hand is so easy. Backgrounds are a mix of photographs, rendered 3D models and cartoon characters. Today's players might argue that the game is graphically outdated, but according to me it is a raw and original visual concept that somehow belongs to Downfall.

The graphical representation is related to a story that certainly does not mince words and warnings at the beginning of the game, that this is a game for adults. After the opening sequence, where we introduce the main characters Joe and Ivy reveals, that among them there is something wrong. Couple arrives at Quiet Haven to spend the night. Ivy starts to behave strangely and soon lost. If you expect it will be a classic horror plot about kidnapped mistress and some monster holding her, you are far from the core. In fact, it is a very thoughtful psychological horror that you’ll be thinking about even after finishing. Downfall is not afraid to dish out some very gory scenes and two rather gross tasks. Additionally, it is often possible to choose dialogue options available in a journey, which then leads to a different end. There’s no need to spoil anything, but Downfall offers more than just one conclusion.

The puzzles are well designed and items needed to solve them are in sequential order as the narrative goes. You could say that their difficulties are among the simple, basically it is impossible to be stuck on something. Here it's all about the story. Fans will be pleased that the story includes some characters from other author’s games and it looks like it is going to be a sequel.

The only drawback is the use of already aged Adventure Game Studio engine, where you can’t simply change the game resolution from the standard 800 × 600 pixels, for example, on a notebook. It’s a pity author didn’t use some advanced engine.

Overall this game caught me with its story and stylisation that I basically finished it in one sitting during the evening. It has achievements on Steam that reveal a few surprises, so playing time is extended. If you are into dark and unusual adventure games, I definitely have to recommend a new version of Downfall.

23046228.review:
WARNING! Mild spoilers.

As a recovering anorexic, I really enjoyed this game. Anorexia is a highly misunderstood subject. The fact that it's actuall a mental illness, and a serious one at that, is hardly ever even brought up. Most portrayals of anorexia depict it as skinny girls not eating, no more than than. This game delves into the true horrors of the illness. The obsessions, the paranoia, and just how difficult it is to pull away. The way it was explained by the memory of Sophie in the room of mirrors was incredibly accurate. This game was clearly made by someone who understands eating disorders, and I really appreciated that.

Overall, gameplay was nice. It wasn't too long-- it only took me about an hour and a half to complete a single runthrough. The puzzles were fairly straightforward, but still provided a challenge. As in The Cat Lady, there's no real efficient way to move from place to place on the map (no quick transport, dashing, etc.), but the map isn't altogether too big. The plot was a bit nebulous at times. It was unclear what was meant to be real and what wasn't-- but maybe that was intentional, as a representation of Joe's mental illness. Confusing as is, the story was still very good, but all three endings were rather sad and dissatisfying, especially to fans of The Cat Lady. But horror games don't have to have happy endings, I suppose.

Taking everything into account, I'd strongly recommend this game. Worth the money for sure.

First of all I'd like to say I loved this game's art style and over all general feeling that it gave. The story itself was a good 8/10, and without giving away any spoilers, threw me for several loops.

Aside from that though, this game was very good and was a good 5-6 hours of entertainment just from one playthrough. The puzzles as well were very easy to follow if you used the game's logic to solve them, which is something a lot of games have a hard time doing right, and just come off as confusing and end up losing my interest.
