22914826.review:
Сиквел The Cat Lady, который был ещё до неё.
Минусы – То ли мой ноут совсем ошалел, то ли пора менять винду… А может игры на этом движке и правда от природы так лагают. Не постоянно, но были моменты, когда фпс жуть как проседали (i5 2,4 Ггц, GeForce 520 MX 1 Гб, 4 Гб ОЗУ). Вот Кошатница часто этим грешила, Даунфолл же в разы меньше (притом, что он симпатичнее). Я правда не знаю, проблемы ли это компа, аль с оптимизацией у движка не всё ладно, но как факт я это отметил в обзоре. Сюжет хороший (подробнее о нём в Плюсах), но тут творится такой сумбур и хаос! Прямо вспомнилась The Evil Within, где тоже было сложно следить за сюжетом из-за всех этих запутываний с телепортациями по локациям и прочим. Это сложно объяснить, не на спойлерив, но я попробую… Происходит что-то жуткое, мясное и символичное, но потом это не раскрывается и не объясняется, а если до этого и доходит дело, то уже к тому моменту и забыть успеваешь, что это вообще случалось. Быть может игра рассчитана на дотошное обращение внимания ко всем деталям, но… Да ладно вам! Не каждый готов проходить игру по 30 раз, чтобы понять каждый символичный штришок! Ну да ладно. Всё равно сюжет прекрасный. Последним минусом хотелось бы выделить крайне ничтожную продолжительность – 5 часов в первое прохождение. Как-то маловато, учитывая, что прохождения на вторую и третью концовки теперь будут ещё быстрее, ибо я всё уже знаю и могу просто бежать по игре, принимая несколько другие решения. Та же Кошатница была раза в два длиннее, вроде бы.
Плюсы – После того, как поругал сюжет в игре, кажется, что как её хвалить-то? Но… Я совершенно честно могу записать эту игру в свои фавориты. Серьёзно, она прекрасна. Каждая деталь в ней если не чудесна, то хотя бы просто на уровне. Для начала оправдаю минусы. Оптимизация. Возможно с ней всё в порядке, просто у меня с системой всё печально. К тому же, снижение фпс было замечено раза три-четыре за игру. Всего-то! Сюжет. Да, он сумбурный. Да, там много странных моментов. Да, он будто пытается быть Silent Hill 2. Но, положа руку на сердце, могу честно сказать, что он очень-очень хорош. Сюжет затрагивает интересные и не изъезженные проблемы современных стандартов красоты. Он успевает быть романтичным и жутким одновременно. В конце концов, история связывает события игры с The Cat Lady настолько, что прохождение приключений Кошатницы становится чуть ли не обязательным перед ознакомлением с игрой (не после, а именно до). То есть, тут у нас уже своя самобытная игровая вселенная. Не дурно, правда? Продолжительность. Возможно игра создана нарочито такой короткой в угоду тому, чтобы каждый пробовал пройти её на все три концовки. Тогда всё в порядке. Вот я и оправдал минусы (потому что так надо, бебебе!). Что же дальше? Чудесная музыка от музыкантов и композиторов, участвовавшей в прошлой игре, плюс  такие же отличные новенькие исполнители. Просто изумительная и красивейшая рисовка персонажей! Забудьте про уродов из The Cat Lady (о, эта Сьюзен Эшфорт, выглядящая на все 60!) – персонажи Downfall нарисованы действительно красиво. Задники и предметы окружения возможно тоже стали симпатичнее, но не так явно бросается в глаза как персонажи. Атмосфера стала ещё более жуткой и мясной, нежели у предшественницы. Изуродованные трупы, романтика, отборнейший мат, чёрный и не очень юмор, обнажёнка (кстати, годная), фансервис, яркие персонажи… Тут есть всё и немного больше. Одного разве что не достаёт – сложных головоломок. Но зачем мне ваши ребусы, мне сюжет интересен и атмосфера, поэтому к чёрту головоломки!
Итог – Если Вам понравилась The Cat Lady, то даже не думайте – покупайте сразу. Если Вы любите жуткие игры с запутанными и интересными сюжетами – тот же совет. Игру я могу советовать всем, кроме разве что тех, кому нужен насыщенные экшон и геймплей (тут с этим проблемы, как Вы наверное поняли уже), и тех, кто жить не может без сложных поинт-энд-кликов. Если охарактеризовать игру совсем просто – это как внебрачный ребёнок Silent Hill и Life is Strange. (Для справки: при запуске игра спрашивает - включить оригинальный Downfall 2009 года или новый Downfall 2016. Я делал обзор на новую версию.)

22439729.review:
[b]If Quentin Tarantino ever made a video game, it would be this game. 
It's gory, surreal, and so very, very messed up... and I love it. [/b]

Downfall is a psychological horror game, and the gameplay mechanics are pretty simple. Everything you do, you do with the arrow keys. You find items, put them in your inventory, and use them to solve puzzles (which are pretty simple) However, the most important factor in this game is the story. And boy, what a story it is. 

The game is very short, it will take you approximately 4-5 hours to finish - and that's if you're being thorough. Now, usually I would recommend picking up games of this length on a sale, this one however I think it's worth the full price. The replayability value in this game is insane. So many dialogue options and scenarios, and there are 3 possible endings. The good, the bad and the neutral. Though, the good isn't really all that happy either. Which I liked! 

[b]The good stuff[/b]
* Dialogue - the script for this game is amazing. It's worth playing just for Joe's mean lines alone. 
* Artstyle - very unique and surreal. Hell, even the paintings in this game are great! Gloomy and dark with hints of color (red) throughout the game.
* Soundtrack - the maker of this game is very good at choosing the right music for each scenario. I love all the soundtracks, and I find myself listening to them outside of the game as well. Really helps creating the atmosphere.
* Replayability - I highly recommend taking your time to explore all the dialogue and all the outcomes. Will take you approximately 12-15 hours. 
* Puzzles - not too easy, not too obvious either. Clever.
* Story - the story will mess with your head. It's weird, and I love it. 
* Price - good price for an amazing game. 
* Joe Davis - yep. 

[b]The not-so-good stuff[/b]
* Audio - sometimes the audio just sounds... off. Some of the voice actors have a really shitty mic, which sorta ruins the mood and dialogue sometimes. This was a problem The Cat Lady had as well. 
* Sometimes the controls feels slow and not responsive. Also a problem The Cat Lady had. 

I highly recommend playing this, especially if you're already a Cat Lady fan. Those of you with a BBW fetish might enjoy this as well.

22433101.review:
一周目通关不看攻略只打出最普通的Ending A，但是在我心里这就是必然的真结局。
09版的downfall曾经玩过一点，后来入了Steam的大坑后因为这个制作组勾起了往年回忆于是入了The Cat Lady，通关后惊为天人。于是Downfall重制版在绿光上出的时候就关注了很久，发售后也第一时间入手了。

总体来说，Downfall在剧情上一如既往的好，制作组在Downfall和The Cat Lady中展现的氛围烘托和细节叙事水准令人印象着实深刻。看到社区讨论中有人将其和《致命ID》做类比，觉得很适合。明眼人一看就知道整个故事发生在Joe的精神世界，但是背后真正的原委和游戏过程中的各种伏笔直到最后结局部分才揭开谜底，就像看完了一部结局真的完全出乎意料且之前的伏笔全部在结局一刻完全揭开和对应的时侯，那种汗毛倒竖浑身发凉却又感觉肾上腺素急剧飙升的感觉一样。
游戏的配乐这次感觉比The Cat Lady要花了更多的心思，但是我觉得最让人印象深刻的还是只有最后结局时候的那首《Boogeyman》，复古，好听。其间的两首重金属配合当时的场景则是让人有点出戏。

如果非要说本次重制版的缺点的话，我觉得主要有两点：
1、配音演员演出的感觉比起The Cat Lady的时候，差了一点点。我最不太能接受的是最后susan友情客串出场的时候的配音，总有种淡淡的戏谑口吻，我觉得这不是我所玩过的TCL中的susan的感觉。至于重新绘制的susan和mitzi的形象，说实话我也不是很喜欢，但是可能见仁见智吧
2、剧本如果能再长一点充实一点，可能会更好。比起09版的downfall，重制版增加的剧情不多，道理上来说这块应该评价不过不失才对。但是有The Cat Lady珠玉在前，总觉得这代的游戏过程线性过头了，玩家可以自主发掘的东西太少了点，导致除了开头和结局令人印象深刻以外，游戏过程中的一些流程总显得有点那么流于平淡了

如果你是硬核的恐怖游戏/电影爱好者，我还是强烈推荐这部游戏。毕竟这年头，这个篇幅的好的恐怖故事，真的越来越难得了

22417914.review:
A fascinating game for all fans of horror. Using the already familiar art themes specific to The Cat Lady, the game bolsters the great idea of the original game into a true refined masterpiece. Unlike the original, the gameplay and puzzles are actually pretty intuitive here, with one or two small exceptions. Expect some gruesome and disturbing scenes and puzzles. 
Using round, interesting or even mysterious characters, the game builds an emotional and often quite shocking story which will keep you gripped most of the time.
Apart from the obvious choices, some aren't that intuitive, so don't be surprised if you're left wandering what you did wrong when you get an ending different than expected.

The game is definitely recommended for everyone fascinated by horror or who simply enjoys this sort of art. I wouldn't, however, recommend it for someone simply looking for an emotional or engaging story.

22360143.review: Artistically and technically beautiful, Downfall provides an engaging story and wonderfully disturbing atmosphere that might possibly surpass that of The Cat Lady. The puzzles are intuitive enough to not require the 'try everything in my inventory on everything' tactic of progression, while still being challenging. Decisions you make feel like (and seem to) influence the storyline, and the attention to detail is fantastic. Highly recommended for fans of adventure games, and/or horror.

22316329.review:
Рекомендую покупать Downfall если вы любите игры от Harvester Games, а также психологические хорроры с глубоким, интересным сюжетом и разными исходами, которые зависят только от вашего решения. 
Очень давно хотела приобрести эту игру, так как доводилось играть в версию 2009-го года, и она также шикарна. Ремейком тоже не разочарована. Прекрасный стиль, отличнейший саундтрек, также события в Ремейке игры пересекаются с сюжетом Tha Cat Lady. А также с Ремейком идет и версия игры с 2009-го года для тех, кто хотел бы переиграть или увидеть Downfall таким, каким он был с самого начала или же переиграть в него снова. 22293114.review:
Jogo: Downfall
Gênero: Aventura de Horror Psicológico
Desenvolvedora: Harvester Games
Distribuidora: Screen 7

[u][h1]ENREDO:[/h1][/u]
O jogo o coloca na pele de Joe Davis, um homem com sérios problemas em seu casamento com sua espoa Ivy. Diante de toda a situação, ele decide levá-la para um passeio ao Hotel Quiet Heaven, onde lá ele busca uma forma de salvar o seu casamento com  a mulher que ama.

Entretanto, ao chegar no hotel já é possível notar que é um local estranho, macabro, e o oposto do que eles imaginavam que seria. Após outra discussão com sua esposa, Joe acorda no outro dia e se depara com uma situação perturbadora, sua esposa desapareceu, e cabe a ele encontrá-la antes que seja tarde demais. 

[u][h1]GAMEPLAY:[/h1][/u]
A mecânica do jogo é bem simples, você basicamente controla o personagem entre as fases, podendo coletar objetos, ler papéis e cartas, interagir com as situações criadas.
Os controles respondem bem, e as animações de movimentos são simples e bonitas na maior parte do jogo.

[u][h1]GRÁFICOS:[/h1][/u]
Os gráficos podem ser simples à primeira vista, mas cumprem a proposta do jogo, entregando um ambiente macabro e envolvente emocionalmente.

[u][h1]TRILHA SONORA:[/h1][/u]
A trilha sonora do jogo alterna entre faixas melancólicas no piano (usadas em momentos de tensão emocional) e também hits de rock (usados para momentos frenéticos).
A dublagem do jogo é um ponto bastante positivo, dando destaque para Joe e Ivy, cujas vozes são muito bem trabalhadas.

[u][h1]OTIMIZAÇÃO:[/h1][/u]
Não há muito o que declarar, jogo leve e roda tranquilo em todos os momentos.

Downfall é um jogo com um enredo interessante e envolvente, um gameplay e gráficos simples e funcionais, uma trilha sonora boa, e além de tudo, é capaz de lhe divertir bastante.

[h1]Enredo: 9
Gráficos: 8
Gameplay: 8
Dificuldade: 6
Trilha Sonora: 8[/h1]

[b][h1]Nota final: 8/10[/h1][/b]

22198942.review:
Oj tak, to są moje klimaty :)
Na początek zaznaczę, że Redux nie jest przeniesionym 1 do 1 oryginałem. Oczywiście większość głównych założeń fabularnych i wydarzeń pozostało bez zmian. Chociaż nie jest to regułą, niektóre zostały przepisane na nowo i sporo się różnią. Twórcy nie poszli na łatwiznę, trochę pozmieniali i dodali nowe elementy fabularne i miejscówki. Spotkamy też stare znajome z The Cat Lady, w ogóle historia z Downfall jest kontynuacją tej z Cat Lady. :) 

Zagadki, choć wiele z nich się pokrywa, też zostały przerobione, zaznaczę że zmiana z typowego point&clicka na sidsecrollowy horror sprawiła, że stały się one łatwiejsze, nie sposób przegapić potrzebnych nam rzeczy, ponieważ ilekroć kolo nich przechodzimy pojawia się menu kontekstowe. 
Oprawa jest ponura, w większości czarno biała, od czasu do czasu przełamana jakimś kolorem (najczęściej krwistą czerwienią). Nie jest tak kolorowa jak w pierwowzorze, nawet The Cat Lady wydaje się przy barwna.

Na pewno do Downfall wrócę jeszcze nie raz, chcąc poznać wszystkie 3 zakończenia.

ocena: 8/10 Teraz już wiem, że biorę w ciemno wszystko, co wyjdzie spod ręki R Michalskiego.

Tytułem końca: Downfall (2016) można poznawać samodzielnie, jednak zapoznanie się z historią Susan Ashworth rzuci światło na wiele wydarzeń, pozwoli również na delektowanie się wieloma smaczkami :) Ogólnie polecam grać w takiej kolejności: Downfall, The Cat Lady, Downfall: Redux :)

22167384.review:
Психологическое мистическое приключение с нелинейным повествованием. Переосмысление игры 2009 года. Развитие истории, показанной игрой The Cat Lady. Наконец, очень впечатляющее произведение...
Как и в The Cat Lady здесь есть место и уродству, и красоте; жестокости и милосердию; безумию и мистике; беспросветному мраку и, придающим силы, лучам света. Происходящее в ещё большей степени зависит от решений игрока. Несмотря на то, что б[b]о[/b]льшая часть повествования "сузилась" до супружеской пары, проводящей ночь в отеле, уровень постановки только вырос. Игра чувствуется гармоничней предыдущей, больше захватывает. Может показаться, что это ощущение возникает из-за более мистической природы происходящего. Но чего стоит одно только вступление. Вначале яркое, светлое, оно показывает один день из жизни главных героев, когда они ещё были детьми. Милые сцены, невинные разговоры  сразу же влюбляют игрока в персонажей, на чью судьбу он будет влиять после. Конец вступления трагичен и задаёт климат всей игре, заменяя насыщенный цветами визуальный стиль на черно-белый.
Оригинал идёт в комплекте с Downfall 2016, но ценность его мала рядом со столь замечательным переосмыслением. Версия 2009 года совсем просто нарисована, не озвучена, и лишена выбора по ходу повествования. Вначале игроку предстоит наблюдать резкое отношение главного героя к своей больной супруге. Затем трагичное, грязное завершение истории.
Не понятно, откуда столько отзывов о том, что переосмысление портит достижение оригинала и вообще репутацию разработчика. Правда в том, что версия 2009 года не имеет достижений, являясь бессмысленной грязной историей, пробой пера автора. Если людям, оставившим подобные отзывы хочется чего-то мрачного и бессмысленного, долго искать ненужно - это популярное сочетание. Остальные же пускай наслаждаются достойным произведением, которым и является Downfall 2016.
P.S.: В сети есть видеопрохождение игры актёрами озвучения (Агнес и Джо). Смотрится очень забавно - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R-vZ4sDIpH4
От "Айви" - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wu_t9eKWf_M

22160755.review:
[h1]Terrible.[/h1]

I'm not sure where all these positive reviews came from, but this game is horrendous. Downfall is a point-and-click adventure game, and fulfills all the functionality and tropes of a P&C, including obscure puzzles, heavy narrative focus, and dialogue trees that [i]may[/i] offer narrative changes or alternate outcomes. I don't know for sure, one playthrough was bad enough.

[b]Pros[/b]
+Decent soundtrack
+High-value trading cards, your initial 3 card drop could net you $1.50


[b]Cons[/b]
-Ugly, low-effort visuals, ridiculous walk cycle animations in a game based around walking from a to b
-Unoriginal setting with no thought or creativity involved in its stages
-8th-grade-school-play-tier voice acting, making skipping VA altogether preferable
-Cringeworthy attempts at atmospheric horror that end up on-the-nose and laughable
-Offensively bad representation of Anorexia Nervosa and other mental illness
-Immature, heavy-handed shoe-horning of sexualtiy throughout
-Lame, cliched story with a "twist" you can see coming just by looking at the trailer video

In summation, practically everything about this game is bad, and while it would be easy enough to chuckle as you worm your way through this as an $0.99 gag purchase, the fact that the developer is asking [b]$13.99[/b] for this dumpsterfire of a game is criminal.

[h1]IF YOU'RE NOT ALREADY AN ADORING FAN OF THE FREEWARE VERSION OF THIS GAME, DO NOT BUY[/h1]

22102457.review:
As far as psychological horrors go there may not be many better games released in 2016 than Harvester Games’ Downfall. This shouldn’t be a surprise to those of you who are aware with the studio’s work given the outstanding The Cat Lady that the studio released in 2012. Despite releasing only last month the original version of the game was released even before The Cat Lady in 2009. The original 2009 release of the game is now freeware which you can get from the title’s official website.

For those of you who are questioning whether or not you should just grab the free game or to pony up the $13.99 for the newly released version do know that the recently released version has been significantly remade and has been reimagined in a fashion similar to that of The Cat Lady – which to fans of the game should automatically raise a huge smile. For those unaware of the original title then I’d like to kindle your imagination with the thoughts of some of the best psychological horrors on the big screen coming to mind in 1408  and Identity.

I was a huge fan of the controls that are established within the game. The simplicity of the system makes the game a joy to play and allows the player to concentrate on the story being narrated. I’m not going to spoiler the game too much as it is another game that deserves to be played and experienced first hand. I know some of you have advised me that you consider it lazy writing but I firmly believe that there are just some games that demand to be experienced first hand rather than being narrated to you to the point where when you come to play the game it becomes impossible for the narrative to have the same effect upon you as it possibly could have.

The graphics while simple really help establish the atmosphere and aide immersion. The camera work is extraordinary and while I know Total Biscuit hates people referring to games as cinematic experiences this is certainly a game that deserves that phrase being applied to it. Animations are used sparingly but when they are used in each scene there is an undeniable purpose which is consistently well executed. The decisions made towards the utilization of monochrome with very minimal utilization of color is outstanding and extend through to the lighting used throughout the game. This makes the horror and the gore stand out at a level that is arguably greater than the sum of its parts. This in turn leads to the voice acting. Although there are some scenes that I feel lack the oomph that would have made it a truly great experience throughout there is enough strength in the delivery that makes the whole above average. The decisions behind the choice of songs that constitute soundtrack are also of a sound decision. The sounds again raise the level of the horror and demand praise. It is a game that I would recommend that you wear headphones for.

A word of warning for some of you to take heed of is that there is quite a significant amount of gore throughout the game.

Downfall is one of the best psychological horror experiences I have enjoyed across all media in a long time. It is highly recommended.

To join in our fantastic community join our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Steamified]Steam group[/url]

DOWNFALL REDUX (он же DOWNFALL 2016) , ремейк "Дождя" от 2009 года.

Игра-кроссовер  "Кошатницы"(The Cat Lady) от 2012 года  от этого же производителя.
При том,что оригинал 2009 года имел ,естественно немного другой сюжет.

Игра все же уступает по психоделике и сюжету  "Кошатнице" (далее "К") - самой удачной игре на данный момент у HARVESTER GAMES.

Игра интересна, но при этом  скучна,  местами , до безобразия.

В игре нет загадок на внимательность,загадок  на логику,какие были в "К".

Да и переживать драматические приключения  Сюзанн Эшворт , 40 летней суицидницы и одиночки, намного интерснее,чем  снова смотреть уже на заезженную историю доктора Франкенштейна.

В ОБЩЕМ:

2. Игра будет интересна тем,кто в последующем захочет ознакомиться с "К",посокльку ремейк сделан на волне ее успеха и как "приблуда" к ней.
3.Кому нравится красное на черно-белом.

22046968.review:
Когда узнал что выходит ремейк, в голове возникла только одна мысль - зачем ? Да, оригинал был сделан на катастрофически низком техническом уровне и озвучка отсутствовала как класс. Но у игры было свое лицо, она брала своей неповторимой атмосферой полной шизофрении, мягко скажем главному герою порой приходилось делать очень спорные вещи. 

Что я вижу в ремейке... Разработчик стал стесняться сам себя и частично отказываться от своих идей ? Это я например про сцену с котом, помню как играя в оригинал я думал: "ДА ЛАДНО, ТЫ ШУТИШЬ!!! Мне правда нужно это сделать, да ? точно ?". В ремейке все как-то стерильно, будто ты тут не причем. Это не стиль Downfall, есть ощущение что, в игру которая изначально была про другое на волне успеха сделали насильно инъекцию идей Cat Lady. Но не смотря на то что Downfall и Cat Lady в каких-то моментах имеют точки соприкосновения, это РАЗНЫЕ игры с РАЗНЫМИ идеями и оригинальный Downfall хоть он был в техническом плане весь кривой, косой, хромой и пр. был законченной вещью, не требующей ПЕРЕОСМЫСЛЕНИЙ и УТОЧНЕНИЙ.

Короче, к чему я тут так раскудахтался. Я играл ремейк и смотря на гору позитивных отзывов, думал что я ничего не понимаю и вообще "зажрался" :steamhappy: Рад, что оказывается я не один такой старый скряга.

Диалоги отупели, персонажи одеревенели, eбаный серый цвет не создаёт ничего кроме усталости  моих глаз. Он тут ни к чему, здесь нет ни капли экшена, а крови, а значит красного, и того меньше. ЭТО КОНЕЧНО БОЛЕЕ ЛОГИЧНО И ОРИГИНАЛЬНО БЛ`ТЬ[/spoiler] яды в подвале теперь ничем не отличаются, так и наxуя было заставлять выбирать? Ресторан  пуст, праздник Софи пуст, дом мечты героев пуст(вопрос - нахeра он вообще нужен, что он есть, что нет. Это бессмысленная локация), весь отель пуст, вся игра пустая. Бл`ть, она не заполнена ничем, и серый цвет делает всё действо  еще более унылым.. и смешным. Смешным пока не появляется Сьюзан, наш оxuенный сюжетный твист, [spoiler]по словам закостенелых gовноeдов[/spoiler]. После этого совсем не смешно, после этого всего как-то хyёво [strike]и грустно[/strike], всё-таки это была единственная игра, к которой у меня был интерес, конечно,  благодаря предыдущим.

[b]ОЙ ДЖО ДАВАЙ ЗАВЕДЕМ КОТА ЧЕРНОГО КАК НОЧЬ И НАЗОВЕМ ЕГО ЛЮЦИФЕРОМ БЛRТЬ ДАВАЙ НАЗОВЕМ ТЫ СЕРЬЕЗНО HАXУЙ.  А МОЖЕТ ЛУЧШЕ НАЗОВЕМ ЕГО В ЧЕСТЬ ТВОЕЙ ТУХЛОЙ МАМАШИ-ШЛ~ХИ, КОТОРАЯ НЕ ДОДУМАЛАСЬ НИЧЕГО СДЕЛАТЬ КОГДА ЕЕ 9ЛЕТНЯЯ ДОЧЬ СТРАДАЛА БУЛИМИЕЙ?[/b] а лучше в  честь создателя этого сценарного бреда, который (неужели) подумал что она бы смогла 20 лет жить, страдая подобной xyйней. Всё уничтожено на уровне пролога. Такое всё бл`ть миленькое, и трагичное, но как же это бредово и противно было видеть. В этом нет ни толики той атмосферы и подачи сюжета что была раньше. Радует одно - денег я за это дeрьмо не отдал. Но наверное стоило бы сделать это, хотя бы для того чтобы утопить этот позор в негативных отзывах. Потому что это конец. 
Одержимая дьяволом педовка сходит с ума в ванной, и выблёвывает мой огонёк веры и надежды на разработчиков в унитаз.

21949510.review:
Даже и не знаю, с чего начать этот полный неприятных слов обзор.

Когда-то, года два тому назад, обнаружила для себя чудесную игру the cat lady, на одном дыхании были пройдена мною. Абсолютно все понравилось. Но я не заостряю внимание на ней сейчас, вовсе нет. 
После этого меня очень заинтересовал разработчик, наткнулась на Downfall. Быстро найдя ее на торрентах, скачала, долго не могла запустить, но в итоге, спустя кучу времени у меня получилось это сделать. Каков был восторг. Окно в игре было маленькое, управление неудобное, чувствовала себя слепым кротом, близко подсаживаясь к монитору, вглядываясь, с чем мне нужно взаимодействовать, искать нестандартные решения головоломок. О, времена. 

Непосредственно к игре.
Оригинальная версия, которая вышла в 2009 году поразила и сразила. Так и могу выразиться. Сюжет про обычного, казалось бы, парня Джо Дэвиса... На протяжении всей игры оставалась пелена недопонимания, как туман, в который идешь и не знаешь, куда он выведет тебя. А в конце было: БАХ! И ты сидишь на титрах и долго в себя прийти не можешь. Так и было.

Что видим в ремейке. Абсолютно отвратитльный движок. Графика - на нуле. Сцены, начиная с гостями в столовой, заканчивая массивными тушами в ванной комнате - вызывают лишь недоумение, но никак не ту мерзость, которую я испытывала при прохождении оригинальной игры. 
А момент с хрюшей, которая так ТРИДЭШНО висит за ножки на кухне? О, боже, мне стало стыдно. Стыдно, что я прохожу это. СТЫДНО, понимаете?
А чувак с топором? Помните тот страх, когда он ходит по отелю, а вы должны быстро перемещаться, быстрее свалить, чтоб не поймал и не убил.
Саундтрек - поганит всю атмосферу. Что за альтернативчик внедрили? ЧТО ЭТО, господа?! 
У меня слишком много неудомения и вопросов, и, видимо, один ответ на него: ИЗ-ЗА ДЕНЕГ И ХАЙПА. (ненавижу это слово).
Да, да, именно хайпа. Вот понравилась всем малолеточкам The Cat Lady, а разработчики и подумали: будет оригинально запихнуть Сьюзен в игру, помолодевшую на лет 15ть, с жизнерадостным таким голоском. Да, давайте завяжем финал игры на ней. Пусть решает все.

За что? Почему вы так поиздевались над фанатами, дорогие Harvester Games?

Где моя жирная Айви в конце, сидит на электрическом стуле, дробовик в руках, полицейский все это видит, непонятная меркзая вакханалия, психопат, который всю игру казался нормальным и любящим мужем? ГДЕ  ЭТО? ГДЕ?
ГДЕ МОЙ ЭМБИЕНТ, КОТОРЫЙ НАПРЯГАЛ ВСЮ ИГРУ, ГДЕ ОНО?
А ГРАФИКА? РИСОВАННЫЕ ЛОКАЦИИ ОТ РУКИ? 

Господа, у меня много гнева , мне жалко 300 отданных рублей. Я очень надеюсь, что этот ремейк был глупой ошибкой  R. Michalski.
Но я так же благодарна за оригинальные игры и продолжаю ими восхищаться и по сей день.

Просто. Ребята, будьте умнее. Сначала пройдите то, что вышло в 2009 году, прежде чем играть и писать КАК ВАМ ПОНРАВИЛОСЬ это. Пожалуйста. 

Воистину ваш, олдфаженька, которому не место в новом мире игровой индустрии. А теперь, пора в гроб. Спасибо за внимание.

21941160.review:
[h1] Ivy e Joe, together we stand	[/h1]

[b] NO SPOILER	[/b]


Downfall è stato l'esordio di Michalsky, ancor prima del successo di The Cat Lady. Questo remake però non è solo un revamp grafico sulla scia di TCL, ma anzi modifica le carte in tavola e si pone temporalmente dopo le avventure di Susan Ashworth e Mitzi. 

Anche qui l'autore ci da la possibilità di influenzare l'epilogo della vicenda in base a come risponderemo e a determinate azioni che compieremo, da questo punto di vista come AG fa un passo avanti rispetto a molti esponenti del genere. 

Detto questo, [b]Downfall non può che essere un'opera imprescindibile per chiunque abbia amato The Cat Lady[/b] , narra la storia di un amore tormentato, di piccole frizioni quotidiane che logorano. Della difficoltà di comprendere, a volte anche semplicemente di ascoltare, tanto può cambiare in base a come ci rapportiamo.  

Il prologo ci metterà nei panni di due bambini e aprirà le porte verso l'inferno personale dei protagonisti. Uno specchio ci fa vedere le cose da diverse angolazioni, uno specchio frantumato ci offre altre visioni e realtà, realtà specchio di quello che ci frulla nella testa. 

E' difficile parlare del gioco senza anticipare cose che vanno vissute in prima persona, vi basti sapere che al termine delle 6 ore che serviranno per portarlo a termine, inevitabilmente andrete su internet a cercare interpretazioni e nuove chiavi di lettura, da questo punto di vista l'amore di Ren per le storie horror, per Stephen King in particolare, si fa sentire. 

Il comparto sonoro è straordinario così come il doppiaggio, vi farà venire voglia di rigiocare The Cat Lady, per riprendere poi le maglie di un discorso che probabilmente avrà il suo vero epilogo in Lorelai, la chiusura della trilogia.

21877926.review:
Downfall can be enjoyed as a remake/retelling of the original 2009 version, as a sequel to The Cat Lady or as a stand-alone game.  There are nods and allusions to both the original and TCL, but you honestly don’t have to be familiar with either one to play this game.  All the background information you need is given in the prologue; heck, you don’t even get this much in the original Downfall—it simply begins with a husband and wife seeking shelter from the storm in a hotel in the country.

If you’ve played The Cat Lady, you know what to expect in terms of graphics, sounds and gameplay.  The game’s color palette is almost exclusively black, white and red.  There’s voice acting! (More on that later.)  The interface is simple and easy-to-use with the names of objects you can interact with appearing on the screen whenever you walk passed them.  I’m not in the best position to judge the difficulty of the puzzles, having played the original Downfall in which many of the puzzles are the same, but I think they are easy, with clues that more-or-less tell you what to do whenever the solution isn’t obvious.  I’d say the difficulty level is lower than TCL.  Probably the designer wants players to enjoy the story that unfolds rather than getting stuck and spending a lot of time wandering around the hotel in search of what to do next.  I would have enjoyed some more challenging puzzles though; it’s a bit like one of those games where puzzles seem designed to keep you from getting ahead of yourself (e.g. you can’t get through this door until you find object X which is in the room where you meet Mary and that is because we want you to talk to Mary first).  In addition to the inventory based puzzles, you lead your character, Joe, through some conversations and places where he has to make choices.  These can affect the ending of the game.  
I’d give the voice acting an 8.5/10.  For the most part I really liked it (I especially liked the voice of Joe, the protagonist), but there are some places where the voice actors make an odd choice on which word to emphasize (this is a pet peeve of mine); also Joe often speaks lines softly where it seems natural that he would raise his voice.

OK, I am a big fan of Downfall 2009 so I’m really aching to discuss my feelings about the differences between the remake and the original (And, hey, it’s included in the bundle so you can play both of them).  Some minor spoilers ahead…
* Some background regarding Joe’s childhood that we don’t get until the very end of DF2009 is expanded and moved to the prologue here—I thought this announced right away that this was going to be a new take on the story.
* I like how the Queen of Maggots is changed so her nature is more consistent with what we learn in TCL.
* I prefer the twist ending in the remake to the one in the original.  It fits better tonally with the rest of the game and it is set up more, so it doesn’t seem to come out of nowhere.
* Joe and Ivy’s relationship is developed more here and its changed some from DF2009.  I suppose it’s handled more maturely, it’s a more cohesive story and Ivy’s problems are more relatable.  That said, I miss the flashback with Lucifer in the bathroom.  I also miss the psychotic episode Ivy seems to be having when they first arrive at the hotel in DF2009 (screaming, seeing things).  In DF2009 it’s implied, at least at first, that this is a source of their relationship issues, but the problems they face in the remake are, I guess, more in keeping with the game’s theme.
* I really miss Joe’s descent into madness and (at least potentially) evil in DF2009.  I remember loving the dark choices he needs to make throughout the game.  Here his interactions with Sophie are less intense.  In the original he says at one point that she deserves a more painful death(!), and I really miss the extra ingredient you have to add to the smoothie recipe.  Maybe this is just me, second time through DF2009 I decided to play Joe as a total a-hole.
* In addition to thinking the developer might have a swung a bit too far in the opposite direction when it comes to the puzzles (eliminating some, giving the player big hints for others), I actually miss the chase scenes in DF2009.  They added a level of fear and exhilaration.

So that’s my 2 cents.  I would definitely recommend this game for its story, graphics and atmosphere and the multiple endings lend it replay value.  My one criticism is that, partly because of the lack of difficult puzzles, the game is on the short side.  It took me about 4 hours to complete it.

21833771.review:
Я иногда смотрю чьи-то прохождения или стримы, у людей, которые мне интересны, как личности.

Одному взрослому и опытному стримеру зритель написал в местном чате, что он "скатился" и уже не снимает такие качественные видео, как раньше.

На что тот ответил примерно следующее: "Качественный микрофон, хромакей, поставленный свет - хорошо, когда у стримера это все это есть. Вот только смотришь на такого - за душой ничего, обертка красивая есть, а внутри пустота, нечего рассказать, нечем поделиться. Ведь качество - это только 5-10% успеха, остальное - это твоя душа, твой труд."

Можно привести замечательную аналогию с картиной и рамкой. Ведь какой бы красивой ни бы рамка, она не спасет изначально плохую картину.

В игровой индустрии можно наблюдать похожую ситуацию.

С одной стороны - AAA-гиганты, которые выпускают один за другим эпичные блокбастеры. В основном такие игры - это ода "красивым обложкам", с отличной графикой, эпичными трейлерами, при запуске сопровождающиеся большим количеством рекламы. Эти игры редко могут дать нечто большее, кроме как убить время, в ожидании неких новых и интересных чудес. Есть исключения, но их мало.

С другой стороны - инди-проекты, среди которых много низкобюджетного мусора (давайте называть вещи своими именами, я понимаю, что люди старались, но труд далеко не всегда прикладывается правильно и в нужном месте). Несмотря на это, среди океана инди-проектов можно найти настоящие жемчужины.

Одна из таких жемчужин - это ребята из Harvester Games. Из года в год они плюют на современные движки (за что их, конечно, стоит поругать), им не нужна качественная графика. У них есть давно знакомый движок, простая рисованная графика, десятки минут качественного саундтрека, а также доля воображения и юмора.

Я с удовольствием прошел в свое время The Cat Lady, и был рад, что в мои руки наконец попал Downfall.

Плюсы:
+ атмосфера, взрослая история
+ озвучка персонажей
+ классная музыка
+ много концовок
+ черный юмор

Минусы:
- все тот же старый движок
- эта игра не для всех (не зря она 18+)

Пожалуй, мое самое любимое прохождение на данный момент. Несмотря на усталость и упоротость, я делал видео по Downfall с душой и хорошим настроением, полностью отдаваясь игре, ее внутреннему ритму.

Извините за короткий обзор, просто я хочу избежать спойлеров.

Прохождение на канале:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YsNuIlOCmh8&list=PLiQB33TEMVYJgGWSIaV8-I-15KMziKfeg

21799981.review: If I based this review on the voice acting, it wouldn't be very good. But that aside the story is amazing and kept me interested throughout. If you give this game a chance i promise it wont disapoint!

21779696.review:
This game, like The Cat Lady, deals with a lot of incredibly heavy and sensitive material. This game included the expected blood and gore, as well as murdering animals and children, and a lot of talk of eating disorders and the accompanying thoughs someone would have when going through that. Because of that, this isn't really game for everyone (if you have an eating disorder, think long and hard about whether or not you can handle this game right now), but it is a good game. 

I think this is a game that you'll need to play after finishing The Cat Lady, as there are several references (and sections of the game) where you'll have no idea what's happening unless you know who Susan Ashworth is etc. It's not necessary to play the 2009 version of Downfall, though, unless you'd like to compare. The new version differs in story a bit, is much less colourful, and there's voice acting! Unfortunately, some of the voice acting was really off, and the inclusion of a "mandatory" prologue bit will put a lot of people off of finishing this, I'm sure. But please, if you're reading this, go through the prologue and you'll be happier once you start the actual game.

I wasn't fond of the redesign of Susan and Mitzi (Susan looked awful, not going to lie), and I thought Ivy looked very different than her 2009 character, as did Agnes. I didn't care for Ivy at all, mostly because everything felt a bit forced and the mic would crack sometimes, but I think that overall, she was a good character and she did well being a new voice actor. I loved Joe, and I wish the game were longer so we could play as him a bit longer-- that's another thing, the game is shorter than I would have liked. Agnes was a pain at first, and again, very very different, but halfway through the game she became my favourite character. Really, I think the only characters who needed more work or didn't have their characters explored enough were Dr Z (there was a LOT cut out in this version of the game), Joe's family, and Ivy as I previously mentioned. Also, nobody really says much about the evil presence that wrecks everyone's holiday beyond the cryptic things you'd expect, and this was also the case in the older game, so I wish they'd done something with that.

I think that the Axe Man was poorly used in the game compared to the 2009 version, but he was a threat and he did do what he was supposed to do at least for a little while. The game didn't have me as on edge as The Cat Lady, though, and that's a shame. I think the addition of "tendency hints" kind of ruins the game a bit, but I appreciate that they allowed you the option to turn them on and off.

One major criticism I have with the game isn't about the game itself, but about the Extras-- I felt like some of the dev bios etc. were really, really awkward to read. Some read like they were trying too hard to be edgy, and I took the game a bit less seriously after that.

Overall, I do think it's worth playing this game. It was moving, uncomfortable, and disturbing, and I think that anyone looking to play this expects that going in. The game itself is gorgeous except for the new Susan Ashworth, and the dialogue is great (Joe has some of the BEST lines!). I do recommend playing this AFTER playing The Cat Lady and the 2009 version of Downfall, and I also promise that things get better after the prologue if you just get through it.

21733608.review:
Krótko mówiąc - Rem znów to zrobił. Dobrze zrobił!
Słowo klucz to atmosfera - autorskie podejście do szaty graficznej, muzyki, horroru jako gatunku. Remigiusz, jeden najzdolniejszych twórców niezależnych gier polskiego pochodzenia, stworzył trudny do pomylenia styl - i to jest podstawowa zaleta gry. 

Być może lepiej najpierw zagrać w The Cat Lady - jest dłuższa i bardziej złożona od Downfall, a w tej wersji Downfall znajdują się odwołania do TCL, których nie rozumiejąc można trochę stracić. A jeśli The Cat Lady się spodoba, lub - po prostu podoba się atmosfera zwiastuna Downfall - można brać w ciemno. Miejmy nadzieję że wkrótce pojawią się polskie napisy do Downfall.

Downfall to remake, a może lepiej powiedzieć – radykalny overhaul gry o tym samym tytule z 2009 (dołączona do tego wydania). Szata graficzna zmieniona jest na modłę TCL – dwuwymiarowe postaci niczym z makabrycznego teatrzyku kukiełkowego na tle trójwymiarowych pomieszczeń, zmienione są też całe fragmenty fabuły. Oś pozostaje podobna – wizyta małżeństwa w kryzysie w prowincjonalnym hotelu, zniknięcie dziewczyny i walka męża o jej odnalezienie. O ile w pierwszej wersji gry z 2009 był to pretekst do krwawej historii psychologicznej o bohaterze, o tyle teraz to już historia związku dwojga ludzi – i wyniszczającej dziewczynę (oraz jej partnera) nieakceptacji własnego ciała i osobowości. W TLC tematem głównym była depresja, w Downfall wyrasta nań właśnie samowyniszczenie, chorobliwe kompleksy, anoreksja.

Nie wszystkim pasować może horrorowa otoczka gore (choć jest tego nieco mniej niż w wersji z 2009) czy stosunkowo proste zagadki (główna wada dla lubiących trudne przygodówki). Ale jest to rekompensowane przez wspomnianą atmosferę i wymowę, a także dialogi – rozgałęzione, prowadzące do różnych rezultatów rozmów i ostatecznie do trzech możliwych zakończeń (uwaga – najbardziej „pozytywne” i „negatywne” są dość trudne do uzyskania, więc wyzwanie jest). 

I jeszcze słówko w kwestii zakończeń – są inne od wbijającego w ziemię zakończenia Downfall 2009, ale to nie znaczy że gorsze. Główny „przekręt” jest zachowany, ale bardziej powiązany z losami wszystkich bohaterów, nie tylko głównego. Nawiązuje też bardziej do kluczowych tematów psychologicznych gry przez co staje się bardziej spójny z resztą historii i znaczący. 

Gratulacje i pozdrowienia dla autorów gry!

21713684.review:
2009年に発売されたDownfallというゲームのリメイク版。
現在リメイク前のものはダウンロードフリーになっています。
（このゲームを購入したときにも一緒についてきます。）

ある夫婦の狂気的ともいえる純愛を描ききった作品。
どんなことをしても離れたくない、守りたい存在、がいる方には共感できるところが多い…と思います。

分類的にはR-18のホラーゲームですが、そんなに怖くはありません。
（R-18のゾーニングはどちらかというと性的・暴力的な表現によるものでしょうか…？）
プレイしていて、美しい一本の映画を見ている気分になります。
人を選ぶかもしれませんが、一般的に鬱ゲー・電波ゲーと呼ばれるものが好みの方には素直におすすめできる作品です。


■ボリュームについて
・通常のプレイで一周5～6時間くらいだと思います。
・エンディングは3種類。通常エンデイング以外を見るための条件がとても厳しいですが、（おそらく2周目から）ヒント機能も利用できるので自力でコンプすることも不可能ではないと思います。

■音声、字幕、音楽など
・作中の台詞全てフルボイスです。私は特に主人公のJoeの演技と、妻のIvyの儚げで弱々しい声がとても好きです。
このレビューを書いている時点で、日本語化はありません。作中の英語は難しい方ではないと思うのですが、音声に合わせて字幕が流れるため、わからないところを止めて訳すことはかなり厳しいと思います。逆に早送りしたいシーンでもスキップができません。

・音楽はピアノ主体の悲しげな曲が特徴的で、サウンドトラックは作中に使われていた曲が好みならとてもおすすめです。現時点ではサントラにボーカル入りの曲が軒並み入っていないので、そちら目当ての方は注意が必要です。


■リメイク前との比較
・リメイク前は総当り気味のクリック探索ゲームだったので迷うところが多かったのですが、今回は左右移動で注目すべきオブジェクトもわかりやすいため探索は簡単です。より物語に集中できると思います。

・謎が多かった人物に明確な役割や定義が与えられ、より整然とした物語になったと思います。

・グロテスクな表現は緩和されていると思います。よりゴアでサイコでショッキングな表現をお求めの方はリメイク前をプレイしてみるのも良いかもしれません。


■その他
こちらの「Downfall」をプレイする前に、同じ製作会社の「The Cat Lady」をプレイしておくとより物語を楽しめる部分があると思います。個人的には強くおすすめします。

21683918.review:
YOU ARE TEARING ME APAAAART, IVY!

Hello all, and welcome to Tommy Wiseau's "Downfall"

Now, I was ABSOLUTELY sure I was getting this game after about the first THREE SECONDS of the trailer. When I heard a girl, who was obviously roofied or drunk spouting some of the most horrible dialogue ever (although after finishing the game I just think perhaps she has a speech impediment.) Then a guy having issues with AcCENTing Upon the Wrong SylLABles comes along with even more horrible lines. Finally, one of the most awesome songs ever kicks in.

So I got this because I knew I'd clown on it. I knew (and I was right), that it'd be Playstation Resident Evil 1 quality of voice work. And boy was I right. It's right on par with, or maybe even worse than, "Hope this is not... Chris' blood!?!" and "The master of unlocking." I'm all about horror, but this voice acting is downright horrible. It's great for a laugh, but it removes you from the story when everyone (except the Manageress) sounds like they suddenly forgot how to speak normally.  

So it ends up being something other than intended, much like "The Room."  This game tries to be horror but ends up coming off as some kind of laughable B grade horror-comedy. It's sad too, because it seems to want to deal with some fairly serious subject matter. 

Now, that's not to say it's bad. It's great, and I highly recommend everyone play it. Sure, the dialogue is shit, and a majority of the voice actors are about as wonderful as choking on a bag of dicks, but it can give you a laugh, the art is AMAZING, and it doesn't overstay it's welcome. 

Plus, everyone should go on Bandcamp and buy the song "Boogeyman" by Black Casino and the Ghost that's on the trailer and at the end of the game. It's not on the soundtrack here (which I also bought) and it's well worth the .99 or so.

In the end, buy the game, have some laughs, see some cool art, and support [strike]Tommy Wiseau[/strike] errr... the developer. And who knows, maybe he'll make enough money to hire decent voice actors next time, so I can play a horror game that actually comes off as a horror game.

21675160.review:
MI sono preso qualche giorno di riflessione prima di recensire Downfall "La caduta". Allora il motore di Downfall supporta una risoluzione di 800x600 i fondali sono puliti e belli a vedersi oltre ad un buon supporto ai filtri durante l'avventura sono integrati anche dei filmati, le animazioni non sono delle migliori e i personaggi si muovono come dei robottini sui fondali per essere un gioco del 2016 il motore è tutto da riscrivere anche se sono state portate diverse migliorie dal gioco precedente the cat lady. ma davvero questo non vi deve scoraggiare a giocare a Downfall perchè la grafica in questa avventura è la cosa meno importante.
Anche se grezzo il gameplay è curato quanto basta da non essere un problema.

Downfall si colloca rispettivamente nell'arco di tempo dopo tutti gli eventi di the cat lady e prima della fine del gioco di The Cat lady quindi alcuni mesi prima del scena finale della storia di Susan, ma potrebbe anche essere collocato rispettivamente dopo i fatti di the cat lady ma questo solo se si da per canonico il finale segreto di the cat lady.
Essere più chiaro vorrebbe dire spoilarvi il finale del primo gioco.

The cat lady e Downfall sono due giochi molto legati si possono giocare separatamente ma per avere una visione più chiara della vicenda bisognerebbe giocare prima a The Cat lady e poi a Downfall.

Le musiche sono molto curate anche se io personalmente ho amato di più quelle di The cat lady ma vi assicuto che nemmeno queste vi deluderanno.

Che dire della storia è molto profonda, è una storia matura tremendamente cruda e pulp.

nei giochi di Rem non c'è spazio per il buonismo lo scrittore di questo gioco tratta temi forti e lo fanno senza timore di osare.

Downfall è un gioco con le palle e se volete giocarci dovete essere pronti ad affrontare temi come il suicidio, la bulimia, anoressia, depressione, schizzofrenia. temi cari allo scrittore già trattati in The cat lady, ma se in The cat lady vedevamo una donna schiacciata dalla vita trovare uno scopo in essa, se in the cat lady Susan compieva una scalata verso la luce in Downfall lo scrittore mischia le carte e compiremo una discesa nelle tenebre.
In downfall la caduta è inevitabile, la tragedia è inevitabile.
Ma quando si tocca il fondo a volte, poche volte si può trovare una luce nel fondo delle cose.
Compirete un viaggio all'inferno...e sta a voi, solo a voi in base alle vostre scelte riuscire a uscirne.
Non potrete non sporcarvi le mani, il sangue sarà versato che voi lo vogliate o meno.
ma se lotterete fino alla fine dando il tutto e per tutto forse accadrà l'impossibile.

21665602.review: Эта увлекательная и трогательная история не оставит равнодушными тех, кому понравилась Cat Lady.

21613854.review:
Я имбецил и зачем-то перепрошёл оригинал перед ремейком.
Теперь не могу связно всё расписать, не скатываясь в сравнения. Игры очень разные, но в то же время одинаковые.
Поэтому по пунктикам:
1. Сюжет хорошо перекроен. Убраны чересчур нелогичные места, добавлены логичные. Некоторые персонажи переделаны с нуля. События напрямую согласуются с Кошатницей. Теперь обе игры - фактически одна история.
2. Оттуда также попижжен Стиль. Да-да, кислотные фоны из дурки - этого тут нет. Теперь у нас трёхцветный Синсити, который тут не для красоты, НА СЕКУНДОЧКУ. Для эстетов в стиме приложен Downfall 2009.
3. От некоторых новых ТВИСТОВ могут охренеть даже те, кто играл в оригинал. Во всяком случае, я охренел точно.
4. Агнес теперь Looks like a gipsy princess.
5. Хорошая концовка - meh. Нейтральная - ОТ ЭТ ЗАШИБИСЬ. Плохая - НА КОНЧИКАХ ПАЛЬЦЕВ 10\10 ГОСПОДИ. От старых, что удивительно, почти не отличаются. Всего лишь кое-что поменяли.
6. Ну саундтрек пушечный, конечно.
7. Тот Блядский Кот никуда не делся.
8. Более красивых игр на движке AGS уже не будет, судя по всему, никогда.
9. Не нажимайте Esc при запуске игры.

Пока что лучший сюжет в этом году. Именно так и надо делать ремейки. В каждом спрайте АЖ ЧУВСТВУЕТСЯ любовь автора к своему детищу. Та самая DOOSHA, которую сегодня кругом ищут.

9\10 
Только потому что ремейк. Так бы десятку поставил. 
Отдайте Михальскому всё индиквесты. И занесите его пацанам чутка лавэ, невпадлу.

P.S. Русские субтитры - корявые.

21543261.review: I loved the original Downfall so I've been looking forward to this remake for a long time. Now that I've had a chance to play it, I can say I liked it a lot. The art looks great and since much of Quiet Haven follows the original layout, it feels very nostalgic to be back there if you've played the first game. It's nice to see some parts of the story more fleshed out than they originally were as well. The voice acting is so-so. Some of the voice actors were rather good, others had some moments that I didn't care for. But nothing was full on cringeworthy for me. The only thing about this remake that bothered me was that it doesn't stay true to the original story and it felt like all the most controversial parts were changed or removed. Don't expect it to be quite as gritty as the old version. Still, this one is very much worth playing too and it's great to see this twisted love story retold like this.

21512823.review:
This is a pretty great follow up to the Cat Lady. Whereas the Cat Lady was a deep exploration of depression and insanity, Downfall is a deep exploration of, well... insanity times ten.

The Cat Lady had some pretty surreal elements and sequences, but one of its strengths is that everything made sense, narratively speaking. Downfall is a bit less clear and much more surreal, although no less fascinating.

Joe Davis and his wife Ivy have been dealing with some marital problems. Ivy starves herself and will often have episodes where she says strange things. Joe. doesn't know what to do and depending on what dialogue options you choose, he is either someone trying to understand and help, or someone who is pretty self centered. He takes Ivy to a small countryside place called the Quiet Haven Hotel. Shortly after arriving, strange things start to happen, and Ivy disappears. Joe sets out to find her, but it isn't long before reality starts to warp into something ugly and unrecognizable.

This game is, as I said, incredibly surreal in a Silent Hill 2 sense. Very little of it is meant to be taken literally and instead is open to interpretation. The writing is consistently strong, and it's constantly engaging. The only problem is that, unlike Cat Lady, depending on the ending you get, there are many questions left. Whereas Cat Lady had slight variations on the same ending, this game has full blown different endings- as in the outcome is entirely different. So the confusion can be pretty frustrating.

Still, this is a must play for fans of the Cat Lady. It's visually stunning, has a terrific soundtrack, and returns the player to the well established, macabre world of the previous game. Just expect to get a little bit more lost this time around, but also expect to get wrapped up in another twisted, creepy story that is impossible to stop thinking about.

21502172.review:
Игра стоящая своих денег, и даже больше .
   Давно ждал что-то в духе  the cat lady, и этот ремейк не разочаровал.
   История  держит в напряжении до конца (не было занудных моментов) - все очень безумно, таинственно, в общем - потрясающе. В отличие от первой версии - повествование более разжеванное (?). Интересна так же "двоякость" - истории - с одной стороны - ты поступаешь правильно, благородно, а  с другой - падаешь в пучины своего израненного разума, становишься монстром и наконец - замечаешь его в своем отражении.
   Атмосфера почти та же что и в Cat Lady, но как по мне, еще более доработанная, тягучая, липкая, мозгодробительная некоторыми эффектами (не в плохом смысле), не такая грязная как в Downfall 2009 (хоть первоначальная версия пугала намного больше).
   Радует что действия и сюжет, не скопированы из версии 2009 года, есть и новые неожиданные обороты, и новые  грани характера некоторых персонажей.
   Озвучивание понравилось, подходит персонажам (понравился акцент Доктора Z), у Айви правда чувствуется что не совсем качественная запись (ощущение небольшого помещения с плохой аккустикой) , но она озвучена настолько чувственно, что спустя небольшой отрезок времени не замечаешь этого.
   Саундтрек - очень подчеркивает локации и некоторые моменты, прям неотъемлемая часть, серьезно.
   Как раз таки тот момент, когда по ощущениям это произведение влияет сильнее, чем большинство высокографонистых игр. Как и предыдущие проекты от harvester games - оставляет после себя ощущение, словно кусок твоей души вывернули наружу, и это больно, и сладко одновременно, оставляет после себя груз мыслей и тянущийся шлейф как я упоминал -  атмосферы, и это здорово. Отличный баланс всех вышеперечисленных составляющих.
   10\10

21486821.review:
Let me preface this review by saying that I have only written a few reviews, for games, that I believe are worth my taking the time to write about. I appreciate all of the Steam users out there that take so much time writing near professional quality reveiws of games, for all of us who are undecided when we want to make a purchase. However, I am not that person, and I only write reviews when I am so very passionate about a game, and I feel the need to tell the world! The only problem is when I sit down to type it I cannot ever seem to articulate my feelings for the game and I end up not doing the game justice. I say "this game was amazing, I loved it, buy it." I run out of ways to truly explain it after a few sentences. That being said, please bear with me! [u]For those of you scanning over the reviews, just trying to make a quick decision, I will spare you my lengthy drawn out babbling and say this: unless you are squeamish and don't like gore, JUST DO IT-PLEASE BUY THIS GAME-YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY![/u]

I first played Downfall around the time The Cat Lady (TCL) was released. I loved TCL so very much and I was excited to not only find another game by the same devs but also a game that had a storyline that was intertwined with TCL. It was free to boot! The original version of Downfall, was lacking in the graphics department, (not complaining just an observation) but that did not matter whatsoever. The devs very wisely chose to use these "painted vignette" themed rooms, and the main character himself (Joe Davis) seemed like a vignette. Because of this specific artistic style, heavy atmosphere, amazingly haunting music, and story, story, STORY (OMG that story), the lack of graphical quality did not matter. Within minutes I was captivated by the story of Joe and Ivy Davis and had to understand what exactly was going on at The Quiet Haven Hotel. An hour into the game I couldn't stop playing and around 4am the following morning when I finished it, I wanted to play it again! Unfortunately I had to go to work, and I sat (exhausted) all day at my desk thinking about Joe, Ivy, "Sophie," all of it. I played through Downfall again over the next couple days. As far as I could tell then it did not have a branching storyline, as I got the same ending twice and don't remember any choices that were made where the screen dims or a sound is made letting you know you have made a game altering decision. Either way-I was still left with many questions, and I wanted MORE -sort of like when I was all done playing Silent Hill. 
I forgot about Downfall for awhile, and just recently I was browsing through my games and thought I'd give TCL another go as it had been years since I played. Then I thought, wait-let me play Downfall again first then I will play TCL again. I had just really "cracked" Downfall open and was a couple hours in, when I saw there was a remake just released-with better graphics, but more importantly voice acting and additional content. I was SO excited I purchased it without even reading a review or watching the trailer. I didn't need to-I knew it would be amazing, and I would have paid AAA+ pricing for the game without a second thought. 
The remake was everything I'd hoped it would be and more! The game is fine polished now and graphics have improved tenfold while still maintaining that "vignette" feel to it. The voice acting is absolutely superb, which is tough because, just like when you read a book and then watch the movie remake if it, the actors have to look and sound the part that you imagined while reading it. Well-when a game is all subtitled, you envision the characters sounding a certain way, and if the sound is too far from that, it is a tough sell. Joe, Ivy, the "manageress" (think the devs coined that term-but I like it), Sophie, Harrison (he cracked me up-what a douche)-and everyone else sounds just as they should. 
[b]Voice Acting:[/b]
Ivy's accent was so very unique, and hard to put my finger on, almost like a Northern European that speaks English as their second language, and learned English from someone with an Irish accent. Whatever it may be, it couldn't be more perfect that someone like Ivy would have such a hard to "put your finger on" kind of accent-it's beautiful, mysterious and magnificant! Joe's accent which is best described as "I'm just a American dude, who is sarcastic, indifferent to the world and usually stoned"  is also very well fitting, and had me laughing at times. Harrison's voice hit the nail right on the head as a perfect d-bag, he reminded me of "Steff" in 'Pretty in Pink.' The "manageress" was phenomenal, the best in the game and whoever she is should seriously consider acting IRL. She nailed the affect in her voice giving it the feel of "I am an incredibly intelligent, insastiably horny snob, who always has an ulterior motive." 
[b]The Story:[/b]
This game falls into the horror genre, no doubt about that. I feel that is it very important to point out that, unlike so many predictable, slasher/gore/jumpscare fest games (many of which I truly enjoy playing BTW) this gem really does have a unique storyline, which does not follow any genre norms, or cliches. This game may mean very different things to different people, and thus it is difficult for me to try and "nutshell" the story, especially without spoilers. So, I will say that for me, this is a story of the human psyche and how the subconscious mind can take on a life of its own, and crush all hope of the conscious mind ever returning to "normalcy".  It is truly intriguing to me that the developers of this game are men, given the choice and more importantly the delivery of the story content. Not that I like to stereotype, but let's face it, we all have our biases and we do frame things with them everyday-ya just can't help it. I don't want to spoil the story here, but let's just say it touches on some very heavy subject matter, in a way that makes people truly see just how crushing, and sometimes even fatal, certain "mental illnesses/disorders" can be. I am not speaking from personal experience but I am a woman, and have a degree in the mental health field, which helps "set the stage." 
[b]Last important bits to consider:[/b]
[list]
[*]I take my time when playing a game, but must not take enough time as I miss achievements! I have logged 15hrs of playtime, and finished ending "A." (in all fairness I would say 1-2hrs of that was idle time)
[*]This game is extremely graphic-not just blood, guts and gore (which there is plenty of), but also in the presentation of it, and context it is delivered in. Not for children or the squeamish!
[*]To truly enjoy this game properly, one must have a semi-quiet playing space, with volume turned up on your computer and dimmed lighting (doesn't have to be completely dark) is best to really enjoy it visually.
[*]There are only two possible "jumpscare" moments in this game (it doesn't need them -trust me)
[*]I have missed more than half of the achievements and only reached one ending. I am not sure how many endings there are, and what they entail.
[*]Don't overthink your choices when reaching a branch in the storyline. There are too many of these moments in the game and it ruins the flow to overthink your dialogue choices. Just save often, and label the saves accordingly, then respond the way you would IRL or the way you want to make Joe respond. 
[*]You will most likely NOT need a guide or walkthrough to complete the game. It is not a puzzle game, but has some tricky spots. If you just interact with everything with a "pop up," and think about the tasks at hand you should be fine. If you are an achievement junkie, I highly recommend giving this an honest playthrough to fully absorb the story, in all its glory before reading any guides. 
[/list]
[b]PS:Dear devs: You guys ROCK[/b]

21485700.review:
Oh My Dog- what a game. "Downfall" is a dark descent into the twisted mind of a troubled individual; Joe and Ivy's marriage sets the scene for a compelling story arc throughout the title. 

Downfall's world-weary art style and character perspective helps to create a world in which pessimism is not merely an option- but an unquestioned way of life. Depression has never been so enjoyable. Not as good as "The Cat Lady", but Harvester Games have once again brought the goods to the table- and did not disappoint. 

Some of the few downsides of this game include the game's short length and the narrow-minded, conservative approach to murder scenes.
 Rather than a completely scripted and uncompromising approach to murder, I'd have prefered a gameplay mechanism in which I decide how I kill the characters. The game in many aspects holds the players hand too firmly- sometimes leaving the gameplay feeling a bit little stiff and tiresome.


 Regardless, this is a must play for any fan of "choice and consequence" games or dark storylines in general. I can honestly say "Downfall" is one of the most unique games I've ever played, and its numerous thought-provoking characteristics will ensure you never forget your stay at Quiet Haven.         
 
                                                                                                                                        8/10

21485189.review:
Long story short: If you love horror adventure type of games with an amazing style you need to buy this game: JUST DO IT! If you still are not sure about this purchase you can read here in full length why you probably should buy this piece of art: 

To be honest from the start, "The Cat Lady" by R. Michalski brought me up to this game as a fan already even before I played "Downfall" and I left as an even bigger fan of the whole story. Although "The Cat Lady" is a storywise prequel to what happens in this game, "Downfall" still stands there as an independent game which can be played without playing the other game first. 

Just a short summary of the story without spoiling anything: The marriage of Joe and Ivy Davis is not going too well, so Joe organized a trip to a nice country hotel as a chance to repair their broken relationship. After a fight between the two of them, Ivy disappears under mysterious circumstances and in order to save her Joe  goes on a quest through a creepy, disturbing and surreal environment embedded into the hotel they stayed in. Determined to save his wife Ivy, Joe is ready to go far into the abyss of human nature...

So much for the story. The player is playing as Joe Davis, exploring the scenery in "The Quiet Haven Hotel" using simple arrow commands to walk around and interact with the environment. To solve puzzles you are picking up items to use them on certain other objects. The difficulty of these was perfect for this type of game because they were not too easy but not hard enough to break the flow of the game in case the player gets stuck; but at the same time the puzzles weren't generic especially in terms of creativity due to them being incredibly disturbing sometimes. Another key gameplay feature is the ability to choose between dialogue options, making significant decisions occasionally (there are 3 possible endings depending on things you say/do on your journey). Furthermore the game supports full voice acting and the voice actors did a great job overall in giving the characters more personality and depth. 

Now, the pros and the cons for this game. 
First of all, the pros: Surrealism and horror are two terms which are made for each other and you will find a spectacular mix of the two of them in this game, crafted into a beautifully eerie environment; if you like things like that combined with a stunning soundtrack that always fits the situtation perfectly you will fall in love with this game (47 titles which can be bought separately as an addition to the game). Although it still is a game, much play time will be invested in plot development, this should be kept in mind when considering to buy this game, but luckily the story does not let the buyer down. I was totally content with the way the plot unfolded and unraveled (and especially with the appearing characters too!); all endings made sense and the game remained true to what it is, a horror game. Beside the plot which I liked anyway, the game also deals with real life problems (especially anorexia) in a hauntingly shocking way which I will remember probably long after playing it.
 Now the cons: The one thing I need to criticize the most is that for the full experience you should have played "The Cat Lady" already, because the endings just make so much more sense with the knowledge you gain from this game (although I certainly recommend everyone to play it anyway). Another negative thing is the tutorial sequence. It just seemed forced and it was mainly unnecessary for the plot itself [spoiler] Robbie dying because of hand grenades, come on, just why [/spoiler]. For the cost of this game a duration of 4-5 hours is not really much neither.

Summary: I can completely recommend this game to fans of horror who like a nicely narrated story with well-made characters. The different dialogue options and endings invite the buyer to replay it, justifying the short duration of this game.

21474913.review:
주인공인 조 데이비스 Joe Davis 와 그의 여친 아이비 Ivy 의 관계는 갈수록 나락으로 떨어지고 있습니다. 
문제는, 데이비스는 자기가 무엇을 잘못했는지 모르는것 입니다. 그녀는 가끔 말이 없어지고 불안해 했지만, 그 증세는 갈수록 강해집니다..

이런 이유로 다시 소원해진 둘의 관계를 다시 전진시키기 위하여,  이번 기회에 로멘틱한 휴가를 보내기 위해 잠깐 여행을 가기로 했답니다. 하지만 폭풍이 몰아치게 되어 어쩔수 없이 가까운 Quite heaven 호텔에 머무르게 되는데요

이 조용한 천국 호텔은 이름처럼 천국은 아니었습니다...지옥이군요.



The cat Lady 작품의 주인공인 harvest moon 사의 처녀작 Downfall 의 리메이크작이 되겠습니다.
전작의 주인공인 수잔 에시우드의 아파트에 숨겨져 있는 이해할 수 없는 떡밥들과, 
영문을 알수 없던 비밀에 싸인  조 데이비스의 궁금증을 해결 할 수 있는 짧지만 재미있는 게임이었습니다.

새롭게 애니메이션 연출을 더하여 기존의 그레이 톤 연출에 분위기를 한껏 더했습니다!

전작의 정말 아쉬웠던 볼품없는 성우와 녹음환경이 대폭 좋아졌기때문에, 이번 작품은 훨씬 몰입이 잘되었습니다.
전작에서 이것저것 시험하던 연출, 게임스타일등의 톡특한 여러 기법들을 이번 작품에서 혼신의 힘을 다해 완벽하게 만드려는 시도가 보였습니다, 그리고 그것들은 훌륭했고요!

전작보다 더 잔인하고, 선정적이고..그로테스하고...역겨웠습니다. 최고의 경험입니다.
오 그리고 OST!
전작에서 OST를 사랑하셨던 유저분들에게 희소식입니다. 전작 The cat lady 의 OST를 담당했던 Warmer 가 이번에도 손을 대었습니다!

아직 1회차이기에 좀 더 파해쳐야 겠지만 역시 다양한 문장의 선택지와 선택에 따른 변화가 있는것으로 파악됩니다.

전작과는 달리 퍼즐의 난이도가 너무 낮지 않았나 싶은 아쉬운 감이 없잔아 있습니다. 예전작에서는 2챕터에서 얼마나 크게 멘붕을 했는지 모르겠습니다만, 이번엔 공략한번 안보고 쉽게 깨어버렸습니다..덕분에 조금 돈 값을 못한다는 기분이 들었습니다. 기본적인 볼륨에 정말 제정신이 아니고서야 쉽게 풀 수 없는 수준의 퍼즐로 뻥튀기 되던 플탐이 반토막 나버렸으니깐요..

이걸 재외하고요?

최곱니다.

추천하냐고요?
전작을 안해봤다면 전작인 The cat lady 를 먼저 해보심을 추천드려요!
해보셨다고요?! 재밌으셨어요?!?! 세상에 뭐해욧!! 지갑을 열어욧!!!!

21451591.review:
Immediate impressions were terrible. Horrible voice acting and boring gameplay that feels more like doing chores than solving puzzles. I was ready to write this game off as laughable...

But I toughed it out and finished the game, and let me tell you it was worth it. The jump in quality from the start to finish of the game is MASSIVE. For all the missteps the game takes, it manages to do just enough things right to make the journey worth it. 

There is certainly enough content to warrant to price tag, my first playthrough was about six hours, and there are a good number of endings to keep you coming back...

...but its hard to come back to a game that starts this slow, with unskippable dialouge that will test your patience to see more than one ending.

TL:DR Downfall was worth playing, but will certainly test what you're willing to put up with in a video game. I'm ready to start The Cat Lady next.

21436566.review:
Downfall was one of my most hyped up releases of the past year or so, as I carry a certain fondess for the original 2009 version and The Cat Lady. After having played it, I can say that it was worth the hype, as the gameplay, soundtrack, characters and setting are all fantastic and tons of fun to soak in. 

However, be wary: the voice acting in this game is a teensy bit forced and, as much as I don't want to say it, amateurish (any time a certain character yells, you can hear their voice echo in the room they recorded it in, for example) and the plot can be difficult to describe and keep interest in. Aside from those points, though, Downfall is a great horror adventure game that feels more dynamic and involved than TCL, but less gripping and emotional.

21416507.review: This game was great! I played the original Downfall a while back and now seeing the remastered version of it is amazing. This game has a unique plot and characters, and it always kept me on the edge of my seat. I really like how the choices one makes affects the game's outcome. I played through it multiple times and finally got all possible outcomes and achievements. The music and art used in the game was amazing, and well-placed for each scene. Without a doubt I say it's one of the best dark, psychological horror games I've ever played. It only comes second to The Cat Lady. I'd like to say "well done" to everyone who had a hand in making this game, and I hope to see more from you in the future!

21398021.review:
Once you start playing this lovely gem of a game, it's really hard to stop. From the beginning of the game to the end, I've been very cautious with my choices, making sure I don't say the wrong thing or make the wrong choice that will affect my chances of a good ending. When I get to the end of the game, it turns out I was off by one and I end up getting the bad ending, which resulted in me playing the game again to get the Golden Ending, and let me tell you, playing the game a second time is definitely worth it. 
The controls are pretty much the same as from 'The Cat Lady' but with the addition of the quicksave/quickload option using the "F" keys which are a BIG help and such a good convenience, especially when you think you've made the wrong choice in a segment. Just hit the key from your last quicksave and you're immediately brought back to that segment. 
The dialogue is great, with a good cast of voice actors, along with some cameos from some favorable Youtubers, and the references are a real fun treat if you manage to spot any.
All in all, if you loved 'The Cat Lady' you'll love this game as well.
 
Anyways, if anyone is interested, here's a Golden Ending Walkthrough that I've made:

https://youtu.be/UxkwkUYLPXE

По сравнению с оригиналом новый Downfall лучше понимает, чем хочет быть, что и плюс, и минус одновременно - в оригинале больше странных и экспериментальных моментов, порой не нужных, из-за чего он выглядит аляповатее, но более сюрреалистично.

21388338.review: Did you like The Cat Lady? Then you will love Downfall!

21377500.review:
Fans of "The Cat Lady" will appreciate this game, which adds another chapter onto that story while also providing a full new game in the same art and game style.

This 2016 game is a remake of its 2009 self, maintaining much of the original story, but morphing it into the new "Cat Lady" style and interface.  This is generally an extreme improvement, though also manages to be odd in amusing ways.  "The Cat Lady" managed to engulf all of the original "Downfall" into its own plot arc, and did so in a subtle way that worked very well.  Here, the Downfall remake attempts to reengulf "The Cat Lady," for an odd game-ception effect.  Fans of "The Cat Lady" are likely to be pleased, but any newcomers to this universe are more likely to just be clueless and baffled by the jarring and out of place late-game characters.

Also, while this version polishes some of the rougher patches of the 2009 story, I can't honestly say that this story is as good as "The Cat Lady."  Not that that's necessarily a bad thing.  "The Cat Lady (TCL)" was AMAZING.  As such, it makes sense that this game would pull so much of its elements into itself to get that boost.  It's a fair move, and it works, but not completely.  The game suffers most just in comparison to the game it's copying: the sequel (this game) just isn't as good as the original (TCL, 2012).  Even though, technically, this is both the sequal (2016) AND the original (2009).

21373475.review:
Игра просто великолепна! Ради всех концовок проходил игру аж 4 раза и она мне не надоела( один раз я облажался и получил стандартную концовку второй раз, но  даже те 2 стандартные концовки, которые я получил, немного отличались друг от друга из-за моих выборов). А всё благодаря чему: во-первых, в игре шикарнейшие натуральные диалоги и персонжаи, которые выглядят очень реалистично, во-вторых, неизменная прекрасная стилистика The Cat Lady( саундтрек, кинемотагрофичная режиссура и визуальный ряд), в-третьих, сама история очень трогательная и красивая( мне не нравился Downfall 2009 года, потому что сюжет в нём был каким-то грязным и мерзким, но тут его неплохо переделали), в-четвёртых, геймплей достаточно нелинейный- в игре огромное количество моментов, когда игроку приходится делать выбор и нужно очень чётко понимать,  что хочет сказать автор, чтобы достичь желаемого результата...  но многое в игре неочевидно, и игрок до последней минуты сидит в напряжении- а сделал ли он всё как надо? а правильно ли поступил в тот или иной момент? а может ли быть лучше? Ведь одна неправильно сказанная вами реплика может перечеркнуть все ваши старания)
Отдельно хочется сказать спасибо автору за достаточно простой английский и за то, что не задрачивает игрока зубодробительными квестами- головоломки решаются интуитивно и не отвлекают от сюжета и персонажей. 
P. S.: но Cat Lady мне всё равно больше нравится)

Absolutely phenomenal.  This remake has, in many ways, surpassed the original, opting for an artistic and mechanical style more in keeping with The Cat Lady.  The surreal environments, unnerving music, and compelling characters make this a solid piece in its own right.

If you played The Cat Lady at all, there's a lot here for you.  Little nods to the game, both in dialogue and flavor text, are plentiful, and if you play your cards right, you may just see a few familiar someones at the end.

The Voice acting was a bit weird at times, but this is a beautiful sequel/prequel to the Cat lady and the old Downfall game as it fills in all the gaps.
I love this game because it takes abstract concepts such as an illness, and it makes it physical and able to see. There's so much to this game than meets the eye, every time i play it I get a new feel for it, like i'm constantly discovering a new detail that makes the two stories come together.
In a way, it's also a life lesson to anyone who's struggling with any problems of the sort, especially food eating disorders. I definitely recommend this game, the story is beautiful.

21363643.review:
Downfall is not a game about death or about love, it is simply a game about life - and all its horrors and wonders.
Notably different from the original, and still true to it, cleverly related to The Cat Lady, this graphic adventure offers moments or pure happiness (because of the writing, the music, the art and a smooth, fluid but not superficial gameplay) and lots of violence and gore. Always motivated.
I'll recommend it also to non gamers, because the language it speaks is universal. Just give it a chance (and play The Cat Lady first, if you already haven't).

21331517.review:
So my journey was: playing The Cat Lady, playing the first Downfall partway through, and then playing this gem. I have to say I am so happy that I was introduced to Harvester & R. Michalski by my friends here on Steam!!! 

2016 Downfall absolutely exceeded all of my expectations. It has so much new from the first Downfall (story-wise) and is beyond the perfect chaser if you're looking for something after The Cat Lady. As a fan of adventure/horror games - it really doesn't get better than this. The haunting art, outstanding music, full voice acting (yes it's a bit poor quality in some areas - but judging it for what it is I *loved* it!), the story...the choices...replayability....it's just a fantastic game. 

Believe me - I was REALLY hype for this game so if anything I was nervous that it would let me down in some way - but it was SO GOOD. I will go and play it a few times over now. If you're on the fence about purchasing this: you will not regret it. Please support Harvester & Screen 7...and Warmer and the VAs and everyone on this project! I am looking forward to the final piece of this "trilogy", Lorelai.

21326556.review:
Very much everything you'd expect from the developer that gave us Cat Lady. Raw, gritty, without peers, hauntingly beautiful at times and a complete mind fuck.

This visuals are a continuation of the unique art style of the Cat Lady, along with the story the stand out element of the game. From the outset the game is manic, as early as 10 minutes in tackling issues such as the incredibly gruesome [spoiler]death of a sibling[/spoiler], eating disorders, break down of a marriage, control within relationships & later infidelity. There are plot elements which leave you completely and utterly torn between whether or not character choices were the selfish or the selfless thing to do or more likely both. I fealt helpless, useless, no comprehension of whether I was helping or harming. True to it's name as the game progresses the plot points and character's sanity levels plummet to the point where reality is a blur, the game makes your head spin, leaves a bad taste in your mouth like a fryed belly fat / human head and "oregano" smoothie but for all the gore it's an immensely beautiful game in it's own bizarre way akin to doing the perfect swan dive from a waterfall into a pool of blood. The scene composition is stunning, something any photographer would rightly be proud of.

For fans of the Cat Lady there are many popular returning characters and elements of the story tie directly into that game thus it's hard for me as a fan to not recommend.

The Cat Lady was the best game I'd ever played - until now. Downfall has just surpassed it.
