21304969.review:
Ayant retournée l'original dans tous les sens et l'ayant adoré, j'étais impatient de voir ce remake de Downfall sortir.

Ceux qui ont aimé The Cat Lady vont probablement aimer ce remake de Downfall, et le jeu essaie clairement de relier l'histoire de Downfall avec The Cat Lady (je peux même dire que ça se passe après les evènements de The Cat Lady).

Il raconte l'histoire du jeu original avec des nouveautés qui complètent l'histoire de Downfall et quelques modifications qui donnent un nouveau souffle au jeu. Cependant, certaines modifications sont sérieusement conséquents (la fin du remake n'a absolument rien à voir avec celui de l'original, par exemple).

Il faut faire attention au choix qu'on fait, car ces choix auront, pour la plupart, une influence sur la fin qu'on obtiendra (comptés en points /27).

La durée de vie est, comme dit, d'environ 5 heures pour une partie (mais après, le fait d'avoir fait l'original m'a aidé à savoir ce qu'il fallait faire par moments, donc je dirait une heure ou 2 de plus pour ceux qui n'ont jamais fait l'original).

Petit bonus: Si j'avais senti une influence de Silent Hill 2 dans le jeu original, eh bien c'est encore plus prononcé dans ce remake (au niveau de l'histoire), mais il faudrait spoiler pour que je puisse m'expliquer ^^'

En conclusion, je le recommande! Je ne regrette pas une seconde d'avoir acheté ce jeu et je vais probablement me le refaire pour essayer d'avoir la meilleure fin :)

21296807.review:
https://youtu.be/UaCxgQeyIeU
[i]Game:[/i] Downfall
[i]Genre:[/i] Psychological Horror Adventure
[i]Developer:[/i] Harvester Games
[i]Publisher:[/i] Screen 7
[i][u]Copy supplied by developer[/u][/i]

[b]Downfall[/b] is a psychological horror adventure game developed by Harvester Games and published by Screen 7, the same people behind 2012's [i]The Cat Lady[/i]. This is a remake of the 2009 game by the same developers, and it is included in this version.

[h1]STORY[/h1]
You play as Joe Davis, a man who goes on vacation with his wife Ivy to the Quiet Haven hotel to try and fix their marriage problems. However, after the first night, Ivy disappears and weird, disturbing, violent and space-bending things start to happen.
If you played the developer's previous game or read some of Stephen King's horror novels, you know what you are gonna get: a creepy and weird story with depressed characters and dark humor. Saying more about the story would spoil it, but just know this: I was hooked from the get-go and I played the entire game in one sitting, which rarely happens to me. I laughed, I cringed, and I even cried while playing this. One of the best stories in a game since Telltale's first season of The Walking Dead.

[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
The game is made with [i]Adventure Game Studio[/i], and you will either love or hate how it looks. It's mostly in black and white with 2D stripes and burst of colors (mostly a lot of red blood). There are some disturbing and gory images that might scar those who aren't used to them, and a couple of sequences will leave you with your eyes wide open in sheer terror.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
The game is played entirely with the keyboard. You can pick up, examine and use items, as well as talk to the people that you will find. It is a very standard adventure game and there isn't any sequence that changes things up a bit, but the game focuses more on the story rather than gameplay, and the latter works more than well to move the story forward.

[h1]CHALLENGE[/h1]
The puzzle are usually really intuitive and even non-fans of the genre won't have trouble figuring out what to do. Still, I would've liked a couple more thought-provoking puzzles than the ones that we got.

[h1]SOUND[/h1]
The voice acting is either going to ruin or make your experience. I personally really enjoyed it: the voice actors deliver their lines in a weird way that, surprisingly, works with the overall tone of the movie. I also really enjoyed the soundtrack that mixes quiet and eerie tracks with hard-rock songs.

[h1]REPLAYABILITY[/h1]
There are many choices that you make in the game that will change the outcome, leading to one of three different endings. There are also 30 Steam achievements to unlock that will keep you completionists busy enough to play the game at least three times.

Overall, [b]Downfall[/b] is an incredible adventure game that delivers a compelling, eerie and romantic story with simple but effective gameplay, delightfully weird voice acting and good replayability. A must-buy for fans of great stories in video games!

[h1]Story: 10
Graphics: 8
Gameplay: 8
Challenge: 6
Sound: 9
Replayability: 8

[b]ENJOYMENT: 9.5
FRUSTRATION: 2[/b][/h1]

So I originally preordered this game for the Silent Hill 2 feelings the trailers gave me, Having played through twice I can say I was pretty satisfied with both the purchase and the assessment.

It’s short game (takes a little over three hours once you’ve got the puzzle solutions down,) but I enjoyed the story and the puzzles. While my second playthrough started to hit some glitches (mostly just Joe sliding around the screen when I attempt to open doors, nothing that impacted actual game play or story) and I'm having a bit of trouble figuring out what to vary in actions to change my ending, I’d certainly recommend others buying this.

The indie source shows in a lot of the voice acting audio and some of the artwork in close up scenes, but it's nothing I can't live with.The Voice acting may drive people some people up the wall because I know some people really can't stand any issues with voice audio quality, but I will say it's improved immensely since The Cat Lady. So if you could put up with the recording issues there, you'll probably be just fine with this game.

I'm certainly looking forward to more work by this developer.

21287976.review:
Downfall без сомнения замечательная и прекрасная игра, затрагивающая серьёзные и тяжёлые темы. Но, к сожалению такого глубокого эмоционального осадка как  после прохождения Cat Lady не оставляющего. Это ни в коем случае нельзя отнести к упрёкам Downfall, уж так получилось, что эти две истории похожи, но в то же время разные по своему. В любом случае Downfall и Cat Lady обязательны к прохождению всем жаждущим неповторимых историй, о которых потом вспоминаешь всю неделю после их завершения.

Своё начало Downfall  берет с парадной двери небольшого отеля «Quiet Heaven», куда на ночь заезжают в поисках укрытия от яростной грозы Джо Дэвис вместе со своей женой Айви. Это весьма неудачное решение и служит чередой странных и ужасных событий. Событий, которые расписывать тут просто дело безоткатное и неуважительно по отношению к тем, кто решится уделить  Downfall своё время. Мельком можно отметить мотивацию главного действующего лица как  ясную и понятную, но от чего-то на настоящие переживания и сочувствия  не сильно толкающие, и поэтому он всего лишь и остаётся «персонажем» и никем больше. В то же время душевные переживания его жены Айви, незаслуженно присутствующее в крайне скупом количестве, трогают за душу куда сильнее и крепче. Остальные обитатели отеля тоже интересны по своему, но опять-таки, остаются лишь «обитателями».

Стилистика полностью выполнена в черно-белых тонах с проблесками красного цвета, что превосходно вписывается в происходящее. Добавленный красный цвет выбран не просто так, ведь как можно изобразить сцены насилия и жестокости без данного цветового оттенка? А насильственные сцены тут приходится лицезреть в достаточном количестве. 
Распутывание всей истории сопровождается решением небольших загадок и задачек, которые буквально на лету отпадают сами собой настолько они последовательны и просты. И это только плюс; в Downfall – история на первом месте, всё остальное лишь дополнение. 

Небольшая цена, превосходный и интригующий сюжет,  делают Downfall  одной из лучших трат денег любого геймера ценящего в играх исполнение и стиль повествования.

21282027.review:
[i]"If you are the voices in your head, then who is listening to them?"[/i]

[h1]Game overview[/h1]

* Genre: indie, adventure, psychological horror
* Avg length: ~5 hours
* Developer: Harvester Games
* Publisher: Screen 7
* Release date: 15th February 2016
* Platform: PC

[b]<<<Pros & cons>>>[/b]

+ Interesting story! 
+ Gorgeous looking
+ Fitting soundtrack
+ An atmosphere not easily forgotten
+ Open for interpretation
+ Includes the original [i]Downfall[/i]!
(+ Same universe as TCL!)
- Weird changes in volume 
- Monotonous or bad quality voice acting 

[h1]Full game review[/h1]

After I finished playing [i]The Cat Lady[/i] (TCL) last year, I was eagerly looking for more games that carried on the same style. I came across [i]Downfall[/i], a game released in 2009 and created by the same guys. I played it a little bit - never finished it though - and was definitely intrigued by it. When I found out that the developers were working on a remake, I felt like the happiest person alive. A 'new' game that would show why [i]The Cat Lady[/i] got the attention it deserved. The biggest question is now ofcourse: was the remake of R. Michalski's first game what we hoped for, or was it perhaps a downfall too?

[b]<<<Story>>>[/b]

Meet Joe and Ivy Davis, a couple that has been struggling with their marriage for a long time due to Ivy's eating disorder. In order to try and save it, they decide to go on a trip to "Quiet Haven Hotel". Things don't really go as Joe had hoped, but as stubborn as he is, tries to keep fighting for Ivy. After all, he is supposed to love her .... Right?

[b]<<<Gameplay, fun factor and replayability>>>[/b]

Just like in TCL, the gameplay exists out of two major elements: progressing the story via dialogue and exploring the area to do various puzzles and actions. Being a character driven game, there is quite a lot of dialogue to be found, but luckily, the conversations never felt uninteresting. I was also quite surprised with the amount of different replies that you can give. You can behave like the sweet and understanding husband, or like one that is totally fed up with the whole situation. Furthermore, if the game's madness wasn't already enough for you, there's also that spoon of humour that they threw into the mix - it's rather amusing.

Being not a big puzzle solver myself, I was pleased to see that this game focused a little bit more on story progression. The puzzles that were present, never felt too difficult or frustrating. In fact, most of them are pretty straight forward. All in all, they are really fun to solve/do. Lastly, both of those elements (dialogue + puzzles) alternated often enough to keep the game fun and fluent: I never felt like either of them went on for too long or became tedious.

Personally, I am someone who plays through heavily story-based games (mostly) only once, but for those who so desire: there are multiple endings! So try to forget all about this game and maybe replay it within a couple of months. Or, if you just want to try out all the different dialogue options/hunt down the achievements, you can do that. Just make sure to save often enough or make use of the quick-save option. 

[b]<<<Controls, graphics and sound[/b]

The controls are very minimalistic: wandering around is done by the arrow keys. Inventory usage? Yep, you guessed it: arrow keys! All confirmation is done by pressing enter. Lastly, want to skip some dialogue during your second playthrough? The space key is your friend. The controls worked like they should, however ... 1 tiny little thing bugged me throughout my playthrough: at certain parts of the game, you have many items at the same time. Instead of having to press the right arrow key multiple times to get to the furthest item, it would've been useful if I could've just pressed the left arrow key to get to it. 

As the original [i]Downfall[/i] was a little bit more colourful, this game presents itself in a 2d black-white style, with some sporadic colouring to be found. I like to think that the usage of black-white or colours reflect the characters' state of mind/certain events, but that is merely my personal interpretation. Whatever the developers tried to express, there is no doubt that it adds to the (creepy) atmosphere of the game. I also have to say that they did an exceptional job on the looks of the game. TCL already looked pretty good, but this game looks just gorgeous. Just about every area has been created with a lot of detail and care. 

Along with the beautiful art comes the amazing soundtrack. I found the OST to be equally as good as the one in TCL. There was a lot of variety to be heard - from slow and creepy piano sounds to loud and heavy guitar riffs - that nailed setting the tone/atmosphere for the whole game. As it should be clear now, this is a game that makes you feel uncomfortable with almost everything that happens. Despite this feeling of unease, you just want to keep playing and discover how the story will unfold. These guys may not make bestselling games, but they are masters at setting an atmosphere so creepy, even at times when nothing's really happening: it's all in our head.

My biggest point of critique (regarding the sound section) concerns the voice acting (VA), especially during the prologue: as a prologue is meant to peek the player's first interest, I was rather disappointed. The VA during the rest of the game was ok though. A last point of critique goes to the different volume levels: there were certain scenes were one character was almost shouting in my ear, whilst the other was pretty much mumbling. Also, it seems like not every VA had a good quality mic, which is a shame. All in all, ok voice acting, but there is a lot of room for improvement.

[b]<<<The verdict>>>[/b]

I am glad to conclude that this game was not a 'downfall' at all. People who enjoyed TCL will not only play through a new story that they'll get to love, but are also in for quite a surprise later in the game! Fans of (psychological) horror are also in for quite a ride, but may miss some references: I definitely recommend playing TCL aswell. Even if you don't like horror, you still may want to give this game a try. I'm not a real fan of horror myself - on the contrary - I try to stay away from it as much as possible. Yet, I found a special joy and satisfaction in playing such a stylistic game that dares to embrace such confrontational subjects.

21254656.review:
[h1]Downfall - Ein tiefer Einblick in menschliche Abgründe[/h1]

Der Schöpfer und Erfinder von [b]The Cat Lady[/b] "Remigiusz Michalski" hat wieder zugeschlagen.
Mit geballter Power, einer [b]unvergleichlichen, allerdings auch blutigen und knallharten Atmosphäre[/b], [b]eigens komponierten; stimmungsvollen Musikstücken[/b], [b]wunderschön in Szene gesetzten Hintergründen[/b] und einem [b]in sich geschlossenen; selbst erdachten Universum[/b], kehrt ein weiteres Meisterwerk von "Harvester Games" zurück auf die PC-Bildschirme.

Ich muss zugeben, dass mich der Hype um [b]Downfall[/b] nach [b]The Cat Lady[/b] bereits gepackt hat und ich nicht drumherum gekommen bin, mir eine Version (inklusive OST und DRM-Version) vorzubestellen.

Wie bei allen storylastigen Titeln, halte ich mich auch hier wieder, so gut es geht, bedeckt.

Wie zuvor [b]The Cat Lady[/b] auch schon, ist [b]Downfall[/b] ein [b]klassisches, psychologisches Horror-Adventurespiel[/b], das simpel mit der [b]Tastatur[/b] spiel- und steuerbar ist.
Da [b]explizite Gewaltdarstellungen[/b] vorhanden sind, ist es definitiv kein Spiel für zartbesaitete Menschen oder gar Kinder.

Wir starten als Hauptprotagonist [b]Joe Davis[/b] und erleben einen wunderbar in Szene gesetzten Einstieg [b](eine Art Tutorial)[/b] in ein noch viel tiefergreifendes und emotionsreiches, gleichermaßen aber abstruses und gnadenloses Sammelsurium aus "Mindfu**s", welches uns der Schöpfer "Remigiusz Michalski" und sein Team hier präsentiert bzw. in den Kopf hämmert.
Nach einem "schmerzhaften Erlebnis" beginnt dann das eigentliche Spiel in einem abgelegenen Hotel namens "Quit Haven Hotel" zusammen mit unserer Frau [b]Ivy[/b].
Hin und Hergerissen zwischen eigenen Empfindungen gegenüber den Protagonisten des Spieles (wir spielen nicht nur Joe, verrate ich an dieser Stelle), liegt es an uns, dem Spiel ein [b]auf uns zugeschnittenes Spielerlebnis und befriedigendes Ende zu bereiten[/b].
Den Rest wird jeder Spieler für sich selbst, ungespoilert meinerseits, herausfinden müssen.

Nach etwa [b]7 1/2 Stunden[/b] reinsten Spielgenusses der wirklich sehr durchdachten Story, bereue ich keinen einzigen Cent, den ich investiert habe.
Die kleinen [b]Rätsel[/b] sind nicht der Rede wert und lassen sich [b]schnell und logisch[/b] lösen, sodass ein Voranschreiten der Story kaum gemindert wird. Finde ich persönlich ein wenig schade. Ich hätte es mir gerne ein wenig rätsellastiger gewünscht, aber sonderlich gestört hat es mich auch nicht, da der Fokus ganz klar woanders liegt.
Auf mich warten noch gute 16 [b]Achievements[/b], die es für mich zu entdecken gilt und auch mit meinem [b]freigespielten Ende[/b] bin ich noch nicht gänzlich zufrieden (es scheint [b]mehrere Enden[/b] zu geben).
Der [b]Wiederspielwert[/b] ist, dank der ausgeklügelten Story, ganz klar vorhanden. Ständig hatte ich das Gefühl, irgendetwas verpassen zu können, seien es kleine Details oder Dialogoptionen und das habe ich beim ersten Spieldurchgang anscheinend auch.
Auch ist es das erste Spiel, bei dem ich ständig die Screenshot-Taste im Augenwinkel hatte, da es [b]grafisch noch eine ganze Schippe drauflegt[/b], im Gegensatz zu [b]The Cat Lady[/b]. Kleinere Kamerafahrten und Shots auf bestimmte Gegenstände sind nur kleinere Beispiele der Verbesserungen.

Nach dem Ende von [b]Downfall[/b] saß ich erstmal eine ganze Weile sprach- und regungslos da, bevor ich mich entschlossen habe, diese Review zu verfassen.

Für mich ist [b]Downfall[/b] nach [b]The Cat Lady[/b] und somit "Harvester Games" im Allgemeinen der Inbegriff für perfekten Spielgenuss geworden, wenn es um psychologischen, intelligenten und tiefgreifenden Horror in Spielform geht.
"Remigiusz Michalski" + sein Team wissen einfach, wie man den verschiedensten Spielszenen Leben einhaucht und sie in [b]künstlerisch wertvollem Gewand[/b] erstrahlen lässt.
[b]Der OST[/b] ist ebenso phantastisch gehalten. Die teils [b]sehr melancholischen[/b] Klavierklänge werden meine Bibliothek in Zukunft schmücken.
Der [b]Preis[/b] von [b]12,59€ im Sale[/b] ist in meinen Augen absolut gerechtfertigt.
Es gibt zudem noch [b]einige Specials[/b] zu entdecken, die im Spielmenü erreichbar sind.

Wer [b]The Cat Lady[/b] mochte, wird an [b]Downfall[/b] nicht vorbeikommen. Es warten einige Überraschungen auf euch, aber auch diese müsst ihr selbst entdecken.

Viel Spaß beim Spielen und Danke für's Lesen.
Ich kann eine Forsetzung des "rem'schen" Universums kaum erwarten.

21253450.review:
The Cat Lady was my game of the year back in 2014 (even though it came out in 2012) and It's still one of the best games I've ever played story wise. So the expectations I had for this game were huge. This review will be filled with comparisons between these two games so if you haven't played The Cat Lady and are reading this review, just stop here and buy both of these games. And note that I did not play the 2009 original of Downfall because I didn't know it existed until I already heard they were working on a remake, so I wanted to save myself for this one.

Did this game live up to my expectations? Both yes and no. Don't get me wrong, this is an awesome game and I highly recommend it to players that are into these kind of games. However, one reason that this game somewhat didn't live up to my expectations might be because it's a remake of an older game. I wanted this game to surpass The Cat lady which it didn't even come close to. The Cat Lady left me with a great satisfaction and a feeling for closure when I finally beat it (on all endings). This game did not give me that feeling, it gave more of a Telltale games ending, leaving you with a cliffhanger (at least with the first ending I got). Some might love these kind of endings and that's great for them. And some might argue that The Cat Lady is the sequel so it's not really a cliffhanger. This doesn't explain Joe's "cameos" in The Cat Lady though, as far as I know. There are some loose ends in this game that I hung up on and I'm not really a fan of games and movies where you have to interpret your own story or ending.

The second thing that made me a little disappointed was how short this game is compared to The Cat Lady. And yet again, I know that this is a remake and I won't argue against that. The Cat Lady took me around 15-20 hours to fully complete with all endings and 100% achievements (2 of the runs were with the help of a walk-through on YouTube). I completed this game in under 5 hours with 50% of the achievements. I don't see myself sitting for another 10+ hours getting the rest of the achievements and endings since this game was much more simpler than The Cat Lady (didn't get stuck more than a few minutes in this one while it could take me hours to figure out some parts in The Cat Lady).

Last but not least I have to touch on the subject regarding the voice acting. This is something I pointed out as the biggest flaw in my review of The Cat Lady and sadly it wasn't improving in this game. I know, I know, this is a small budget indie game, and so was The Cat Lady but I just can't take some parts in these games seriously due to the lack of emotions from the actors (not all of them though). I always get the image in my head of a person sitting in front of their computer reading of a script with zero emotion and effort when that said character in on screen, and that kills a lot of the mysterious atmosphere in these two games.

Enough of my bashing and rambling. I do still recommend this game and it's still one of the best horror/adventure games I've played in the past years and I would like to thank the developer who has given us these two great games. As a Cat Lady fanatic, I still hold that game highly over this one. I might edit this review in the near future after I'm done with my second play through. That's what I love about these games, they have a really high replay value.

TL; DR: Do you like The Cat Lady? If not, don't bother with this one, otherwise buy this game ASAP. Haven't played either of them? Look up short clips of either game on YouTube (the trailers don't seem to convince people since a lot of negative comments on these games are people not understanding the actual gameplay) and buy both of them. It's not a game for everyone though due to its very dark and twisted story.

21249527.review:
Внизу будет обзор на русском.

Thanks for this great remake! After playing Cat Lady I tried original Downfall, but it was too raw for me. But this one is really awesome.

If you've played Cat Lady already, then I assure you - this game is really similar. Most of the cons and pros are same here.

Pros:
- Really unique style
- Great story pacing and action feedback. There almost always will be something new and intriguing.
- Story is interesting and captivating (upon completing the game I still can't throw it outta my head)
- Simple but still immersive controls
- Awesome soundtrack

Cool but flawed:
- I really like the voice acting. Some people arguing to low quality through but I almost didn't notice that. Still emotions and act are quite impressive for me
- Horror component. OK this one is tricky. I know many people like the darkness and grimness of Harvester Games, so sorry no offence. Horror is really harsh, shocking and you will definitely remember that. That itself is cool for me. What I didn't like is really high amount of meat&rot&maggots disgusting themes which are over the line. In my opinion, there are more elegant ways to scare and shock player, and what game often use these ways. It's a mash of exquisite horror style and then lots of raw meat. Also, sometimes horror sequences really don't look like natural part of the whole game. They are here as if author like them but didn't really though about integrating them into the main story. IMO, again.
- Graphics. It's really amazing what R Michalski managed to do with good old AGS engine. His artistic skills and choices can bewitch. And rough animations somehow comeplement choisen style. Still, it's not 3D AAA and pretty budget, and animations are still rough. I would really like to see Downfall and Among the sleep graphic decisions combined together.

OK, that were cons actually for some people. Don't play if you have overly sensitive sense of hearing. Don't play if you are pregnant/traumatic/healthy american dream/else. It's pretty sick game despite leaning majorly on some cool things like love, hope, courage. The ending will kill you certainly for ceveral days at least. Don't play if you are sensitive to resolution/ PC MASTER RACE.

and another cons:
- Play Cat Lady first, or you won't get ending at all. These games have lots of intersections. Probably to understand more you have to complete original Downfall: A Horror Adventure Game first, but I'm too not-oldschool for dat.

If I'd be a reviewer on IGN or something, my evaluation for this game would be 7.5/10
But the impact of this game upon me worth solid A. Without plus but really solid. As I've said already, can't throw this game outta my head since completing.

Waiting for the next R Michalski's game.

Для тех, кто не дуплит по-английски. Не знаю, зачем вам эта игра, ведь русского в ней нет, а если и будет, то дай бог не чтобы такой, как в Cat Lady в Стиме (машинный), а такой, как у Акеллы в Кошатнице. На случай, если перевод таки будет и он будет норм, мой обзор на русском.  

Спасибо разрабам за офигенный ремейк! После Кошатницы я пытался поиграть в предыдущую игру того же автора, ремейк которой мы наблюдаем, Downfall: A Horror Adventure Game. Не зашло. А вот ремейк охрененен.

Если вы играли в Кошатницу, то тут практически всё то же самое, за исключением акцентов в истории. Если нет, то эти плюсы и минусы для Кошатницы тоже подойдут.


Плюсы:
- Охрененный ни на что не похожий стиль
- История постоянно развивается, продолжается и не даёт скучать, почти постоянно что-то происходит.
- История очень интересная и сильно цепляет (как и с Кошатницей, очень сложно выбросить из головы еще долгое время после прохождения)
- Простые, но при этом отлично справляющиеся с погружением игрока в игру кнопки управления. Нафиг point&click, без него здесь лучше
- Невероятный саундрек 

Как бы и минусы, и как бы плюсы:
- Озвучка мне правда понравилась. Некоторые жалуются, что звучит будто запись в туалете, но я почти не заметил несовершенства самой записи, но что заметил - актеры хорошо справляются с эмоциями и заставляют верить. Это сyка главное в инди адвенчуре
- Хоррорная составляющая. Фанаты закидают меня своими фанатскими гуанами, но я попробую развернуть мысль. Я знаю, что многим нравится мрачная впечатывающая в стену атмосфера игр Р Михальски, так что без обид. Игра реально жесткая, шокирующая и точно останется в памяти. Это круто. Некруто количество мяса&гнили&личинок и прочей бутафории, которой в игре черезчур много. Мне кажется, есть намного более более элегантные способы испугать и шокировать игрока, дак игра ими и пользуется очень часто. Выходит месиво из психологически мощного хоррор стиля и техасской резни бензопилой. И, иногда некоторые моменты будто из другой игры. Они интересные и мощные, но автор будто не особо задумывался о том, как подвязать их вообще к основной истории. Мое личное мнение.
- Графика. Если не знать, что это движок AGS, то можно не поверить. Художественные и режиссерские скиллы реально творят чудеса. Дубовая анимация даже подчеркивает общий стиль. И все же, игра не ЙОБА, бюджетность заметна, а анимации таки дубовые. Я бы был очень рад увидеть лучшее от Downfall и Among The Sleep в одной игре.

.... продолжение в комментах, а то слишком жирно для Стима вышло

21248348.review:
Итак!
После долгих ожиданий ремейка этой игры, я наконец могу написать обзор. 
Во-первых, если Вы фанат игры The Cat Lady и раздумываете над тем, стоит ли покупать эту игру... Да, конечно же, стоит. Атмосфера кошатницы, развернутая история Джо Девиса со второго этажа, квартиры №3. Все это Вас очень порадует. 
Во-вторых, если Вы не играли в игры от этого разработчика, то спешу предупредить:
- Довольно сомнительный тег "хоррор", скорее "мрачная атмосфера". Эта игра может напугать только чрезмерно чувствительных личностей или фэтфобов
- Здесь нет "экшона", только ламповое повествование

Почему же все таки стоит приобрести эту игру?
- Очень низкая цена для качественной интересной истории и офигенных саундтреков (саундтреки никого не оставят равнодушными, они действительно очень правильно и под атмосферу подобраны)
- Игра имеет несколько концовок (все же любят вариативность?)
- Классная, необычная стилистика

Моему восторгу нет предела и я не могу судить об игре непредвзято. Я все.

21246428.review:
I was a huge fan of both The Cat Lady and the original Downfall, especially in how they fit together and the world that was created. When I heard Downfall was being remade I was super psyched, and now it's finally out! Just finished my first runthrough, and I'm so pleased with this new version.

Good
-Voice acting! A little awkward in some places, but generally good. Shoutout to Chiseleya especially! Also a few familiar voices show up, and it was lovely to hear them.
-Clearer, more streamlined plot, including integration with TCL.
-The least intuitive puzzles/least fun segments of the original Downfall were removed or altered.
-Even though I knew the plot of the game and generally what was coming, there were surprises and some moments were still genuinely scary.
-TCL lovers will be extra, unexpectly pleased in the latter portion of the game.

Bad
-Short! I finished in about five hours I think, but I also generally knew how to solve the puzzles/where to progress the plot from the original Downfall so it may be longer for others.
-Answers a lot of previous questions about integration with TCL, but raises some new confusing ones. Maybe it'll make more sense the next play, though.
-A few classic awesome elements of the original Downfall ended up scrapped or altered.
-The plot might be a little TOO in your face and easy to understand now.

In general, I absolutely loved it and I'm looking forward to some more playthroughs. I'm definitely not disappointed with this remake, and even better it's different enough from the original that there's still replayability for both versions. Absolutely awesome.

21246331.review: Downfall. Now where do I start on this game? Downfall is an adventure game with an intriguing storyline. Personally myself, I have played both The Cat Lady and the origional 2009 Downfall. The art-style is similar to that of the Cat Lady. I was pleasently suprised at the amount of changes that Downfall went through from the origional game. Dissapointingly some of the puzzles from the original game were not put into this version of the game, which I enjoyed a lot (Doctor Z's manniquin, combat scenes). I did like how they changed it so that Joe didn't have splitting headaches and slept in the middle of the game as seen in the original game. I felt that it allowed the game to run smoother, and feel of an urgent need to find Ivy. Although I loved the tie-ins to The Cat Lady I can't help but be dissapointed that the twist ending of the original Downfall wasn't used within this verison of the game. Despite this, the game still came alive with the artwork, voice acting, and music used within the game. Overall, I enjoyed this game and wont hesitate to play it again. I suggest anyone a fan of The Cat Lady or similar point-and-click adventure games pick this up. You won't regret it.

21243362.review:
For the record, I played The Cat Lady a long while ago (not too long after I watched Cryotic play it), and I absolutely adored it. I was enamored with the art style and the writing and the acting, so naturally, I looked into their first work Downfall, when I heard about it. And needless to say, I was enthralled when I heard they were doing a remake. 
While some of the content may be different, the story still flows together, it's a dark, gritty tale that'll leave you on the edge of your seat and wanting more. The voice acting is great, the art style is great, I loved it. 
I'd highly recommend this to those fans of psychological horror, and especially to fans of their previous work.

21243327.review:
I'm three hours in, haven't completed it yet, but for my first horror game it is rather tame and pleasant, while still giving off an incredibly haunting atmosphere. The voices in the prologue/tutorial could have used a bit of work, but from watching on their Facebook page, it seemed like a last minute addition to add some kid voice actors into the game, as well as that scene. 

The art style, you can easily tell its always in black and white with a splash of color, yet my mind seemed to add color without me even realizing such. Quite haunting and easy to recommend. Easy to learn controls, and the story, from the very beginning, makes you keep wanting to know more, while adding in more questions as it goes.

It is a bit hard to connect with Joe, seeing as a lot of his dialogue options are rather pushy, and I found myself selecting them all before being forced to choose the one I wasn't pleased with. But the way everyone sounds in the game, I've made him seem rather unsurprised about his situations.

Was really hoping for 5iah to be on the soundtrack but, either I'm blind and cannot find the song, or it's simply not there for copyright reasons. Overall, a rather enjoyable game and a remake, and rather nifty that it comes with the original 2009 game as well.

The Dead Celebrities achievement had me grinning like a loon though =3

А оказывается просто "мультик", анимационный фильм, выполненный в той самой стилистике, что нарисованна игра, и та самая история  Ну геймплейной части там самый минимум, это вам не outlast))) А тем не менее это игра!!!! и при чем очень хорошая!!! И рекомендую её к приобретению каждому как минимум любителю хорроров, и квестов))) А кто ищет хорошего сюжета - это по тому же адресу)

p.s. - Что я подразумеваю под играми "Шедеврами"? - Это игры без косяков, ну где реально придраться не к чему))) Вот под эту категорию попадают игры от "Harvester Games" Ну и такие как "Limbo" и "Inside"

39471372.review:
Downfall — это театр абсурда, выставка спорных и зачастую неуместных решений с проблесками отличных идей и местами хорошей историей. Горькое послевкусие с нотками разочарования и обиды за загубленный потенциал. Получил ли я удовольствие от игры? Определенно, да. Нужен ли был этот ремейк? Скорее всего, нет.

Полный текст обзора читайте здесь: http://roclobsta.ru/2018/01/20/downfall/

39573827.review:
[h1] Did the Cat Lady bring you here? [/h1]

Downfall is not another point-and-click adventure game. Downfall does not need Eldritch horrors or contagion, nor does it need a btchin' graphics card. Dread, history, love, resentment, and pain make the dialogue engrossing, the pitfalls more upsetting. This married couple's despondent, claustrophobic vacation is a a roaring romp through your own guiltiest, grimy wrongs done to people who have loved you. The things you've said, taken, and simply left.

[i] They have led you here. You are not done yet. Through this door, please.	[/i]
